title: Chicken Hariyali Tikka Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs 35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely chopped fresh mint leaves'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ginger garlic paste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'lemon juice'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'green chile paste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into chunks'}]
directions: ['In a large bowl, grind together the cilantro, mint leaves, ginger garlic paste, lemon juice, green chile paste, and salt. Place the chicken in the bowl, and rub with the mixture. Cover, and refrigerate 2 to 3 hours.', 'Preheat the oven broiler. Lightly grease a baking dish.', 'Place the chicken in the baking dish, and broil 20 minutes, or until chicken juices run clear.']

title: Kulfi Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '8 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '8 hrs 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '24'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 Â¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'evaporated milk'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'sweetened condensed milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) container', 'Name': 'frozen whipped topping, thawed'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'white bread, torn into pieces'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}]
directions: ['Combine evaporated milk, condensed milk, and whipped topping in a blender and blend in pieces of bread until smooth.', 'Pour mixture into a 9x13-inch baking dish or two plastic ice cube trays, sprinkle with cardamom and freeze for 8 hours or overnight.']

title: Easy Naan Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '12 naan breads'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'warm water'}, {'Quantity': '2 Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'active dry yeast'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'sugar, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'egg, beaten'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'salt, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '5 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'bread flour, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'butter, melted'}]
directions: ['Combine water, yeast, and sugar in a large bowl. Let stand until bubbly and frothy, about 10 minutes.', 'Stir in milk, egg, salt, and enough flour to make a soft dough. Knead dough on a lightly floured surface until smooth, 6 to 8 minutes. Place dough into a well oiled bowl, cover with a damp cloth, and set aside to rise until the dough has doubled in volume, about 1 hour.', 'Punch down dough and knead well. For garlic naan, knead in garlic at this point.', 'Pinch off small handfuls of dough about the size of golf balls. Roll into balls, cover with a clean cloth, and allow to rise until doubled in size, about 30 minutes.', "Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.", 'Roll out 2 balls of dough into elongated ovals. Place on an ungreased baking sheet and cook under the broiler until lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Brush butter on both sides and flip. Continue broiling until the second side is firm and golden, 2 minutes more. Repeat with remaining dough.']

title: Kurkuri Bhindi (Crispy Okra) in the Air Fryer Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '2'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'frozen cut okra, thawed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'gram flour (besan)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'red chili powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chaat masala'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'amchoor (dried mango powder) (Optional)'}]
directions: ['Place thawed okra in a bowl. Preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 5 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in gram flour, salt, chili powder, coriander, chaat masala, cumin, and amchoor; cook and stir until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and add to okra; mix until okra is fully coated. Transfer okra to the air fryer basket.', 'Cook in the preheated air fryer for 5 minutes. Flip okra and continue to cook, flipping in 5-minute intervals, until cooked through and crispy, 5 to 10 more minutes.']

title: Ras Malai Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '12 dumplings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) container', 'Name': 'whole-milk ricotta cheese'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'half and half'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'rose water (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'saffron'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'chopped blanched almonds'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'chopped pistachio nuts'}]
directions: ['Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Blend the ricotta cheese and 1/4 cup sugar together in a bowl with a hand mixer; divide the mixture between 12 muffin cups.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 35 to 40 minutes. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack. Arrange the cheese balls onto a dessert platter.', 'While the cheese bakes, pour the half and half into a saucepan and bring to a simmer over low heat; simmer 10 minutes. Stir 1 cup sugar, the cardamom, rose water, and saffron into the half and half and simmer another 2 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool completely. Drizzle the cooled mixture over the cheese balls. Sprinkle the almonds and pistachios over the cheese balls to serve.']

title: Besan (Gram Flour) Halwa Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'ghee (clarified butter)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chickpea flour (besan)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sugar'}]
directions: ['Bring the milk and water to a simmer in a saucepan over medium-low heat; stir the cardamom into the mixture. Set aside.', 'Melt the ghee in a shallow skillet over medium heat; stir the chickpea flour into the melted ghee and cook until fragrant, about 10 minutes. Add the sugar and stir to incorporate. Slowly pour the milk mixture into the skillet while stirring to avoid lumps. Continue cooking and stirring until the halwa pulls away from the sides of the pan, 10 to 15 minutes. Serve hot or spread the mixture into a rimmed plate and allow to cool. Cut into squares and serve.']

title: Easy Paneer Tikka Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '7 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 42 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'plain yogurt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ginger-garlic paste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'lemon juice'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground red chile pepper'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garam masala'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt to taste'}]
directions: ['Line a fine-mesh strainer with muslin or cheesecloth and set inside a small bowl. Pour in yogurt; let drain for 15 minutes. Discard liquid.', 'Mix drained yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, turmeric, chile powder, cumin, garam masala, and salt together in bowl. Add paneer, onion, and green bell pepper and mix well. Marinade for 1 hour.', 'Preheat grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.', 'Skewer marinated paneer, onion, and bell pepper onto metal skewers. Grill until vegetables are soft and cheese is browned, 6 to 8 minutes. Brush with vegetable oil and grill for 1 minute more.', 'Mix onion rings with green chutney and serve with skewers.']

title: Indian Chole Aloo Tikki Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'potatoes'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '3 Â½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground ginger'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'black peppercorns'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'whole cloves'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'small dried chile peppers (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cumin seeds'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bay leaves'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, grated'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(1/2 inch) piece', 'Name': 'fresh ginger, grated'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'curry powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'tomato paste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'tomato, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'Name': 'garbanzo beans, drained'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'cilantro leaves'}]
directions: ['Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and peel.', 'Place cooked potatoes into a bowl and add cornstarch, ginger, cumin, cayenne, cilantro, salt, and pepper. Mash together with a fork. Oil your hands with a little vegetable oil and divide the potato mixture into 4 equal portions. Pat each portion into a potato patty about 1/3-inch thick.', 'Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Fry potato cakes until golden, about 3 minutes on each side. Remove from heat and keep warm.', 'Grind peppercorns and cloves with a mortar and pestle.', 'Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in red chile peppers, cumin, bay leaves. Add onion, ginger, and garlic. Cook and stir until onion is golden, about 5 minutes. Add pepper-clove mixture, curry powder, and turmeric.', 'Mix tomato paste with water. Stir diluted tomato paste and tomato into the skillet. Cook over medium heat until the tomato has softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in chickpeas and simmer over low heat for 10 minutes.', 'Spoon chickpea sauce over the potato cakes and sprinkle with cilantro leaves.']

title: Besan Laddu Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '24'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '2 dozen'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chickpea flour (besan)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'clarified butter (ghee)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'finely chopped pistachio nuts'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'finely chopped cashews'}]
directions: ['Stir the chickpea flour and clarified butter together in a saucepan over medium-low heat until the mixture smells toasty, about 10 minutes. Set aside until cool enough to handle.', "Stir in the sugar, pistachios, and cashews until evenly mixed. Form the mixture into small balls the size of large cherries. Use some pressure when forming the balls so they don't come apart."]

title: Aloo Paratha
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 parathas'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'potatoes, peeled and cubed'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil, divided, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cumin seeds'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green chile peppers, minced'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'fresh curry leaves'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'minced fresh ginger'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'ground turmeric, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt to taste'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'whole wheat flour, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}]
directions: ['Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer. Bring water to a boil. Add potatoes, cover, and steam until tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from the heat.', 'Heat 1 1/2 teaspoons vegetable oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and cook until light brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Add chile peppers, curry leaves, and ginger; cook and stir for about 1 minute. Add potatoes, turmeric, and salt; cook and stir carefully for about 5 minutes.', 'Transfer potatoes to a bowl and allow to cool, about 15 minutes.', 'Place 1/2 cup flour into a shallow bowl. Combine the remaining flour and 1 1/2 teaspoons oil in a large mixing bowl; salt to taste. Mix with your hands while gradually adding water. Knead dough until a smooth ball forms. Divide into 6 evenly round balls.', 'Roll each dough ball into a thick, circular shape. Form the cooled potato mixture into 6 round balls and place a potato ball on top of each dough circle. Fold all the dough sides over the potato filling to cover. Flatten each stuffed dough slightly while dipping both sides into the bowl of flour.', 'Roll each dough to a thin, circular shape and set a few inches apart on parchment paper.', 'Set a large skillet over medium heat and lightly spread with remaining oil. Place a stuffed paratha on the hot skillet and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Flip over and cook the other side for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove to a serving plate and continue this same process for all the parathas. Serve hot.']

title: Gulab Jamun or Kala Jam (Waffle Balls) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '17 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 17 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '12 gulab'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'drops', 'Name': 'rose water (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'saffron (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'instant dry milk powder (such as CarnationÂ®)'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking soda'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': "unsalted butter (such as Land O'LakesÂ®)"}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'plain yogurt'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'vegetable oil for frying'}]
directions: ['Combine water, sugar, cardamom, rose water, and saffron in a saucepan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until consistency is syrupy, 5 to 10 minutes.', 'Mix milk powder, flour, and baking soda in a bowl until well-combined. Slowly mix in butter and yogurt until dough comes together. Let gulab dough rest for 5 minutes. Shape into smooth balls the size of pennies.', 'Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Test the temperature of the oil by dropping in a small piece of dough. When it sits at the bottom of the pan for 1 minute before coming to the surface, the oil is ready.', 'Fry 4 gulab balls at a time, stirring carefully, until dark golden brown on all sides, about 2 minutes. Drain on a paper-towel lined plate. Repeat with remaining gulab.', 'Bring syrup back up to a boil and drop in fried gulab. Remove from heat and let them soak in the syrup, covered, 45 minutes to 1 hour.']

title: Reshmi Kebab (Silken Kebabs) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 day'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 day 1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'almonds'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'jalapeno peppers, seeded and chopped'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'inch piece', 'Name': 'fresh ginger root, peeled'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lemon, juiced'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'heavy cream'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into 1 1/2 inch pieces'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter'}]
directions: ['Place almonds in a small bowl and cover with water. Allow to soak for 15 to 20 minutes; drain. Place almonds, peppers, garlic, ginger, and cilantro into the bowl of a food processor; blend until smooth. Season with salt, and blend in lemon juice. Blend in cream.', 'Transfer mixture to a large, non metallic bowl. Place chicken in bowl, and turn to coat. Cover, and marinate in refrigerator for 24 hours.', 'Preheat grill for high heat, and lightly oil grate. Remove meat from marinade, and thread onto skewers.', 'Brush meat with butter, and arrange skewers on hot grate. Slowly cook the chicken until cooked through.']

title: Carrot Halwa Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '12 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'ghee (clarified butter)'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'grated carrots'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'raisins'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}]
directions: ['Melt ghee in a saucepan over medium heat. Add carrots; cook and stir until soft, about 5 minutes. Add milk and bring to a boil. Cook and stir until thickened, about 10 minutes. Reduce heat to medium.', 'Combine water and sugar in a bowl; stir to dissolve. Add to the saucepan with the carrots. Stir in raisins and cardamom. Cook and stir until raisins are plumped and mixture is thickened, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat.']

title: Pav Bhaji (Indian Curry) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'oil, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'onion, grated'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, grated'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water, or more as needed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'pav bhaji masala, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'Name': 'diced tomatoes'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'potatoes, peeled and cut into small cubes'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'canned sweet corn, drained'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'mild chile powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'ground ginger'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'lemon juice'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'unsalted butter, or more to taste'}]
directions: ['Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and 1/4 teaspoon salt; fry until browned, 5 to 8 minutes. Add garlic; cook and stir for 4 minutes. Pour in 1 cup water. Add 1 teaspoon pav bhaji masala and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until flavors combine, about 10 minutes.', 'Add tomatoes, potatoes, and corn to the saucepan. Season with chile powder, coriander, and ginger. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Mash curry gently with the back of a wooden spoon or spatula. Simmer for 10 minutes more. Taste and adjust salt. Add 1/2 teaspoon pav bhaji masala and lemon juice. Mash slightly again.', 'Add 1/4 to 1/2 cup water to give curry a runny consistency. Add remaining 1 tablespoon oil and butter; stir until butter is melted. Divide into serving bowls and sprinkle remaining pav bhaji masala on top.']

title: Rasgullas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '20'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '20 rasgullas'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'Quantity': '2 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}]
directions: ['Bring the milk to a boil in a heavy-bottomed pan till it starts foaming; immediately add the lime juice and stir. It will curdle right away. You should see the milk solids (chenna) separate from the whey. Pour into a colander lined with cheesecloth; rinse the chenna with cold water to get rid of the lime juice. Allow the water to drain completely.', 'Gather the muslin cloth edges like a parcel and express as much water as possible; what you now have is soft paneer. Turn the paneer onto a rolling mat or other smooth surface. Knead the paneer well to make a smooth paste. Roll into a ball and divide into 20 equal portions.', 'Bring the water to a boil in a pressure cooker; stir the sugar into the boiling water until dissolved.', 'Roll each portion of paneer into a smooth ball between your palms, making sure there are no cracks; gently drop the balls into the hot syrup. Secure the lid onto the pressure cooker and bring to pressure. Reduce heat to medium-low and pressure cook for 6 minutes.', 'Release the pressure from the cooker while running under water; remove the lid. The rasgullas should be floating on the syrup and have expanded 2 or 3 times in size. Pour the rasgullas and syrup into a bowl. Gently stir the cardamom into the mixture. Refrigerate to chill completely before serving cold.']

title: Rava Laddu Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '16'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '16 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'semolina flour'}, {'Quantity': '7', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'ghee (clarified butter)'}, {'Quantity': 'â…“', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cashew nuts'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'hot milk'}]
directions: ['Heat a large dry skillet over medium to medium-high heat. Add the semolina, and toast, stirring constantly. Stir in the sugar and cardamom while toasting until light brown and fragrant, about 10 minutes.', 'Heat a small amount of the ghee in a separate skillet over medium heat. Add the cashews, and cook until lightly toasted, about 10 minutes. Add the cashews to the semolina along with the remaining ghee. Gradually stir hot milk into the semolina until it is thick enough to pack into a ball. Remove from heat, and form palm-sized balls. Let cool and serve.']

title: Egg Halwa Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'pods', 'Name': 'green cardamom'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs, beaten'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'shortening'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'semolina'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'dry milk powder'}]
directions: ['Crush the cardamom pods with the side of a knife. Combine the cardamom, milk, egg, sugar, shortening, semolina, and dry milk powder in a heavy bottom saucepan. Whisk well to combine, then cook on low heat, stirring occasionally until the eggs thicken. Continue cooking, stirring constantly, until the mixture browns, and the shortening begins to separate, about an hour. Remove cardamom pods and serve hot.']

title: Makhani Daal (Buttery Lentils) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '6 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '6 hrs 50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'black lentils (kaali daal)'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'split chickpeas (channa daal)'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'red kidney beans (rajma)'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(2 inch) piece', 'Name': 'ginger, minced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cumin seeds'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'tomatoes, finely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garam masala'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'red chile powder'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'yogurt'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'sprigs', 'Name': 'cilantro leaves'}]
directions: ['Place black lentils, chickpeas, and red kidney beans in a large container and cover with several inches of cool water; let soak, 6 hours to overnight.', "Pour lentil mixture and soaking liquid into a pressure cooker. Bring to high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions and cook until soft, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and release pressure through natural release method according to manufacturer's instructions.", 'Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, ginger, garlic, and cumin seeds; cook and stir until golden brown, about 3 minutes. Add tomatoes; cook and stir until softened, about 2 minutes. Stir in ground coriander, garam masala, red chile powder, turmeric, and salt.', 'Fold onion mixture into cooked lentil mixture. Add butter, yogurt, and cilantro leaves; stir to incorporate.']

title: Paneer Jalfrazie Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'paneer, cut into cubes'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onions, roughly chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green bell peppers, cut into strips'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'minced fresh ginger root'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'minced garlic'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garam masala'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground fennel seed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'tomatoes, pureed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ketchup'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt to taste'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}]
directions: ['Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Fry the paneer in the hot oil until golden brown, 7 to 10 minutes. Remove the paneer to a plate lined with paper towels, reserving the oil in the skillet.', 'Add 1 tablespoon oil to the skillet. Fry the onions, bell peppers, ginger, and garlic in the hot oil until the onions are browned, about 5 minutes. Season with the garam masala, turmeric, and fennel; cook and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Stir the tomatoes, ketchup, and salt into the mixture; continue cooking until the tomatoes are tender and the oil separates from the gravy. Pour the water into the skillet and stir. Return the paneer to the skillet; raise heat to high and cook until the gravy is thick, about 10 minutes. Garnish with cilantro to serve.']

title: Atta (Whole Wheat) Halwa Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'ghee (clarified butter)'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cashews'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'raisins'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'whole wheat flour'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}]
directions: ['Melt the ghee in a heavy-bottomed skillet over medium heat; cook the cashews and raisins in the melted ghee until the raisins plump and the cashews are lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Remove the cashews and raisins from the pan with a slotted spoon and set aside. Add the flour to the pan and roast till brown and nutty, about 10 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, bring the water and sugar to a boil in a saucepan until the sugar dissolves to make a clear syrup. Stir the cardamom into the syrup; slowly pour over the roasted flour, stirring as you pour to avoid lumps. Continue cooking until the halwa pulls away from the sides of the pan, about 5 minutes more. Transfer to a serving dish and spread into an even layer; sprinkle the cashews and raisins over the halwa to serve.']

title: Paalu Mithai (Milk Sweet) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'ghee (clarified butter)'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cashews'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'whole milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'semolina flour'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}]
directions: ['Heat the ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan over medium heat; fry the cashews in the ghee until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Scrape onto a cutting board to cool, leaving some of the ghee in the pan and return the pan to the stove. When the cashews are cool, chop coarsely.', 'Mix the milk, sugar, and semolina flour into the ghee remaining in the pan. Bring the mixture to a boil; reduce heat to low and cook, stirring frequently, until the mixture becomes very thick, 30 to 45 minutes. Stir the cardamom into the mixture.', 'Lightly grease a rimmed platter. Pour the milk mixture onto the prepared platter and spread into an even layer. Sprinkle the chopped cashews over the mixture. Score the mithai into squares and allow to cool completely before cutting.']

title: Spicy Potato Noodles (Bataka Sev) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '10 cups'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped fresh green chile peppers'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'coarsely chopped garlic'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'fresh ginger, peeled and coarsely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': 'â…›', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}]
directions: ['Combine the chiles, garlic, ginger, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon turmeric, and 2 teaspoons vegetable oil in a food processor or mortar and pestle and process into a fine paste. (Add a tablespoon of water if you need more liquid.) Set aside.', "Place the potatoes in a saucepan with the water and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and cook the potatoes until they're soft and easily pierced with a fork, about 15 minutes. Reserve the cooking water.", "Mash the potatoes while they're still warm, using some of the cooking water to get a smooth consistency. Mix in 1 tablespoon green chile paste, chickpea flour, 2 1/2 teaspoons salt, 1 teaspoon turmeric, and mustard oil. Add enough reserved potato-cooking water as needed to make a soft dough. Taste the dough for heat level and seasoning (the dough will taste raw, but should be salty and spicy; the flavors will mellow slightly during cooking). Add more salt and chile paste if desired.", 'Heat the cooking oil in a deep pan over medium-high heat. Use a potato ricer (or sev machine, if you have one) to press noodles into the oil. Fry until golden brown and crisp, about two minutes. Use a skimmer or slotted spoon to transfer the noodles to a paper towel-lined bowl. Repeat until all noodles are fried. Store in an airtight container for up to two weeks.']

title: Sambusa Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '24'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '2 dozen sambusas'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'leek, washed and chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'clove', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'ground beef'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'water, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(14 ounce) package', 'Name': 'spring roll wrappers'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'quart', 'Name': 'oil for frying, or as needed'}]
directions: ['Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Add onion, leek, and garlic; cook and stir until onion is transparent. Add ground beef; cook and stir until still slightly pink and about halfway done. Season with cumin, cardamom, salt, and pepper; mix well. Continue cooking until beef is browned and crumbly. Remove the skillet from heat.', 'Mix flour and water together in a small bowl to make a thin paste. Using one wrapper at a time, fold into the shape of a cone. Fill cone with beef mixture, close the top, and seal with paste. Repeat until wrappers or filling are used up.', 'Heat oil in a deep fryer or large saucepan to 365 degrees F (170 degrees C). There should be enough oil to submerge sambusas. Fry sambusas, a few at a time, in hot oil until golden brown. Remove to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.']

title: Easy Baked Indian Samosas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '16'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '32 samosas'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'potatoes, peeled and cubed'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'onions, finely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'coriander seed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'curry powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(1 inch) piece', 'Name': 'fresh ginger, grated'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground allspice'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': 'â…›', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'Roma (plum) tomatoes, finely chopped'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'frozen peas'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(14.1 ounce) packages', 'Name': 'double-crust pie crusts, thawed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'egg whites, beaten, or as needed'}]
directions: ['Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and transfer potatoes to a large bowl; mash coarsely, then set aside.', 'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).', 'Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat; cook and stir onions, coriander seed, curry powder, ginger, salt, turmeric, cumin, allspice, cayenne pepper, and cinnamon in hot oil until onion is lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Remove the skillet from heat and stir in tomatoes and peas. Pour into coarsely mashed potatoes and mix until thoroughly combined. Cool filling completely.', 'Cut each pie crust into 8 equal triangles. Spoon filling onto the wide end of each triangle; fold corners over filling to create a triangle-shaped hat. Pinch dough together to form a seal. Brush beaten egg whites over each samosa and arrange on baking sheets.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until samosas are golden brown, about 15 minutes.']

title: Indian Samosa Pie Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 9-inch pie'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'whole-wheat pastry flour'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'ice-cold water, or more as needed'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).', 'Whisk all-purpose flour, pastry flour, and salt together in a bowl. Drizzle 2 tablespoons vegetable oil into flour mixture while stirring until clumps form. Stir cold water, 1 tablespoon at a time, into the dough until it holds together; shape into a ball, cover with a damp towel, and set aside.', 'Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes; drain. Transfer drained potatoes to a large bowl and mash until only small chunks remain.', 'Stir mustard seeds, curry powder, ground ginger, cumin, and red pepper flakes together in a bowl.', 'Heat 1 1/2 teaspoons vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir onion, carrot, and garlic in hot oil until carrot is tender, about 5 minutes.', 'Move onion mixture to one side of the skillet. Pour seasoning mixture into the skillet and cook until spices are toasted and fragrant, about 30 seconds. Stir onion mixture and spice mixture together; add vegetable broth and peas to the skillet and stir.', 'Fold carrot mixture into mashed potatoes; add sugar, stir, and season with salt and pepper. Spread the filling into a 9-inch pie plate.', "Turn dough out onto a lightly floured work surface; roll out into an 11-inch circle. Place dough atop pie filling, pressing down on dough in several spots to remove any pockets of air. Trim excess dough from edges. Crimp edges of dough with your fingers. Cut a large 'X' in the center of dough to vent steam. Brush milk over dough.", 'Bake in the preheated oven until crust is golden brown, 40 to 50 minutes. Cool pie 5 minutes before serving.']

title: Traditional Beef Samosas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '24'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '24 samosas'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'lean ground beef'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'garlic cloves, crushed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chile powder, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground ginger'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garam masala'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(6 ounce) package', 'Name': 'frozen peas'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'minced pickled jalapeno pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'lemon juice'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'Name': 'wonton wrappers'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'vegetable oil for frying'}]
directions: ['Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add ground beef, onion, and garlic; cook until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Reduce heat to low.', 'Mix in coriander, cumin, salt, turmeric, chile powder, and ginger. Add peas and water; bring to boil. Cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, about 25 minutes. Uncover and cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until any remaining liquid evaporates.', 'Stir jalapenos and garam masala into the beef mixture. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice; let cool until safe to handle, at least 15 minutes.', 'Drop about 1 tablespoon of the beef mixture onto the center of a wonton wrapper. Moisten edges with water, fold them over the filling, and seal. Repeat with remaining filling and wonton wrappers.', 'Heat about 1/2 inch oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add samosas in batches; fry until browned, 1 to 2 inches per side.']

title: Sambousa Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'lean ground beef'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'carrot, minced'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green chile pepper, diced (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'clove', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'tomato paste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'seasoning salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'Name': 'egg roll wrappers, cut in half into rectangles'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}]
directions: ['Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly. Remove beef from the skillet.', 'SautÃ© carrot, onion, green onion, chile pepper, and garlic in the same skillet over medium heat until tender. Stir in tomato paste and season with seasoning salt. Stir in browned beef until well combined.', "Stir together flour and water in a small bowl until a watery paste is formed. Lay an egg roll strip on a clean work surface. Place a teaspoonful of meat mixture in the front part of strip. Starting from the right front corner, fold over to the left. You've started the triangle shape. Continue back and forth (making a triangular shape) until there is no more wrapper. Seal wrapper closed with paste. Continue this process until all of the strips and meat mixture are used.", 'Heat oil in a large pot over high heat. Fry egg rolls in hot oil until crisp and golden. Drain on a paper towel-lined plate.']

title: Veggie Samosas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '16'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '16 samosas'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'diced onion'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'chopped garlic'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'curry powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground ginger'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'sea salt'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'celery seed'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'dried tarragon'}, {'Quantity': 'â…›', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'diced potatoes'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'frozen mixed vegetables, diced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'vegetable broth'}]
directions: ['Heat oil in a saute pan over medium heat. Add onion; cook for 1 minute. Add garlic, curry, ginger, cumin, salt, red pepper flakes, coriander, cayenne pepper, celery seed, tarragon, and cinnamon. Cook until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes more. Add potatoes and mixed vegetables. Cook, stirring constantly, for 3 minutes.', 'Pour broth into the potato mixture. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cook, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are tender and broth is mostly absorbed, 12 to 15 minutes.', 'Place flour in a medium bowl. Make a well in the center; add salt, oil, and water, in that order. Mix into a stiff dough, roll into a ball, and wrap in plastic wrap. Set aside for 30 minutes.', 'Divide dough into 8 balls. Roll each ball into a 10-inch circle. Cut each circle in half, moisten the edges, and shape each half into a cone around your finger. Fill dough with 1 to 2 tablespoons of the vegetable mixture. Pinch edges shut.', 'Heat oil in a large saucepan or deep-fryer. Deep-fry samosas in batches until lightly browned, 2 to 3 minutes. Serve hot.']

title: Vegetable Curry Samosas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '16'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '16 samosas'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, diced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'curry powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'mustard seeds'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'cumin seeds'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'vegetable broth'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'potatoes, cut into small cubes'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'carrot, cut into small cubes'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'frozen peas'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(17.5 ounce) package', 'Name': 'frozen puff pastry, thawed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'egg, lightly beaten'}]
directions: ['Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add onion, curry powder, mustard seeds, and cumin seeds; cook for 3 minutes. Add broth and potatoes; cook until tender, 3 to 5 minutes. Add carrot and peas, cook 2 minutes more. Remove from heat and allow filling to cool.', 'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Lightly grease a baking sheet.', 'Roll puff pastry out on a work surface and cut into 16 thin rounds. Place 2 to 3 tablespoons of filling on each round. Cover edges of pastry with beaten egg and press edges together using a fork to close. Place samosas on the prepared baking sheet.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until pastry is puffed and golden brown, 12 to 15 minutes.', 'While samosas are baking, combine mayonnaise, sour cream, sugar, lemon juice, horseradish, curry powder, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Cover and refrigerate sauce until needed. Serve with samosas.']

title: Mini Sweet Potato Samosas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '20 samosas'}]

directions: ['Simmer sweet potatoes with a little water until very soft. Drain, and mash with butter, milk, onion soup mix, and curry powder.', 'Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).', 'Place about 1 teaspoon of the sweet potato mixture into the center of each wonton wrapper. title: Beef Samosas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '18'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '18 samosas'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'potatoes, peeled'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'frozen peas, thawed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cumin seeds'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bay leaf, crushed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'ground beef'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'onions, finely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'minced fresh ginger root'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'quart', 'Name': 'oil for deep frying'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chopped green chile peppers'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'Name': 'phyllo dough'}]
directions: ['Bring a medium saucepan of lightly salted water to a boil. Stir in potatoes and peas; cook until potatoes are tender but still firm, about 15 minutes. Drain, mash together, and set aside.', 'Meanwhile, heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add cumin seeds and bay leaf; stir until fragrant and seeds are browned. Add ground beef and onions; cook until beef is browned and crumbly and onions are soft, about 5 to 7 minutes.', 'Stir in garlic and ginger. Season with salt, cumin, coriander, turmeric, chili powder, cinnamon, cardamom, and black pepper. Stir in the mashed potato mixture. Remove from heat and chill in the refrigerator for 1 hour, or until cool.', 'Heat 1 quart of oil in a deep saucepan over medium heat.', 'Mix cilantro and green chile peppers into potato and beef mixture. Place approximately 1 tablespoon of the mixture onto each phyllo sheet. Fold sheets into triangles, pressing edges together with moistened fingers.', 'Lower samosas carefully into the hot oil in batches. Fry until golden brown, about 3 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Repeat with remaining samosas. Serve warm.']

title: Super Easy Samosa Pie Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': 'â…“', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'Yukon Gold potatoes, cut in half'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'frozen peas'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) package', 'Name': 'pastry for double crust 9-inch pies, thawed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'chopped fresh mint, or to taste'}]
directions: ['Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).', 'Fill a pot with water and add the salt; bring to a boil. Cook potatoes in the boiling water until tender, about 12 minutes. title: Air Fryer Samosas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '12 samosas'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '12', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'yukon gold potatoes,'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'onion'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'fresh ginger'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garam masala'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/8', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper (optional)'}, {'Quantity': '2/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'frozen peas, thawed'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'fresh cilantro, plus more for garnish'}, {'Quantity': '24', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'wonton wrappers'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cooking spray'}]
directions: ['Add potatoes to a small saucepan and cover with salted water; bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes or until fork-tender. Drain and transfer potatoes to a bowl; mash until mostly smooth with a few small chunks remaining.', 'In the same saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in ginger and garlic; cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add garam masala, cumin, salt, and (if using) cayenne; cook about 30 seconds more. Stir in mashed potatoes and peas; cook until warmed through. Remove from heat; stir in cilantro.', 'Arrange wonton wrappers on a clean work surface; evenly spoon filling into centers of wontonwrappers. Lightly wet borders of wrappers withwater. Fold two corners together to form triangles. Press edges to seal. Coat both sides of samosas with cooking spray.', 'Preheat air fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat air fryer basket with cooking spray.', 'Working in batches if needed, arrange samosas in an even layer in the basket. Cook, turning once halfway through, until samosas are golden brown and crispy, about 8 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, combine yogurt, cilantro, lime zest, lime juice; garlic, salt and pepper in a small food processor; process until well combined. Chill, covered, up to 5 days.', 'Serve samosas with cilantro-yogurt sauce. Garnish with additional cilantro.']

title: Indian Spiced Onions Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 day'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 day 5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ketchup'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'lemon juice'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chopped fresh fenugreek leaves'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'salt'}]

title: Roti Bread from India Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '12 roti breads'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'durum wheat flour'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}]
directions: ['Stir flour, water, oil, and salt together in a medium bowl until well combined and pulling away from the sides. Turn dough out onto a well-floured surface and knead until smooth and pliable, about 10 minutes.', 'Divide dough into 12 equal pieces. Form each piece into a round. Working with one round at a time while all others are covered with a damp cloth, flatten with the palm of your hand, then use a rolling pin to roll into 6- to 8-inch diameter circle.', 'Heat a dry skillet or tava over medium-high heat. Cook one roti at a time in the hot skillet until golden with some darker brown spots, about 1 minute per side, As it cooks, roll the next roti. Serve warm.']

title: Air Fryer Onion Bhaji Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'red onion, thinly sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'yellow onion, thinly sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'clove', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'coriander'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cumin'}, {'Quantity': 'â…”', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chickpea flour (besan)'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'water, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cooking spray'}]
directions: ['Mix red onion, yellow onion, salt, jalapeno, garlic, coriander, chili powder, turmeric, and cumin in a large bowl. Stir until evenly combined. Add chickpea flour and water. Stir to combine into a thick batter. Add more water if necessary. Let mixture rest for 10 minutes.', 'Preheat air fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Spray the air fryer basket with nonstick cooking spray. Spoon 2 tablespoons of batter into the basket and flatten. Repeat as many times as your basket allows without the bhajis touching.', 'Cook in the preheated air fryer for 6 minutes. Mist the tops of each bhaji with cooking spray. Flip and cook 6 additional minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate. Repeat with remaining batter.']

title: Indian Masala Chicken Wings Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '4 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '4 hrs 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '10 chicken wings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'hot chile powder'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cloves'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt, or more as needed'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'chicken wings, cut in 2, tips discarded'}]
directions: ['Combine coriander, cumin, cardamom, chile powder, pepper, and cloves in a dry pan over low heat. Stir until fragrant. Remove from heat, add oil and water, and stir until combined. Set spice paste aside.', 'Rub salt over wings in a shallow dish, then rub spice paste all over. title: Potato Cutlets Recipe

title: Indian-Spiced Roasted Chickpeas Recipe

title: Curry Dip Recipe

title: Parathas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '4 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '49 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'whole wheat flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'melted butter'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garlic powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'dried mixed herbs'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'oil for frying'}]
directions: ['Mix all-purpose flour and whole wheat flour in a bowl. Sprinkle salt on top. Add butter, sugar, garlic powder, and dried herbs. Mix together with your fingers. Pour water in gradually; continue to mix by hand until a soft dough is formed.', 'Knead dough until smooth and elastic, about 7 minutes. Cover with a damp cloth; let rest for 30 minutes.', 'Divide dough into 8 equal portions. Shape into smooth balls; lightly flatten. Dust with flour and roll into thin circles about 1/16-inch thick and 7 inches in diameter.', 'Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Fry each dough circle until golden, about 2 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels.']

title: Indian Chaat-Inspired Potato Chip Salad Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]

directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Combine yogurt, lime juice, tamarind paste, garam masala, cumin, hot sauce, and sugar in a bowl with a whisk until combined. Taste and adjust as needed; mix in water as needed to reach desired consistency.', 'Layer chips, jalapeno, bell pepper, red and green onions, potatoes, mint, cilantro, and yogurt sauce as desired for individual portions, or this can be served salad bar-style and everyone can make their own plate.', 'Squeeze lime juice from halves over top and enjoy!']

title: Sweet Curry Pumpkin Seeds Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '10 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'fresh pumpkin seeds, washed and dried'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'curry powder'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil, or as needed'}]
directions: ['Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).', 'Combine pumpkin seeds, brown sugar, cinnamon, and curry powder in a bowl. Add vegetable oil gradually, until lightly coated. Spread seeds evenly on a baking sheet.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Remove the sheet from the oven and flip the seeds. Continue baking, flipping seeds every 10 minutes, until crunchy and golden brown, 20 to 30 minutes.']

title: Tandoori-Inspired Oven Chicken Skewers Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '18 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 3 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 skewers'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(6 ounce) containers', 'Name': 'peach-mango yogurt'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'garam masala'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lemon, zested and juiced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(1 inch) piece', 'Name': 'fresh ginger, grated'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'curry powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '2 Â½', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'skinless, boneless chicken thighs'}]
directions: ['Combine yogurt, garam masala, lemon juice, lemon zest, grated ginger, and curry powder in a gallon-sized resealable plastic bag.', 'Slice each chicken thigh lengthwise into 3 or 4 slices, add to the bag with the marinade, and refrigerate for 30 to 60 minutes.', 'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) and move an oven rack to the center of the oven. Line a sheet pan with aluminum foil.', 'Thread chicken thigh pieces onto six 15-inch metal skewers and place crossways across the prepared sheet pan, resting the ends of the skewers on the raised edges of the pan.', 'Bake skewers in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Remove from oven.', "Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Broil chicken skewers for 3 minutes until meat is lightly charred, watching closely."]

title: Butter Chicken Tarts Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 tarts'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'dash', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'dash', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'dash', 'Name': 'garlic powder'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'butter, melted'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onions - chopped, green and white parts separated, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'diced cooked chicken breast'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'soy-based liquid seasoning (such as MaggiÂ®), or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'butter chicken cooking sauce'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease 6 cups of a muffin tin.', 'Stir sugar, salt, cumin, and garlic powder into the melted butter in a bowl. Add flour slowly, mixing until moist but not sticky; you should be able to manipulate it with your hands.', 'Separate tart dough into 6 sections; roll each into a ball and flatten into a round in your hand. Press into the prepared muffin cups.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, about 10 minutes.', 'While crusts are baking, heat oil over medium-high heat in a skillet. Saute onion and white sections of green onions in the hot oil until just starting to brown, 5 to 7 minutes. Add chicken, soy-based liquid seasoning, salt, and pepper; saute for 1 to 2 minutes. Add butter chicken sauce and cook until warmed through, 1 to 2 minutes.', 'Spoon butter chicken mixture into the baked tart shells.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Remove tarts from tin using a butter knife and tongs. Sprinkle green sections of green onions on top.']

title: Tikka Chicken Jalapeno Poppers Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '7'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '28 jalapeno poppers'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'plain yogurt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'garam masala'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'chicken masala powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ginger-garlic paste'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breast halves'}, {'Quantity': '14', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'jalapeno peppers'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(8 ounce) packages', 'Name': 'cream cheese (such as PhiladelphiaÂ®), softened'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(8 ounce) packages', 'Name': 'bacon'}]
directions: ['Combine yogurt, garam masala, chicken masala, coriander, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, turmeric, and salt in a bowl. Set aside.', 'Slice chicken breasts into small strips that will fit on halved jalapenos and place into the bowl with the tikka marinade. Mix well, cover, and let sit in the refrigerator at least 30 minutes; the longer your marinade, the more of a flavor profile on the chicken.', 'Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Place a cooling rack on top of a baking tray.', 'Snap off jalapeno stems by holding a pepper with one hand and pulling it off to the side. Repeat with remaining peppers. Slice all jalapenos in half lengthwise and remove all seeds and ribbing using a teaspoon, making sure not to remove white stem area.', 'Fill jalapeno halves with cream cheese using a teaspoon; place as much cheese as to your liking. Place a strip of tikka chicken on top of cream cheese and wrap each chicken popper halve with a slice of bacon. Place on the prepared baking sheet.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until bacon is browned and crisp, about 40 minutes.']

title: Cranberry Chutney Recipe

Let cool to room temperature before serving.']

title: Mint Chutney Recipe

ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'onion, cut into chunks'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'bunch', 'Name': 'fresh cilantro'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'fresh mint leaves'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green chile pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'tamarind juice or lemon juice'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water, or as needed'}]

title: Tomato Chutney II Recipe

title: Apple and Tomato Chutney Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '4 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '75'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 gallon'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'apples - peeled, cored and sliced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'mustard seed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'tomatoes, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'onions, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'clove', 'Name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sultana raisins'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'curry powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '2 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'malt vinegar'}]
directions: ['Place apples and water in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and cook 25 minutes, or until apples are tender, stirring occasionally. Add more water as necessary to keep the apples simmering.', 'Wrap mustard seed in cheesecloth, and place with apples. Mix tomatoes, onions, garlic, sultanas, sugar, curry powder, cayenne pepper, salt and vinegar into saucepan. Stir until sugar has dissolved.', 'Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat, and simmer 3 hours, stirring occassionally, until a thick chutney remains. Remove and discard wrapped mustard seed. Seal chutney in sterile containers until serving.']

title: Passion Fruit Fizz Martini Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '1'}]

title: Gingerbread Chai Oat Creamer Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Stand Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Steep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cool Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '16'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '2 cups'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water, divided'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'chai tea bags'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'molasses'}, {'Quantity': '3/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground ginger'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '1/8', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cloves'}, {'Quantity': '3/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'oats'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'coconut oil'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'pitted', 'Name': 'dates'}]
directions: ['Combine 2 cups water and tea bags in a saucepan; bring to a boil over high heat. Turn off heat and allow tea to steep 10 minutes.', 'Remove tea bags from the pan and stir in brown sugar, white sugar, molasses, ginger, cinnamon, and cloves.\xa0Return pan to high heat and bring to a boil.\xa0Simmer until reduced and thickened. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature.', 'Meanwhile, pour oats into a heat resistant bowl. Bring 2 cups water to a boil and pour over the oats to cover.\xa0Let stand 10 minutes.\xa0 Drain oats and rinse with cold water.', 'Combine oats, coconut oil, 1 1/2 cups cold water, and dates in a blender.\xa0Blend until smooth and creamy.\xa0Pour mixture through a fine sieve and discard solids.', 'Stir 1/2 cup (or more if desired) of cooled chai mixture into oat milk mixture and refrigerate until ready to use.']
