title: Cottage Cheese Blueberry Breakfast Cake Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Cool Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 loaf cake'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour plus 1 tablespoon for dusting'}, {'Quantity': '3/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'whole wheat flour'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'baking powder'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '3/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cottage cheese'}, {'Quantity': '3/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'honey'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'coconut oil, melted, or neutral oil of choice'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'lemon zest'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'lemon juice'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'fresh blueberries'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan. Line pan with parchment paper, leaving a 2-inch overhang.', 'Whisk Â¾ cup all-purpose flour, Â¾ cup whole wheat flour, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl.', 'Combine cottage cheese, honey, oil, lemon zest and juice, and vanilla in a blender container. Cover and blend until smooth.', 'Stir eggs into cottage cheese mixture.', 'Add cottage cheese mixture to flour mixture; stir to combine.', 'Toss blueberries with remaining 1 tablespoon of flour in a bowl. Fold blueberries into batter. Pour batter into the prepared pan.', 'Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 1 hour. Let cool in pan on a wire rack 10 minutes.', 'Remove from pan and cool completely on a wire rack before slicing and serving.']

title: Easy Parmesan Garlic Ramen Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '3'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '(3-ounce) packages', 'Name': 'instant ramen noodles'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic,'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'shredded Parmesan cheese'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'Italian seasoning'}]
directions: ['Bring 6 cups water to a boil in a large soup pot; add noodles and boil for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Drain, reserving 1 cup of cooking, water and set aside.', 'Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.', 'Stir in Parmesan cheese, Italian seasoning, and reserved cooking water. Cook until cheese is melted and sauce is thick, about 5 minutes.', 'Add noodles to the skillet, and toss gently until heated through . Top with parsley if desired, and serve immediately.']

title: Spargel in Schinken (White Asparagus Wrapped in Ham) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2 Â¼', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'white asparagus'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt to taste'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'butter, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '7', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'sliced ham'}]
directions: ['Peel asparagus spears from top to bottom with a vegetable peeler, starting below the tips. Cut off woody ends with a knife.', 'Place asparagus spears in a large, wide saucepan and pour in enough lightly salted water to just cover. Bring water to a boil; add 1 tablespoon butter and sugar. Reduce heat; simmer until spears are tender and easily pierced with a knife, 15 to 25 minutes. Drain well.', 'Melt remaining 3 tablespoons butter in a small pot over low heat.', 'Wrap each asparagus spear with a slice of ham. Arrange on a serving plate; drizzle melted butter on top.']

title: German Apple Cake Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '24'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 (9x13-inch) cake'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking soda'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'apples - peeled, cored and diced'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13-inch cake pan.', 'Beat oil and eggs in a mixing bowl with an electric mixer until creamy. Add sugar and vanilla; beat well.', 'Stir together flour, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt in a bowl. Slowly add flour mixture to egg mixture; mix until combined. The batter will be very thick. Fold in apples by hand using a wooden spoon. Spread batter into the prepared pan.', 'Bake cake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 45 minutes. Cool cake on a wire rack.']

title: Traditional Sauerbraten Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '4 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '2 days'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 days 4 hrs 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'beef rump roast'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'onions, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'red wine vinegar, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '10', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'whole cloves, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bay leaves, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '10', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'gingersnap cookies, crumbled'}]
directions: ['Place beef rump roast, onions, vinegar, water, 1 tablespoon salt, 1 tablespoon black pepper, sugar, cloves, and bay leaves in a large pot. Cover and refrigerate for 2 to 3 days, turning meat daily. Remove meat from marinade and pat dry with paper towels, reserving marinade.', 'Season flour to taste with salt and black pepper in a large bowl. Sprinkle flour mixture over beef.', 'Heat vegetable oil in a large Dutch oven or pot over medium heat; cook beef until brown on all sides, about 10 minutes.', 'Pour reserved marinade over beef, cover, and reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer until beef is tender, 3 1/2 to 4 hours.', 'Remove beef to a platter and slice.', 'Strain solids from remaining liquid and continue cooking over medium heat. Add gingersnap cookies and simmer until gravy is thickened, about 10 minutes. Serve gravy over sliced beef.']

title: German Pork Chops and Sauerkraut Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'center cut pork chops'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'sauerkraut, drained'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'red apple, diced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'caraway seeds'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Brown pork chops on both sides, about 5 minutes per side. Place chops into a 9x13-inch baking dish.', 'Mix sauerkraut, apple, onion, brown sugar, and caraway seeds in a bowl until well combined, and spread the sauerkraut mixture over the pork chops. Cover the dish with aluminum foil.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until the pork is no longer pink inside, about 45 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a chop should read 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).']

title: Sausage and Sauerkraut Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs 35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '5'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'sauerkraut, rinsed and drained'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'caraway seeds (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'apple, diced'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cooking spray'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'bacon, cut into 1-inch pieces'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'kielbasa sausage, cut into 1-inch thick slices'}]
directions: ['Gather the ingredients.', 'Place sauerkraut, caraway seeds, brown sugar, and apple into a large saucepan over medium-low heat, and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to low, and cook for 2 hours, stirring occasionally.', 'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish. Place bacon and onion into a skillet over medium heat, and cook until bacon is almost crisp and onion is beginning to brown, about 10 minutes. Stir the bacon mixture into the sauerkraut.', 'Brown kielbasa sausage in remaining bacon grease in the same skillet until sausage begins to brown, 10 to 15 minutes; stir into the sauerkraut mixture.', 'Spoon the sauerkraut and sausage mixture into the prepared baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until bubbling, about 1 hour.']

title: German Beef Rouladen Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 rouladen'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '(4 ounce)', 'Name': 'pieces round steak, pounded 1/4 inch thick'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'minced onion'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'paprika'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'bacon'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'canola oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(12 ounce) can', 'Name': 'beef broth'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'warm water'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sour cream'}]
directions: ['Spread 1/2 tablespoon mustard over one side of each piece of steak; sprinkle onion, paprika, salt, and pepper evenly over the steaks.', 'Lay one slice of bacon on each piece; roll up steaks jelly roll-style and secure with toothpicks.', 'Heat canola oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook beef rouladen on all sides until browned. Add broth and water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low; cover and simmer until tender, about 30 minutes.', 'Remove beef rouladen; strain broth mixture and return liquid to the skillet. Whisk cornstarch and 1 cup of water together until smooth; slowly pour cornstarch mixture into the skillet, stirring continually until the sauce has thickened, 2 to 3 minutes.', 'Stir in sour cream; return rolls to the sauce and serve immediately.']

title: Creamy Dill German Potato Salad Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'yellow or gold potatoes'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'mayonnaise'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'plain Greek yogurt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'dill pickle brine'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'hard boiled eggs, divdied'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup chopped', 'Name': 'chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'dill pickles'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}]
directions: ['Add potatoes to a large pot and cover with salted water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, and cook until easily pierced with a fork but still firm, 15 to 25 minutes. Drain potatoes, and set aside to cool.', 'Meanwhile, whisk the mayonnaise, yogurt, pickle brine, and Dijon mustard together in a large bowl until well blended. Peel and roughly chop 2 of the hard boiled eggs. Stir in chopped eggs, onion, and pickles.', 'When potatoes are cool enough to handle, peel and cut them into bite-sized pieces. Add potatoes to the bowl with the dressing, and gently toss to coat evenly.', 'Season to taste with salt and pepper, and slice the remaining hard boiled egg for a garnish on the potato salad. May be served immediately or chilled in the fridge.']

title: German Rhubarb Almond Cake Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 (9-inch) cake'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'peeled and chopped rhubarb'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}]
directions: ['For the rhubarb filling: Combine rhubarb and sugar in a large bowl. Mix to combine and set aside to allow the rhubarb to release some juice, about 1 hour.', 'For the cake: Beat butter and sugar together in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Add flour, wine, baking powder, and egg; mix together to form a dough. Wrap dough in plastic wrap and place in the refrigerator for 5 to 10 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9-inch springform cake pan.', 'Roll dough out on a lightly floured surface into a circle slightly larger than the diameter of the cake pan. Transfer to the prepared cake pan, letting the dough come up the sides by about 1 inch.', 'Drain rhubarb and evenly scatter over the dough; bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, make the custard filling: beat almond flour, 3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons crÃ¨me fraÃ®che, sugar, eggs, vanilla sugar, and cinnamon together until smooth.', 'Remove cake from oven after 45 minutes; top with almond custard mixture and use a spatula to spread it evenly to the sides of the pan. Return cake to the oven and bake until golden brown on top, about 30 minutes more.', 'Allow the cake to cool in the pan before slicing.']

title: Quark (Homemade Cheese) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '16 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '16 hrs 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '2 cups'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'buttermilk'}]
directions: ['Bring milk to a simmer in a saucepan; remove from heat and cool to room temperature.', 'Whisk buttermilk into milk; let sit at room temperature, 8 hours to overnight. Strain mixture through cheesecloth over a bowl in the refrigerator, 8 hours to overnight.']

title: Easy Plum Cake
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 (10-inch) cake'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'unsalted butter, at room temperature'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '12', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'ripe plums, halved and pitted'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'cinnamon sugar, or to taste'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 10-inch springform pan.', 'Combine sugar and butter in a large bowl and beat with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add eggs, 1 at a time, and beat well after each addition. Combine flour, baking powder, and salt in a separate bowl and sift on top of the butter mixture; mix to combine. Transfer batter into the prepared springform pan and smooth out.', 'Set plums inside batter, cut-side up, and sprinkle evenly with cinnamon-sugar.', 'Bake in the preheated oven on the lowest rack until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 40 to 50 minutes. Serve warm or cool to room temperature.']

title: Spaghetti Ice Cream Sundae (Spaghetti-Eis)
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Freeze Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'vanilla ice cream'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'heavy cream'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'white sugar, divided'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'strawberries, washed, dried, and halved'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'lemon juice'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white chocolate shavings'}]
directions: ['Place a potato ricer (or spaetzle press) in the freezer for 1 hour as you prepare the rest of the ingredients.', 'Whip heavy cream and 1 tablespoon sugar in a bowl with an electric mixer into stiff peaks. Scoop cream into a piping bag and pipe 2 to 3 tablespoons cream in a tall dollop onto 4 ice cream bowls or plates. The piping bag allows you to have more control but you can also do this using a spoon, if need be.', 'Place the bowls in the freezer for 30 minutes to allow cream to firm up slightly.', 'Blend sliced strawberries, remaining 2 tablespoons sugar, and lemon juice together until smooth and well combined. Pour into an airtight container and store in the refrigerator.', 'Once sufficiently chilled, remove one bowl from the freezer at a time. Fill the cold potato ricer with 1 cup ice cream and squeeze it over the frozen cream. Depending on the consistency of your ice cream, you might find that you have to let it soften at room temperature for 5 minutes before you can properly extrude the "noodles." Repeat with the remaining bowls.', 'Top each sundae with about a 1/4 cup of strawberry sauce. Finish with a generous sprinkling of white chocolate shavings. Serve immediately.']

title: Pfeffernusse Cookies Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '18'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '36 cookies'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'molasses'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'honey'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'shortening'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'margarine'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'anise extract'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'baking soda'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cloves'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground ginger'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': "confectioners' sugar for dusting"}]
directions: ['Gather the ingredients.', 'Place molasses, honey, shortening, and margarine in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir until creamy.', 'Remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature. Beat in eggs.', 'Combine flour, white sugar, brown sugar, anise, cinnamon, cardamom, baking soda, cloves, nutmeg, ginger, black pepper, and salt in a large bowl.', 'Add molasses mixture; stir until thoroughly combined. Refrigerate dough until well chilled, about 2 hours.', 'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Roll dough into acorn-sized balls and place 1 inch apart on baking sheets.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until firm to the touch with slight cracking, 10 to 15 minutes. Cool on the baking sheets briefly before removing them to a wire rack to cool completely.', "Dust cooled cookies with confectioners' sugar. Store in an airtight container."]

title: Crispy Roasted Chicken Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'caraway seeds'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'dried sage'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'fennel seeds'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'coriander seeds'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'dried rosemary'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'paprika'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'garlic powder'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'onion powder'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(4 pound)', 'Name': 'broiler-fryer chicken, cut in half lengthwise'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).', 'Combine kosher salt, caraway, sage, fennel, coriander, and rosemary in a spice grinder or mortar. Grind to a coarse powder. Transfer spice mixture to a bowl; stir in paprika, garlic powder, flour, and onion powder. Mix in vegetable oil to make a smooth paste.', "Pat chicken halves dry with paper towels and tuck wing tips behind the back. Brush spice paste onto chicken halves, coating all sides and seasoning under wings and legs. Place chicken halves, skin-sides up, in a baking dish or roasting pan, leaving space around chickens so halves aren't touching.", 'Roast in the preheated oven until no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, about 1 hour. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh, near the bone, should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Remove from the oven and let rest for 10 minutes before slicing.']

title: Wiener Schnitzel Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'veal cutlets'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'grated Parmesan cheese'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'minced parsley'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'dry bread crumbs'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'lemon'}]
directions: ['Place veal cutlets between 2 sheets of heavy plastic on a solid, level surface. Firmly pound cutlets with the smooth side of a meat mallet to a 1/4-inch thickness. Dip cutlets in flour to coat; shake off excess.', 'Beat eggs, Parmesan cheese, milk, parsley, salt, pepper, and nutmeg together in a shallow bowl until combined. Place bread crumbs on a plate.', 'Dip each cutlet into the egg mixture, then press in bread crumbs to coat. Place coated cutlets on a plate and refrigerate for 1 hour to overnight.', 'Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook breaded cutlets in butter until browned, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer cutlets to a serving platter and pour pan juices over them. Garnish with lemon slices.']

title: Old German Honey Cookies Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '24'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 dozen'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'shortening'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'honey'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking soda'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground ginger'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Melt together sugar, shortening, and honey in a saucepan over low heat. Let cool.', 'Mix together eggs, vanilla, baking soda, and ginger. Gradually add to cooled honey mixture. Slowly add flour to mixture. Stir until well blended.', 'Drop by teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheets about 2 inches apart.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until golden, 12 to 15 minutes.']

title: JÃ¤gerschnitzel Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'egg, beaten'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'bread crumbs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'pork steaks or cutlets, pounded thin'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'onion, diced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(8 ounce) can', 'Name': 'sliced mushrooms'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cube', 'Name': 'beef bouillon'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sour cream'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}]
directions: ['Place beaten egg in a shallow dish. Mix together bread crumbs and flour in a second shallow dish; season with salt and pepper.', 'Dip pork steaks in beaten egg, then press into bread crumb mixture to coat.', 'Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry coated steaks in hot oil until browned and cooked through, about 5 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of steaks should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C). Remove steaks to a platter and keep warm.', 'Add onion and mushrooms to drippings in the skillet; cook and stir until lightly browned. Pour in water and stir in bouillon cube until dissolved. Simmer for about 20 minutes.', 'Combine sour cream and cornstarch in a small bowl; stir into the skillet. Cook over low heat until sauce is thickened, but do not boil. title: Chef John's Beef Rouladen
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '2'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '2 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(6 ounce)', 'Name': '(1/4 inch thick) slices of beef round'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'strips', 'Name': 'bacon'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'paprika, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, sliced into half-rings and separated'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'dill pickle spears'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}]
directions: ['Place slices of beef on a work surface, Season both sides with kosher salt and pepper. Spread one side with mustard. Place bacon strips on the mustard and sprinkle with paprika. Arrange onion slices cross-wise on the beef. Then evenly space 3 pickle slices across each slice of beef. Keep about an inch of the narrowest end of the beef slice free of toppings to facilitate rolling it up.', "Roll each slice of meat, beginning from the wider of the two short ends, working to keep all ingredients inside the roll. Rolls should be nice and tight. Secure the rolls (seam side down) with 3 loops of butcher's twine, one in the middle and one at each end. Trim excess string.", 'Heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat in a large saucepan. Cook beef, turning and browning well on all sides, about 8 minutes. Remove meat from pan. Reduce heat to medium-low. Melt butter in the pan; whisk in the flour, cooking for about 1 minute. Pour in cold beef broth and whisk vigorously to combine. Raise heat to medium-high and simmer until sauce begins to thicken, about 1 minute.', 'Transfer beef rolls to pan along with accumulated juices. Reduce heat to very low. Simmer gently, covered, turning rolls every 20 minutes or so, until beef is tender, about 1 1/2 hours. When the tip of a sharp knife can easily be inserted into the beef roll, the meat is done.', 'Transfer meat to dish to allow it to rest. Raise heat to high and bring cooking liquid to a simmer to thicken slightly to make a gravy, about 1 minute. Serve rouladen with gravy.']

title: German Hamburgers (Frikadellen) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'kaiser roll'}, {'Quantity': 'â…”', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'ground beef'}, {'Quantity': 'â…“', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'ground pork'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'egg'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'Hungarian hot paprika (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}]
directions: ['Soak kaiser roll in a medium bowl of water for 10 minutes. Drain and squeeze out excess water; crumble into a large bowl.', 'Add ground meats, onion, parsley, egg, paprika, salt, and black pepper to crumbled roll; mix until well blended. Shape mixture into large flattened meatballs.', 'Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Fry meatballs in the hot skillet until browned and no longer pink in the center, about 5 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a patty should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).']

title: Traditional Springerle Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '8 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '9 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '48'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '48 cookies'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cooking spray'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'crushed anise seeds'}, {'Quantity': '3 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking powder'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'sugar'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': "confectioners' sugar"}]
directions: ['Spray 4 cookie sheets with cooking spray; sprinkle with anise seeds and set aside until needed.', 'Mix flour and baking powder together in a large bowl until well blended. Place sugar, eggs, and vanilla in a separate large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until light and frothy, 5 to 8 minutes. Gradually stir flour mixture into egg mixture to form a thick dough.', "Working with handfuls of dough at a time, roll out onto a lightly floured surface until 1/4 inch thick. Lightly sift confectioners' sugar over dough. Place springerle molds onto dough; press down hard and evenly until the mold's design registers in dough. Remove the mold. Use a small knife to cut around each cookie, and place them 2 inches apart on the prepared cookie sheets. Repeat, until all dough has been used. Cover cookies with a lightweight cotton cloth, and allow to dry for 8 hours, or overnight. The designs will remain embossed in the cookies.", 'When ready to bake, preheat the oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C).', 'Bake cookies in preheated oven until tops are pale brown and cookies are set, 25 to 30 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Store in an airtight container.']

title: German Semolina Pudding Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '2'}]

directions: ['Combine milk and sugar in a saucepan over medium heat; bring to a boil then immediately remove from heat. Pour into serving bowls; top with your favorite hot cereal toppings.']

title: Beer Glazed Brats and Sauerkraut Recipe

ingredients: [{'Quantity': 'â…›', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'celery seeds'}, {'Quantity': 'â…›', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'caraway seeds'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(12 fluid ounce) can or bottle', 'Name': 'lager beer'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'light brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'dry mustard powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'onion powder'}, {'Quantity': 'â…›', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': 'â…›', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'dried dill weed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'fresh bratwurst sausages'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'sauerkraut (preferably barrel-aged), drained'}]
directions: ['Crush celery seeds and caraway seeds with a mortar and pestle until ground.', 'Mix beer, brown sugar, dry mustard, onion powder, pepper, dill, and crushed seeds together in a bowl until brown sugar is dissolved.', 'Place brats into a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Pour beer mixture over top and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes.', 'Uncover and increase the heat to medium. Boil the sauce until it reduces to a thick, syrupy liquid, about 20 minutes. Tilt the skillet to roll brats in the sticky sauce until thoroughly coated. Transfer brats to a plate and cover to keep warm.', 'Add sauerkraut to the skillet and stir to combine with any leftover sauce; cook for 5 to 8 minutes. Transfer sauerkraut to a serving platter and top with warm brats.']

title: Krautburger Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '16'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '16 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'lean ground beef'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'medium head', 'Name': 'cabbage, shredded'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': '(1 ounce) package', 'Name': 'dry onion soup mix'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'Name': 'mild Cheddar cheese, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(1 pound) loaves', 'Name': 'frozen bread dough, thawed'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'butter flavored cooking spray'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'margarine, melted'}]

title: Apfelkuchen (Apple Cake) Recipe

ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2 Â¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'sifted all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1 â…›', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'warm milk'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(.25 ounce) package', 'Name': 'active dry yeast'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter, softened'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'apples - peeled, cored, and sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sifted all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'candied lemon peel, chopped (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'butter'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients. Grease the bottom and sides of a 9x13-inch baking dish or a 9-inch springform pan.', 'Beat 2 Â¼ cups flour, milk, 1/4 cup sugar, yeast, 6 tablespoons butter, vanilla extract, and 1 pinch salt in a large bowl with an electric mixer on high until dough is smooth, about 5 minutes.', 'Spread into baking dish and press dough up the sides. title: German Lebkuchen Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '8 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '8 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '36'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '3 dozen cookies'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'honey'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'dark molasses'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'egg'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'sifted all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cloves'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground allspice'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking soda'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'slivered almonds'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'candied mixed fruit peel, finely chopped'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Beat brown sugar, honey, and egg in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth; stir in molasses.', 'Combine flour, nutmeg, cinnamon, cloves, allspice, and baking soda in a separate bowl; stir into the molasses mixture to form a sticky dough. Stir in almonds and candied fruit peel. Cover dough and chill overnight.', 'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease or line cookie sheets. Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface to a thickness of 1/4 inch.', 'Cut into 2x3-inch rectangles. Place cookies 1 Â½ inches apart on prepared cookie sheets.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, about 10 to 12 minutes.', "While the cookies are baking, make the glaze: Stir egg white, lemon juice, and lemon zest together in a small bowl. title: Kate's Easy German Sauerbraten Recipe

ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'red wine'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cider vinegar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'onion, diced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lemon, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'clove', 'Name': 'garlic, diced'}, {'Quantity': '10', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'whole cloves'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bay leaves'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'juniper berries, crushed (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'whole peppercorns'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(4 pound)', 'Name': 'boneless beef chuck roast'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chopped onions'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chopped carrots'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'diced celery'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'gingersnap cookies, crushed'}]
directions: ['Heat water, wine, vinegar, 1/2 onion, lemon, sugar, salt, garlic, cloves, bay leaves, juniper berries, and peppercorns in a saucepan over medium heat until sugar is dissolved, about 5 minutes. Allow marinade to cool, then pour into a resealable plastic bag. Add chuck roast and toss to evenly coat, squeeze out excess air, and seal bag. Marinate in the refrigerator 2 to 3 days, turning roast twice a day.', 'Place 2 cups onions, carrots, and celery in a slow cooker. Remove roast from marinade; arrange on top of vegetables. Strain marinade; pour 2 1/2 cups over roast and reserve remaining marinade.', 'Cover slow cooker; cook on Low for 8 hours. Turn slow cooker off; transfer roast to a cutting board and cover with aluminum foil. Strain cooking liquid into a large bowl. Return vegetables to slow cooker; set aside.', 'Pour 3 cups cooking liquid (adding reserved marinade as needed to reach 3 cups liquid) into a saucepan; add gingersnaps. Heat over medium-high heat until gravy is thickened, about 10 minutes.', 'Slice roast; serve with vegetables and gravy.']

title: Real Homemade Bologna Recipe

title: Schnitzel Recipe

title: Oktoberfest Chicken and Red Cabbage Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'bacon'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'bacon drippings'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt, plus more to taste'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'skinless chicken thighs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'red onion, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'apple, cored and sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'head', 'Name': 'red cabbage, cored and sliced'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'dry red wine'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon (Optional)'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Place bacon in a large oven-safe or cast iron skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on a paper towel-lined plate until cool; crumble bacon. Leave bacon drippings in the skillet.', 'Whisk flour, kosher salt, and smoked paprika together in a medium bowl until evenly combined. Coat chicken thighs evenly in seasoned flour.', 'Cook coated chicken thighs in drippings in the skillet over medium heat until browned, about 5 minutes per side; transfer chicken to a plate.', 'Drain grease in the skillet except for 1 tablespoon; cook and stir onion and apple in hot grease until onion is translucent and apple is softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in red cabbage and crumbled bacon; season with kosher salt. Cook, stirring often, until cabbage is softened, 5 to 8 minutes.', 'Pour vinegar and red wine into the skillet. Stir in brown sugar and cinnamon until well combined. Bring to a boil; cook until sauce is reduced by half, stirring often, about 10 minutes. Arrange chicken thighs on top of cabbage in the skillet.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until cabbage is tender and chicken is cooked through, about 40 minutes. An instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of a thigh should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).']

Line a colander with cheese cloth and place over a large pot in the sink.', 'Gently mix buttermilk and cream together in a 2-quart ceramic casserole dish.', 'Cook in the preheated oven for 2 hours and 15 minutes.', 'Pour buttermilk mixture into the prepared colander; drain for 45 to 60 minutes. Transfer drained cheese to a bowl and beat with an electric hand mixer until smooth and creamy. Store in the refrigerator.']

title: German Zwiebelkuchen (Onion Pie) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 (15x10-inch) pie'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'onions, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'bacon'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) container', 'Name': 'sour cream'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'caraway seed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(14.1 ounce) package', 'Name': 'pastry for a double crust pie'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a 15x10-inch pan or large pizza pan with prepared dough, making sure dough extends up sides of pan.', 'SautÃ© onion in a skillet until translucent and pour cooked onion into a large mixing bowl. Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown. Drain, chop and add to onion; mix well.', 'Stir in sour cream. Beat eggs enough to break up yolks, then mix in to pie mixture. Add flour to thicken mixture (onions will create a lot of water), then add salt. Mix well and pour mixture into prepared pan. Sprinkle top with caraway seed.', 'Bake in preheated oven until onions start to turn golden brown on top, about 1 hour.']

title: Easy German Apple Streusel Pie Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'apples - peeled, cored, and thinly sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '7', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'unsalted butter, at room temperature'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'vanilla sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'egg'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '3 Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'baking powder'}]
directions: ["Combine apple slices and cinnamon in a saucepan and cook over low heat for 10 minutes. If necessary, add a tiny bit of water so apples don't burn. Remove from heat and set aside to cool.", 'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 10-inch springform pan with butter.', 'Combine butter, sugar, vanilla sugar, and egg in a large bowl; beat using an electric mixer until smooth and creamy. Mix flour and baking powder in a separate bowl. Add 2/3 of flour mixture, 1 tablespoon at a time, to butter mixture and beat on low speed. Add remaining flour mixture and mix in by hand to make a crumbly dough.', 'Transfer 1/2 the dough into the prepared springform pan and press down to create a bottom crust. Add apple slices, leaving a small space around the edges. Crumble remaining dough evenly on top.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until streusel and crust are lightly browned, about 50 minutes. Cool on a wire rack for 5 minutes. Run a table knife around the edges to loosen. Carefully transfer to a serving plate or cooling rack.']

title: Kraut Bierocks Recipe

title: Gluehwein (German Mulled Wine) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'gallon', 'Name': 'red wine'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '(3 inch)', 'Name': 'cinnamon sticks'}, {'Quantity': '12', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'whole cloves'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'fresh-squeezed lemon juice'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'orange, sliced into rounds'}]
directions: ['Pour wine into a large pot and set over medium heat. Let it warm up until steam rises from the surface, but do not allow it to boil. Add cinnamon sticks, cloves, lemon juice, and sugar; stir to dissolve sugar. Float orange slices on the surface. Warm over medium heat for 5 minutes, being careful not to let it boil. Remove from heat and let stand for 1 hour.', 'Pour through a colander to remove orange slices and whole spices. Serve hot, or refrigerate and reheat gently just before serving.']

title: Butterkuchen Recipe

Let rise in warm place for 45 minutes. title: Bee Sting Cake (Bienenstich) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '16'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 â…', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'active dry yeast'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'lukewarm milk'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': "confectioners' sugar"}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': 'â…', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sliced almonds'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'honey (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': 'â…“', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'egg, beaten'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'almond extract'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'heavy whipping cream'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'cream of tartar'}]
directions: ['Combine flour, yeast, 2 tablespoons sugar, salt, 3/4 cup milk, and 3 tablespoons butter in a large bowl. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Add almonds and 1 tablespoon milk. Remove from heat, and stir in honey. Spread evenly and carefully onto dough. Allow dough to rise for an additional 30 minutes. Cool completely on a wire rack.', 'Dissolve cornstarch in a little milk. Combine 1 1/2 cups milk, cornstarch, and 1 tablespoon sugar in the top of a double boiler. Fold into chilled pudding.', 'Cut cooled almond bread into 1 1/4x2-inch rectangles; slice each one horizontally into halves. Fill with pudding mixture. Chill, and serve cold.']

title: German Rhubarb Streusel Cake Recipe

title: German Rice Recipe

title: Christmas Stollen Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '15'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 stollen'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': 'â…”', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'warm milk (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'active dry yeast'}, {'Quantity': '2 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'bread flour'}, {'Quantity': 'â…“', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'â…“', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'butter, softened'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'egg'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': 'â…”', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'diced candied citron'}, {'Quantity': 'â…“', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'currants'}, {'Quantity': 'â…“', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'golden raisins'}, {'Quantity': 'â…“', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'red candied cherries, quartered'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'marzipan'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': "confectioners' sugar"}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Place warm milk and yeast in a bowl. Let stand until creamy, about 10 minutes.', 'Place yeast mixture, 2 cups bread flour, white sugar, butter, egg, and salt in a large mixing bowl; stir well to combine. Add remaining flour, 1/4 cup at a time, stirring well after each addition.', 'When dough has pulled together, turn it out onto a lightly floured surface; knead in candied citron, currants, golden raisins, and cherries. Continue kneading until smooth, about 8 minutes.', 'Lightly oil a large bowl, place the dough in the bowl, and turn to coat with oil. Cover with a damp cloth and let rise in a warm place until doubled in volume, about 1 hour.', 'Lightly grease a baking sheet. Deflate dough and turn it out onto a lightly floured surface. Roll marzipan into a rope and place in the center of the dough.', 'Fold dough over to cover it; pinch the seams together to seal. Place the loaf, seam-side down, on the prepared baking sheet.', 'Cover with a damp cloth and let rise until doubled in volume, about 40 minutes.', 'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Bake stollen in the preheated oven for 10 minutes, then reduce heat to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) and bake for a further 30 to 40 minutes, or until golden brown and the bottom of the loaf sounds hollow when tapped.', "Let cool on a wire rack, then dust with confectioners' sugar and sprinkle with cinnamon."]

title: German Schwenkbraten Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 day'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 day 35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '10', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onions, cut into wedges'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'Quantity': '7', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'dried juniper berries, crushed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'German stone ground mustard'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'dried thyme'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'dried oregano'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'paprika'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'curry powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '(8 ounce)', 'Name': 'boneless pork loin chops'}]
directions: ['Place onion wedges in a bowl. Use a large spoon to gently press onions until they release some of their juices. Combine oil, garlic, juniper berries, mustard, thyme, oregano, paprika, curry powder, cayenne pepper, and black pepper with onions; mix to combine.', 'Arrange pork chops in a large baking pan; pour marinade evenly on top. Cover and refrigerate for at least 24 hours.', 'Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat.', 'Meanwhile, remove pork from marinade and allow to come to room temperature. Wrap onions separately in a foil pouch; discard marinade.', 'Cook pork steaks and onions on the preheated grill until pork is no longer pink in the center, about 10 minutes per side.']

Stir cabbage and potatoes into the skillet and sautÃ© until cabbage is wilted.', 'Add kielbasa, vinegar, salt, and pepper; cook over low heat, stirring occasionally until cooked through. title: Mandelmakronen (Almond Meringues) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '48'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'egg whites'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'almond flour, or more as needed'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.', 'Beat egg whites in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until stiff peaks form. Gradually add sugar, 1 teaspoon at a time, while continuing to beat at high speed. Combine almond flour and cinnamon in a bowl and fold into egg white mixture with a spatula. Add more ground almonds if mixture is too runny.', 'Use two teaspoons to place little mounds of almond mixture 2 inches apart onto the prepared baking sheets.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned and baked through, 15 to 20 minutes. Carefully remove from baking sheets and cool on wire racks.']

title: Schupfnudeln (German Fried Potato Dumplings) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'starchy potatoes, such as russet or Yukon Gold'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â¾', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'flour, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter'}]
directions: ['Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, 20 to 25 minutes. Drain and peel potatoes.', 'Place potatoes into a large bowl and mash with a potato masher. Add flour and eggs; mix until well combined. Season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg.', 'Use your hands to shape potato dough into oblong dumplings with two pointy ends. If dough sticks to your hands, rinse them under cold water.', 'Bring water to a boil in a large pot over high heat, then reduce to just a simmer. Working in batches, cook dumplings in just simmering water until they float on top. Use a slotted spoon to transfer dumplings to a large bowl of cold water. Remove with a slotted spoon to a colander; drain well.', 'Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat. SautÃ© Schupfnudeln in hot butter until golden brown and crisp on all sides, 5 to 10 minutes. Drain on a paper towel-lined plate.']

title: Pork Roast and Sauerkraut Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '6 hrs 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '6 hrs 40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'bacon drippings'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'minced onion'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'red apple, diced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'caraway seeds'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'sauerkraut, drained and rinsed'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'dry white wine'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chicken stock'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'boneless pork loin roast'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'kielbasa sausage, cut into 3-inch pieces'}]
directions: ['Heat bacon drippings in a Dutch oven over medium heat. Cook and stir onion in hot drippings until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in apple and caraway seeds and cook until apple is just tender, about 3 minutes more. Stir in sauerkraut until incorporated.', 'Stir together white wine, chicken stock, and brown sugar in a medium bowl; pour over sauerkraut mixture.', 'Place pork roast into a slow cooker. Pour sauerkraut mixture over the top of pork.', 'Cook on Low until pork easily falls apart when pulled with a fork, 6 to 8 hours. Add sausage and continue to cook until sausage is heated through, 15 to 20 minutes more.']

title: Red Currant Pie Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 10-inch pie'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking powder'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'butter, softened'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs, separated'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'grated lemon zest'}]
directions: ['Make the dough: Sift flour and baking powder into a medium bowl. Mix in butter, sugar, egg yolks, and lemon zest until a dough forms. Cover and let rest in a cool place for 30 minutes. Set egg whites aside for the filling.', 'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease the bottom and sides of a 10-inch springform pan.', 'Roll dough into a 10-inch circle; place into the prepared springform pan.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until golden, about 25 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, make the filling: Beat reserved egg whites in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until stiff. Gradually mix in sugar and cornstarch, then beat for 5 minutes. Fold in currants, then pour over crust in the springform pan.', 'Return to the oven and bake until top is lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Cool to room temperature before serving.']

title: German Rocks Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '36'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '3 dozen'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '2 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'sifted all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking soda'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'hot water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'dates, pitted and chopped'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chopped walnuts'}]
directions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'In a medium bowl, cream the butter and sugar. Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each. Finally, stir in the dates and walnuts so they are evenly distributed.', 'Drop by heaping spoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden.']

title: Bierock Casserole Recipe

title: Pfeffernusse Recipe

ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking powder'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking soda'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground white pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground ginger'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'butter, softened'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'packed brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely chopped almonds (Optional)'}]

title: German Anise Christmas Cookies (Springerle) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '36'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '2 to 3 dozen'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking powder'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': "confectioners' sugar"}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'lemon zest'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'anise seed, ground'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'anise seed, crushed'}]
directions: ['Sift together the flour and baking powder, set aside. In a large bowl, whip the eggs and sugar until thick and light. Stir in the lemon zest and ground anise. Traditionally, you would roll over the dough with a springerle rolling pin, but the dough can be cut into small shapes of any kind. Place cookies 1/2 inch apart on baking sheets, sprinkle with anise seed and leave out uncovered, overnight.', 'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Bake cookies for 25 to 30 minutes.']

title: Easy Three-Ingredient Gluten-Free German Christmas Coconut Cookies Recipe

title: Apple Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '24'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 (9x13-inch) cake'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking soda'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'apples - peeled, cored and diced'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped walnuts'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(3 ounce) packages', 'Name': 'cream cheese'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter, softened'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': "confectioners' sugar"}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}]

title: Sausage 'n Kraut Recipe

title: North German Gruenkohl (Kale) and Sausage Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'kale, stemmed and chopped'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'bacon, chopped'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water, or as needed to cover'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'beef bouillon granules'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'prepared mustard'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'thickly sliced cooked ham, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'links', 'Name': 'kielbasa sausage'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}]

Remove kale with a slotted spoon and set aside.', 'Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until browned, stirring frequently, about 8 minutes. title: German Chicken Recipe
