Pour mixture into a large, resealable plastic bag. Drain and discard marinade from chicken tenders. Add chicken to the bag, seal it, and shake until each piece is completely dredged in mixture.', 'Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).', 'Add chicken pieces to the hot oil about 5 pieces at a time so as not to drop the temperature of the oil. Fry for 2 minutes. Transfer chicken to a plate lined with paper towels to drain. Continue with remaining chicken pieces.', 'Increase oil heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) until continuously boiling. Carefully add the first batch of cooked chicken and fry again until cooked through and crispy about 2 minutes more. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towels to drain. Repeat with the second batch of chicken pieces. Transfer chicken to a medium-sized serving bowl.', 'Heat a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Add honey, brown sugar, soy sauce, gochujang paste, Worcestershire sauce, red pepper flakes, and ginger. Cook and stir continuously until sugar has melted and sauce is smooth, about 5 minutes. Drizzle sauce over twice-fried chicken tenders and serve.']

title: Korean Spicy Marinated Pork (Dae Ji Bool Gogi) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '4 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'rice wine vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'gochujang (Korean hot pepper paste)'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'minced garlic'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'minced fresh ginger root'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onions, cut into 2 inch pieces'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'yellow onion, cut into 1/4-inch thick rings'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(2 pound)', 'Name': 'pork loin, cut into 1/4 inch slices'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'canola oil'}]
directions: ['Stir together the vinegar, soy sauce, hot pepper paste, garlic, ginger, red pepper flakes, black pepper, sugar, green onions, and yellow onion in a large bowl. Mix in the pork slices, mixing well until completely coated. Place into a resealable plastic bag, squeeze out any excess air, seal, and marinate in the refrigerator at least 3 hours.', 'Heat the canola oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the pork slices in batches, and cook until no longer pink in the center, and lightly browned on the outside, about 5 minutes per batch. Be careful when cooking the meat, the spicy fumes will hurt your nose!']

title: Yaki Mandu (Fried Korean Dumplings) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '25'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '25 dumplings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'ground beef'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely chopped green onions'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely chopped cabbage'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely chopped carrot'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'sesame oil, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'toasted sesame seeds'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'monosodium glutamate'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'vegetable oil for frying'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'Name': 'wonton wrappers'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'rice wine vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'toasted sesame seeds, or more to taste'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add beef; cook and stir until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease.', 'Mix green onions, cabbage, carrot, garlic, 1 tablespoon sesame oil, 1 tablespoon sesame seeds, monosodium glutamate, salt, and pepper into ground beef mixture; cook and stir until liquid is evaporated and vegetables are tender, 5 to 10 minutes.', 'Transfer beef mixture to a bowl and mix in 1 egg. Meanwhile, heat vegetable oil in a separate skillet over medium heat.', 'Crack the second egg into a bowl and beat well.', 'Hold 1 wonton wrapper in the palm of your hand and brush a thin layer of beaten egg on 1 edge. Scoop about 1 teaspoon beef mixture into the center of the wrapper.', 'Fold wrapper in half, corner to corner, to make a triangle and pinch the edges shut, crimping with your fingers to make a seal.', 'Press the air out by cupping your fingers over the dumpling in your palm and pressing lightly.', 'Fry wontons in the hot oil until 1 side is browned, about 1 or 2 minutes. Flip and cook until other side is browned, 1 or 2 minutes. Transfer wontons to a paper towel-lined plate to drain using a slotted spoon.', 'To make the dipping sauce: Whisk soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, 1 teaspoon sesame oil, and 1 teaspoon sesame seeds together in a bowl until smooth.', 'Serve alongside wontons.']

title: Kimchi Jun (Kimchi Pancake) and Dipping Sauce Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 pancakes'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'kimchi, drained and chopped'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'reserved juice from kimchi'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'rice vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'sesame oil'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'Korean chili pepper flakes (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'toasted sesame seeds (Optional)'}]
directions: ['Stir together the kimchi, kimchi juice, flour, eggs, and green onion in a bowl.', 'Heat vegetable oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Using about 1/4 cup of batter for each pancake, pour into skillet, spreading as thin as possible. Cook pancakes until set and lightly browned, turning once, 3 to 5 minutes per side. Season to taste with salt.', 'Whisk together the rice vinegar, soy sauce, sesame oil, chili pepper flakes, and toasted sesame seeds. Serve with the pancakes.']

title: Tteokbokki (Korean Spicy Rice Cakes) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '2'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'dried anchovies, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chile paste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'corn syrup'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'Korean fish cakes, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'o'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'spring onion, thickly sliced'}]
directions: ['Combine water and anchovies in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Cook for 10 minutes. Remove and discard anchovies. Set anchovy water aside.', 'Combine chile paste, sugar, soy sauce, and corn syrup in a bowl. Set chle paste mixture aside.', 'Add rice cakes, onion, and chile paste mixture to anchovy water. Bring to a boil for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add spring onion and boil 3 minutes more.']

title: Japchae Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '2 ½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'sesame oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'minced garlic'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'To make the sauce: Whisk soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, and garlic in a bowl until sugar is dissolved; set aside.', 'Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook sweet potato noodles in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until cooked through but firm to the bite, 6 to 7 minutes.', 'Rinse noodles under cold water and drain. Transfer noodles to a bowl, add 2 tablespoons of prepared sauce, and toss to coat.', 'Squeeze beef under running water until juices run clear. Mix beef and 1 tablespoon prepared sauce together in a bowl; set aside to marinate.', 'Bring a pot of water to a boil. Cook spinach in the boiling water until just wilted, about 1 minute. Drain quickly and transfer spinach to a bowl of cold water to stop the cooking process. Squeeze excess water from spinach, place spinach in a large bowl, and season with salt and pepper.', 'Heat 1 teaspoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat; cook onion until fragrant but crisp, 1 to 2 minutes. Transfer onion to the bowl with spinach.', 'Heat another 1 teaspoon oil in the same skillet. Cook mushrooms in the hot oil until lightly browned but still firm, 1 to 2 minutes; add to onion mixture.', 'Heat remaining 1 teaspoon oil in the same skillet. Cook carrot in the hot oil until lightly browned but still crisp, 1 to 2 minutes; add to onion mixture.', 'Cook and stir beef strips with marinade in the same skillet until browned, 1 to 2 minutes; add to onion mixture.', 'Cook and stir noodles in the same skillet until heated through, 1 to 2 minutes; add to beef-onion mixture. Add remaining sauce to beef-noodles mixture and toss to coat using your hands.']

title: Korean Tofu and Vegetable Soup Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'beef stock'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'toenjang (fermented soybean paste)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(4 inch) piece', 'Name': 'dashi kombu (dried kelp) (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'Name': 'medium-firm tofu, cut into 1 1/2 x 1/4 inch dominoes'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'napa cabbage, thickly sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'daikon radish cut into 1 1/2x1/4 inch pieces'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'yellow squash, cut into 1 1/2x1/4 inch dominoes'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'green onions, white and pale green part only, sliced diagonally into 1 1/4 inch pieces'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'hot red pepper, seeded and sliced diagonally into 1/4 inch pieces'}]
directions: ['Pour the beef stock into a stock pot or large deep skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in the toenjang until dissolved. Add the kelp and garlic, and bring to a boil. Put in the tofu, cabbage, daikon and yellow squash, cover and return to a boil. Cook gently for 5 minutes. Then add the green onions and hot pepper, and boil for a minute, or until the onion and pepper become fragrant and brightly colored. Limit the cooking time to no more than 15 minutes. Remove and discard kelp. Serve immediately.']

title: Korean Soft Tofu Stew (Soon Du Bu Jigae) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '2'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '2 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'Korean chile powder'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'ground beef (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'Korean soy bean paste (doenjang)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'Name': 'Korean soon tofu or soft tofu, drained and sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'egg'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'sesame seeds'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onion, chopped'}]
directions: ['Heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the Korean chile powder and ground beef. Cook and stir until the beef is crumbly, evenly browned, and no longer pink. Stir in the soy bean paste, coating the beef. Pour in the water and bring to a boil. Season with salt and pepper. Gently drop tofu into the soup and continue cooking until the tofu is heated through, 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from heat and quickly add the egg into the soup, stirring gently to break it up. Garnish with sesame seeds and green onion.']

title: Korean Spicy Chicken and Potato (Tak Toritang) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2 ½', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'chicken drumettes'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'potatoes, cut into large chunks'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'carrots, cut into 2 inch pieces'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'onion, cut into 8 pieces'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'gochujang (Korean hot pepper paste)'}]
directions: ['In a large pot over medium heat, mix the chicken, potatoes, carrots, onion, sugar, and garlic. Pour in water and soy sauce, and stir in sugar and hot pepper paste.', 'Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer 45 minutes, until chicken juices run clear, vegetables are tender, and liquid has thickened.']

title: Spicy Korean Chicken Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'Korean chile paste (gochujang)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'sesame oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'Korean red chile flakes (gochugaru)'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(1 inch) piece', 'Name': 'ginger, peeled and minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'skinless, boneless chicken thighs, pounded if desired'}]
directions: ['Combine soy sauce, vegetable oil, chile paste, sesame oil, chile flakes, garlic, and ginger in a large bowl; whisk until chile paste is completely dissolved. Add chicken and stir to coat. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.', 'Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.', 'Grill chicken until slightly charred and no longer pink in the center, 5 to 8 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).']

title: Korean Kimchi Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '2 days 3 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 days 3 hrs 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '20'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '5 cups'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'heads', 'Name': 'napa cabbage, cored and cut into quarters lengthwise'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'heads', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'bunch', 'Name': 'green onions, cut into 2 inch pieces'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'monosodium glutamate (MSG)'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'red pepper flakes, or to taste'}]
directions: ['Cut the cabbage leaves into 2 inch long pieces. Spread 1/4 of the leaves into a large, non-metallic bowl and sprinkle with 1/4 of the salt. Repeat layering all of the cabbage has been salted. Let stand at room temperature until a lot of liquid has been pulled from the leaves and the cabbage is tender, 3 to 4 hours; drain. Rinse the cabbage in 2 or 3 changes of water. Drain again very well and return the cabbage to the mixing bowl.', 'Sprinkle the cabbage with the minced garlic, green onions, MSG, and red pepper flakes. Season to taste with additional salt and toss until evenly combined. Pack the mixture into a sterilized gallon-sized glass jar. Cover the jar with wax paper and a loose fitting lid so the seal is not airtight.', 'Allow the cabbage to ferment at room temperature until it reaches the desired degree of sourness, 2 to 5 days. Store in an airtight jar in the refrigerator.']

title: Vegetarian Bibimbap Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '3'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'sesame oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'carrot matchsticks'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'zucchini matchsticks'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': '(14 ounce) can', 'Name': 'bean sprouts, drained'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'canned bamboo shoots, drained'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(4.5 ounce) can', 'Name': 'sliced mushrooms, drained'}, {'Quantity': '⅛', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'cooked and cooled rice'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sliced green onions'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'sweet red chili sauce, or to taste'}]
directions: ['Heat sesame oil in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir carrot and zucchini in the hot oil until vegetables begin to soften, about 5 minutes. Stir in bean sprouts, bamboo shoots, and mushrooms. Cook and stir until carrots are tender, about 5 more minutes. Season to taste with salt; transfer vegetable mixture to a plate.', 'Stir cooked rice, green onions, soy sauce, and black pepper in the same skillet until the rice is hot.', 'In a separate skillet over medium heat, melt butter and gently fry eggs, turning once, until the yolks are still slightly runny but the egg whites are firm, about 3 minutes per egg.', 'To serve, divide hot cooked rice mixture between 3 serving bowls and top each bowl with 1/3 of the vegetable mixture and a fried egg. Serve with sweet red chili sauce.']

title: Ba'corn Cheese Corn
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 10-inch skillet'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'Name': 'bacon, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) packages', 'Name': 'frozen sweet corn, thawed'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'bunch', 'Name': 'green onions, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'jalapeno peppers, diced, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'heavy cream'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'shredded mozzarella cheese'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'shredded Monterey Jack cheese'}]
directions: ['Cook bacon in a 10-inch cast iron skillet over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until almost crisp and fat is rendered, 7 to 8 minutes.', "Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.", 'Drain frozen corn thoroughly in a colander. Add 1/2 of the corn to the skillet with the bacon. Cook and stir until kernels just start to turn golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes. Add garlic, green onions, and jalapenos; cook until vegetables start to soften and sweeten up, 3 to 4 minutes. Tilt pan to drain off some of the fat, using a paper towel to soak it up.', 'Season with salt, pepper, and cayenne. Pour in cream; stir and bring to a boil. Stir in the remaining corn until heated through. Turn off the heat and add about 2/3 of the mozzarella and Monterey Jack cheese. Stir to combine. Top corn with remaining cheese and a sprinkle of cayenne.', 'Broil until heated through and top is browned, 5 to 10 minutes. Serve immediately.']

title: Godeungeo Jorim (Korean Braised Mackerel with Radish) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'red chile pepper, seeded and minced (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green chile pepper, seeded and minced (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'cooking wine'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'gochugaru (Korean red pepper flakes)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'gochujang (Korean chile paste)'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'minced fresh ginger'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'daikon radish, halved lengthwise and sliced into 1/2-inch thick pieces'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'whole mackerel - gutted, cleaned, and cut into 3-inch pieces'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onions, sliced on the bias into 1/2-inch pieces'}]
directions: ['Combine red chile pepper, green chile pepper, cooking wine, gochugaru, gochujang, soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, and ginger in a small bowl; mix well to make sauce.', 'Place water and daikon radish in a large pot. Bring to a boil; cook until radish is tender, about 5 minutes.', 'Stir mackerel pieces into the pot. Pour sauce over the mackerel. Cook over high heat, occasionally spooning sauce over mackerel but not stirring the mixture, until cooking liquid has reduced by half, about 10 minutes. Reduce heat and simmer, partially covered, until sauce thickens, about 15 minutes.', 'Garnish mackerel with green onions.']

title: Bulgogi (Korean Barbecued Beef) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'sesame oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'sesame seeds'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'clove', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'monosodium glutamate (MSG) (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'beef top sirloin, thinly sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'carrot, julienned'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'yellow onion, chopped'}]

title: Fried Kimchi Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'kimchi, chopped into bite-sized pieces, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'sesame oil, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'white vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'white sugar, or to taste'}]
directions: ['Heat a nonstick skillet to medium-high heat. Add kimchi. Saute until fragrant and slightly yellow, about 5 minutes. Add sesame oil; cook until kimchi is coated, 2 to 3 minutes. Pour in vinegar to coat the bottom of the skillet. Increase heat slightly; bring vinegar to a boil. Add sugar. Reduce heat to low; cook until sugar dissolves and kimchi is browned, about 3 minutes.']

title: Easy Sheet Pan Beef Bulgogi Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'flat iron steak'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'fish sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'minced ginger'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'sesame oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'chili paste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'sesame seeds'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cooking spray'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'Name': 'sugar snap peas'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'bunch', 'Name': 'green onions, thinly sliced on the diagonal'}]
directions: ['Slice steak across the grain as thinly as possible.', 'Whisk soy sauce, brown sugar, fish sauce, ginger, sesame oil, chili paste, sesame seeds, and garlic together in a large bowl until combined. Add steak and toss to evenly coat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour to overnight.', 'Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Remove steak from the refrigerator and bring to room temperature.', 'Coat a sheet pan with cooking spray. Arrange onion and sugar snap peas on one side of the prepared sheet pan. Drizzle with enough olive oil to coat; season with salt and black pepper. Remove steak from marinade and shake off excess; place on other side of the prepared sheet pan. Discard remaining marinade.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until steak is slightly charred on edges, 10 to 12 minutes. Garnish with green onions.']

title: Korean Hot Wings Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'low-sodium soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'dark brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'ketchup'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'barbeque sauce'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'minced garlic'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'rice wine vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'chile-garlic sauce (such as Sriracha) (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'Asian (toasted) sesame oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'grated fresh ginger'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'quart', 'Name': 'peanut oil for frying, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'chicken wings'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'lemon-pepper seasoning, or to taste (Optional)'}]
directions: ['Stir soy sauce, brown sugar, ketchup, barbeque sauce, garlic, vinegar, chile-garlic sauce, pepper, sesame oil, and ginger together in a saucepan; bring to a boil.', 'Whisk cornstarch and water together in a small bowl; stir into sauce. Remove from heat and set aside to cool and thicken.', 'Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 360 degrees F (182 degrees C).', 'Season chicken wings with lemon-pepper seasoning.', 'Fry chicken wings in batches of 6 to 8 at a time in hot oil until no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, 6 to 8 minutes per batch. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the meatiest part of the wing, near the bone, should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).', 'Place cooked wings into a large mixing bowl. Ladle sauce over the wings and toss to coat.']

title: Bulgogi Beef (Korean-Style Barbecue) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '2'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 ¼', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'boneless beef short ribs, sliced across the grain in 1/8-inch thick slices'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, finely crushed'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'grated yellow onion'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'freshly grated gingerroot'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'toasted sesame oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'light brown sugar, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'freshly grated Asian pear'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'Korean red pepper flakes (gochugaru)'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil, plus more for brushing skillet'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'hot steamed rice, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'sliced green onion tops for garnish'}]
directions: ['Mix garlic, grated onion, grated ginger, toasted sesame oil, and brown sugar together in a mixing bowl. Stir in grated pear, soy sauce, and red pepper flakes.', 'Transfer meat to marinade and toss to coat on all sides. Cover and refrigerate, 1 to 2 hours.', 'Season meat with salt and a drizzle of vegetable oil. Toss.', 'Brush a cast iron skillet with a little vegetable oil and place over high heat. When the skillet is very hot, add beef in a single layer and cook until meat begins to caramelize around the edges and moisture begins to evaporate, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Serve over hot rice and top with green onion slices.']

title: Kalbi (Marinated Beef Short Ribs) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '8 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '8 hrs 40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sesame oil'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onions, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'sesame seeds'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'beef short ribs'}]
directions: ['Stir the sugar into the soy sauce in a bowl until the sugar dissolves completely. Whisk the sesame oil, garlic, green onions, and sesame seeds into the soy sauce. Place the short ribs in a large, sealable bag and pour the marinade over the meat. Marinate in refrigerator for 8 hours or overnight.', 'Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat, and lightly oil the grate. Remove the ribs from the bag; discard the marinade.', 'Cook the short ribs on the preheated grill until they are very firm, hot, and grey in the center, about 15 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).']

title: Korean Cucumber Salad Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'seedless cucumber, sliced paper-thin'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'sea salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onion, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'clove', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'rice vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'sesame oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'honey'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'freshly squeezed lemon juice'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'rice wine'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'toasted sesame seeds'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'gochugaru (Korean red pepper flakes)'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'freshly ground black pepper to taste'}]
directions: ['Place sliced cucumbers in a large bowl and sprinkle evenly with salt; allow liquid to drain from cucumbers for about 15 minutes.', 'Spoon cucumbers onto sheets of paper towels; wrap paper towels around cucumbers and wring out as much liquid as possible.', 'Place green onion and garlic in a salad bowl; add rice vinegar, sesame oil, honey, lemon juice, rice wine, toasted sesame seeds, Korean red pepper flakes, and ground black pepper. title: Jajangmyeon (Vegetarian Korean Black Bean Noodles) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '2'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '2 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'canola oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'clove', 'Name': 'garlic, minced, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cubed carrots'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'peeled and cubed potatoes'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'peeled and cubed zucchini'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped onion'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'black bean paste (chunjang)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'white sugar, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': '(7 ounce) package', 'Name': 'jaa jang myun noodles'}]
directions: ['Heat oil in a wok over medium heat. Add garlic, carrot, and potato. Stir and add salt and pepper. Cook until softened, 5 to 7 minutes. Add zucchini and onion; stir.', 'Combine cornstarch and water together in a bowl until fully mixed.', 'Add water, black bean paste, and sugar to the wok and stir. Add starch mixture to wok slowly while stirring; cook until sauce thickens, 3 to 5 minutes.', 'Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook noodles in boiling water, stirring occasionally, until noodles are tender yet firm to the bite, about 3 minutes. Drain.', 'Serve noodles in a large pasta bowl and add black bean mixture on top. Mix well.']

title: Dol Sot Bi Bim Bap Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '4 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'minced garlic'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped green onion'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'toasted sesame seeds'}, {'Quantity': '20', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'rib-eye steak, sliced thin'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'uncooked glutinous (sticky) white rice, rinsed'}, {'Quantity': '6 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'dried shiitake mushrooms'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'fresh spinach, washed and chopped'}, {'Quantity': '12', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'cucumber, julienned'}, {'Quantity': '12', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'carrots, julienned'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'sesame oil'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'fresh bean sprouts'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs, fried'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'sheets', 'Name': 'nori, crumbled'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'sesame oil'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chili bean paste (Kochujang)'}]
directions: ['Combine soy sauce, sugars, garlic, green onions, and sesame seeds in a large bowl; add sliced beef strips to marinade and season with salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.', 'Bring rice and water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and cover; simmer until rice is tender and liquid has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes.', 'Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Place 6 Korean stone bowls in the oven.', 'Combine shiitake mushrooms and 1/2 cup hot water in a small bowl; soak until pliable, about 10 minutes. Trim off and discard stems. Thinly slice caps and set aside.', 'Bring a saucepan of water to a boil. Add spinach to water just long enough to wilt leaves, then drain and pat dry. Set aside.', 'Combine cucumber and carrots in a bowl; season with salt and pepper. Set aside.', 'Preheat a wok over medium-high heat.', 'Cook and stir carrots and cucumbers in a small amount of sesame oil in the wok until softened. Remove from the wok and set aside. Add a small amount of sesame oil to the wok; cook and stir spinach in sesame oil for 1 to 2 minutes. Remove spinach from the wok and set aside. Add meat strips and marinade to the wok; cook, stirring frequently, until liquid reduces in volume, about 4 to 5 minutes.', 'Transfer the stone bowls from the oven to a suitable heat-resistant surface. Brush each bowl with sesame oil to coat. Divide rice into the bowls and gently pack to the bottom (the rice should sizzle as you arrange). Arrange cucumbers, carrots, bean sprouts, spinach, shiitake mushrooms, and beef mixture over each portion of rice.', 'Add one fried egg to each bowl, drizzle with 1 tablespoon sesame oil, and top with nori. Serve Kochujang sauce as a condiment.']

title: Instant Pot Galbi (Korean-Style Short Ribs) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'beef short ribs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'Asian pear - peeled, cored, and coarsely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'peeled and coarsely chopped fresh ginger'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'low-sodium soy sauce, divided'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'rice wine'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'sesame oil, divided'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'carrots, peeled and cut in chunks'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'radishes, peeled and cut into chunks'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'bunch', 'Name': 'green onions, chopped, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'sesame seeds, or to taste'}]
directions: ['Soak ribs in a large bowl of water for 1 hour.', 'Meanwhile, combine Asian pear, onion, garlic, and ginger in a blender or food processor; purée until smooth. Transfer mixture to a mixing bowl. Mix in 3/4 cup soy sauce, rice wine, water, brown sugar, 1 tablespoon sesame oil, and pepper to create a sauce. Set aside.', "Drain ribs and dry them well. Trim off excess fat. Place ribs in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot), then add carrots and radishes. Pour Asian pear sauce on top. Close and lock the lid. Select Meat function according to manufacturer's instructions; set the timer for 35 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.", "Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Transfer meat and vegetables to a plate and set aside.", 'Select the Sauté function on your Instant Pot. Stir in white sugar, remaining 1/4 cup soy sauce, and remaining 1 tablespoon sesame oil. Cook, stirring occasionally, until sugar has melted and sauce has thickened, about 10 minutes. Return ribs and vegetables to the pot; stir to coat with sauce.', 'Garnish ribs and vegetables with green onions and sesame seeds.']

title: Green Goddess Chicken and Cucumber Wraps Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '2'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(7 inch)', 'Name': 'spinach herb tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'leaf', 'Name': 'lettuce leaves'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(1 ounce) slices', 'Name': 'mozzarella'}, {'Quantity': '2/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cooked chicken breast'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cucumber'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'avocado'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'thin slice', 'Name': 'sweet onion'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'green goddess salad dressing,'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onion leaves'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'grape tomatoes'}]
directions: ['For each wrap, place a tortilla on a flat work surface and cover half the tortilla surface with a piece of leaf lettuce. Top lettuce with 1 mozzarella slice, and distribute 1/3 cup shredded chicken\xa0over cheese.', 'Cut cucumber in half crosswise. Cut one half into 6 to 8 cucumber spears, and set aside. Use a vegetable peeler to shave remaining half of cucumber into very thin pieces, avoiding seeds. Place 1/2 of shaved cucumber on top of chicken.', 'Add half the avocado slices and half the sweet onion rings. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon green goddess dressing. Begin rolling the tortilla from the filled edge to the unfilled edge. Roll wrap in a paper towel to mold. Meanwhile, repeat steps with remaining ingredients for second wrap.', 'Release first wrap from paper towel and tie closed with a green onion leaf or chive. Release and tie second wrap.', 'To serve, place wraps on a bed of leaf lettuce. Lettuce leaves may be used for an optional outer wrap. Garnish with reserved cucumber spears and grape tomatoes.']

title: Ploughman’s Sandwich Recipe

title: Hotdog Roll-Ups Recipe

ingredients: [{'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '(1-ounce) slices', 'Name': 'white bread'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'yellow mustard'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'thin slices', 'Name': 'sharp Cheddar cheese'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'beef hot dogs'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'yellow onion'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons', 'Name': 'pickle relish'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'barbecue sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'mayonnaise'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'seasoned salt'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Using a rolling pin, roll each bread slice until entirely flat. Trim just the crust off each bread slice, forming a 4x4-inch square. Spread each bread slice with an even layer of mustard (about 3/4 teaspoon per slice).', 'Working with 1 slice of bread at a time, place a halved cheese slice on the edge of the bread closest to you; place 1 hot dog horizontally on top of the cheese slice. If needed, trim the ends of the hot dog so that no hot dog extends over edges of bread. Spoon 1 1/2 teaspoons onion horizontally across the cheese slice above the hot dog, followed by 1 teaspoon of relish.', "Roll up tightly, applying gentle pressure to help seal the bread seams together. Slice crosswise into 3 equal pieces (about 1 1/4-inches each), and transfer to a serving platter. Repeat process with remaining ingredients. Preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 5 minutes, or according to manufacturer's instructions. Lightly coat tops and sides of roll-ups with cooking spray. Working in 2 batches, add roll-ups to basket, spacing them 1/2-inch apart, and cook until bread is lightly golden brown, about 5 minutes.", 'Stir together barbecue sauce, mayonnaise, and seasoned salt in a small bowl until evenly combined.', 'Serve hotdog roll-ups with mayonnaise mixture.']

title: The Ultimate Pool Sandwich
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cool Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 Sandwiches'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'round', 'Name': 'bread loaf'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'yellow mustard'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'iceberg lettuce'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'deli ham'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'deli turkey'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'Swiss cheese'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'Cheddar or Colby Jack cheese'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Cut a wide circle out of the bread loaf top like you’re making a soup bread bowl. Carefully remove and set aside the loaf top.', 'Hollow out the bread interior, being careful not to break through the sides. The loaf interior can be used to make croutons, so there’s no waste.', 'Melt butter with mustard in the microwave for 15 seconds in a small bowl. Mix well.', 'Brush butter mixture onto the exterior of the bread loaf and top; place loaf and top on a baking sheet.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Let cool.', 'Pat lettuce dry and place a layer in the bottom of the hollowed-out loaf. Layer cheese over lettuce. Add a layer of ham and turkey. Repeat until the loaf is full. Top with reserved bread top.', 'Wrap sandwich in plastic wrap and put on a baking sheet. Place another baking sheet on top with something to weigh it down.', 'Place the completed sandwich on the baking sheet in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour or overnight.', 'Keep the sandwich whole or cut it into easy triangular sections.']

title: Asparagus and Eggs Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '1'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'garlic clove'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'asparagus stalks, trimmed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'red pepper flakes (optional)'}]
directions: ['Heat a small skillet over medium-high heat. Add olive oil and garlic; cook and stir until garlic is fragrant, about 30 seconds.', 'Add asparagus and cook until fork-tender, turning asparagus often to ensure even cooking, about 4 minutes.', 'Spread asparagus out and crack 2 eggs over the asparagus. Cover with lid and cook until egg whites are firm and yolk is done to desired consistency, about 4 minutes.', 'Season with salt and pepper; sprinkle with red pepper flakes and serve immediately.']

title: Crispy Tater Caesar Salad Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cool Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'chicken cutlets'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cooking spray'}, {'Quantity': '2 1/2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'Tater Tots'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'Parmesan cheese'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'Caesar dressing'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'fresh lemon zest'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'anchovy paste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garlic'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'omaine lettuce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'white balsamic vinegar'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Set 2 shelves near the center of the oven. Spray a baking pan with cooking spray; place frozen chicken filets on the pan.', 'Bake in the preheated oven on the lower-center shelf until hot and crisp, about 20 minutes, turning filets over halfway through heating time. When cool enough to handle, cut filets into bite-sized pieces.', 'Meanwhile, line a large rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper, and add tater tots in an even layer.', 'Bake on upper-center shelf in the preheated oven until tots are soft and slightly baked, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Spray cooking spray on the bottom of a cup. Smash each tater tot into a flat disk with cup.', 'Return to the oven; bake until golden brown and crispy, 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from oven again, and sprinkle with 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese.', 'Bake again until cheese is melted, about 1 minute. Set aside to cool, about 5 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, whisk Caesar dressing, lemon juice, anchovy paste, garlic, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, and salt together in a bowl until smooth.', 'Toss together lettuce, chicken, remaining 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese and remaining 1/4 teaspoon black pepper until well combined. Pour half the dressing into salad mix and toss until evenly coated. Add cooled tater tots and toss until well combined.', 'Transfer to a serving platter, drizzle with white balsamic vinegar, and garnish with more Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.']

title: Teriyaki Salmon Bowl Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '1'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'low-sodium soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'clove garlic, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'fresh ginger'}, {'Quantity': '1 (', 'Unit': '6 ounce', 'Name': 'salmon filet'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'grated carrots'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'radishes, thinly sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'red cabbage'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cooked rice'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'sesame seeds (optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onion, thinly sliced (optional)'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) and spray a baking dish with cooking spray.', 'Combine soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, and ginger in a small bowl. Place the salmon in the prepared baking dish, skin side down. Pour teriyaki sauce over.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, 12 to 15 minutes.', 'Place rice in a bowl, top with salmon, and spoon over teriyaki sauce from the baking dish. Add in the shredded cabbage, grated carrots, and radishes. Sprinkle with sliced green onions and sesame seeds, to garnish.']

title: Meatless Grain Bowl Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white rice'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'sweet potato, peeled and cubed'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'coconut oil or vegetable oil, or as needed, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'red bell pepper, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green bell pepper, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'orange bell pepper, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '14 ounce', 'Name': 'extra firm tofu'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce)', 'Name': 'can black beans, drained and rinsed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'jerk seasoning, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'jerk marinade'}]
directions: ['Bring water and rice to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and water has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes. Keep warm.', 'Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).', 'Toss cubed sweet potatoes in 1 tablespoon oil. Spread evenly on a baking sheet.', 'Roast sweet potatoes in the preheated oven until tender but not too soft, 15 to 20 minutes.', 'Heat a cast iron skillet with 1 tablespoon coconut oil over medium-high heat; add red, green, and orange bell peppers and saute for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from the skillet and set aside.', 'Add remaining 1 tablespoon coconut oil to the same skillet. Add tofu evenly. Cook for 2 minutes and gently flip to the other side. Continue cooking, turning occasionally, until tofu gets a little crisp on the edges, 6 to 8 minutes.', 'Add jerk marinade, being deliberate about making sure tofu is covered. Once tofu starts to caramelize from the marinade, remove from heat.', 'Warm black beans in a microwave-safe dish until hot, 2 to 3 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds.', 'Assemble grain bowls: divide rice, tofu, peppers, sweet potatoes, and black beans evenly into individual serving bowls.']

title: Miso Noodle Soup in a Jar Recipe

title: Croque Madame Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '2'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '2 sandwiches'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'salted butter, softened, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'shredded Gruyère cheese'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '⅛', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'white bread, lightly toasted'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'thin slices', 'Name': 'Black Forest ham'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chopped fresh dill, or to taste (Optional)'}]
directions: ["Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.", 'Melt 1 1/2 tablespoons butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Whisk in flour and stir until slightly brown, about 3 minutes. Whisk in milk; bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Once boiling, reduce heat immediately and simmer for 5 minutes. Add 1/2 of the Gruyère cheese, salt, pepper, and nutmeg; heat until cheese is melted, about 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside.', 'Spread about 1 teaspoon butter on 2 pieces of bread. Spread 1 tablespoon cheese sauce on top and layer each with a ham slice. Spread 1 teaspoon butter on the remaining 2 pieces of bread, then spread Dijon mustard on top and sprinkle with remaining Gruyère. Transfer all 4 pieces to a baking sheet.', 'Broil in the preheated oven until cheese is almost melted, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from the oven, place toast slices together to make 2 sandwiches and pour remaining cheese sauce on top of each sandwich. Return to the broiler until sauce starts to brown, about 2 minutes.', 'While the sandwiches are broiling, heat remaining butter in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Crack 2 eggs into the skillet, keeping them completely separate from one another. Season with salt and pepper. Add water, cover, and baste until whites are set but yolks are still runny, about 2 minutes.', 'Top each sandwich with an egg and sprinkle with dill, if using. Serve immediately.']

title: Delicious Egg Salad Recipe

title: Pasta Salad Recipe

title: Best Cream Of Broccoli Soup Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'stalk', 'Name': 'celery, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chicken broth'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'broccoli florets'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'ground black pepper to taste'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a medium stock pot over medium heat. title: Grilled Cheese Sandwich Recipe

title: Fresh Tomato Soup Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chopped fresh tomatoes'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chicken broth'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large slice', 'Name': 'of onion'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'white sugar, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt, or to taste'}]
directions: ['Gather the ingredients.', 'Combine tomatoes, chicken broth, garlic cloves, and a large slice of onion in a stockpot over medium heat. title: Egg Butter Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 cup'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'drops', 'Name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}]
directions: ['Place the eggs into a saucepan in a single layer and fill with water to cover the eggs by 1 inch. Cover the saucepan and bring the water to a boil over high heat. Once the water is boiling, remove from the heat and let the eggs stand in the hot water for 15 minutes. Cool the eggs under cold running water. Peel, and remove yolks from white. Chop yolks; reserve whites for another use.', 'Beat butter in a large bowl until soft and fluffy. Mix in the egg yolks, cayenne pepper, and Worcestershire sauce. Beat until smooth.']

title: Cucumber Soup with Tomatoes Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]

title: Yeast Dumplings Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(.25 ounce) envelope', 'Name': 'active dry yeast'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '4 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(32 ounce) carton', 'Name': 'chicken broth'}]
directions: ['Place milk and butter in a small saucepan, and simmer over medium heat until butter melts. Remove from the heat and allow to cool.', 'Dissolve the yeast in the warm water placed in a small bowl. Set aside.', 'Combine the eggs, sugar, and salt in a large mixing bowl, and mix until thoroughly blended. Gradually stir in the flour, alternating with milk and yeast mixtures. Gather the dough into a ball. Cover the bowl with a cloth, and let the dough rest 20 minutes.', 'Pour the chicken broth into a large pot. Bring broth to a boil over medium-high heat.', 'Meanwhile, sprinkle flour over a clean board or countertop. Turn the dough out onto the board and knead lightly until smooth and satiny, about 3 minutes. Add a little more flour if the dough is sticky. Roll out the dough to be about 1/2 inch thick. Use a butter knife to cut dough into 2 inch wide strips, and place strips into the boiling broth. Dumplings will initially sink, then rise to the surface when cooked, about 10 minutes. Remove dumplings from the broth with a slotted spoon, and drain on a plate.']

title: Fruity Chili Recipe

Allow to simmer another 1 to 2 minutes until hot.']

title: Grandma's Chicken Soup Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '4 hrs 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(5 pound)', 'Name': 'whole chicken'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'carrots, peeled and sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'celery, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'tomatoes, seeded and chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'bunch', 'Name': 'fresh dill'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '10', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'warm water as needed'}]
directions: ['Clean chicken, remove and discard some, but not all, fat. Place in a large saucepan with carrots, celery, tomatoes, and onion.', 'Tie dill sprigs into a bunch with kitchen twine. Add to the saucepan, and season with salt and pepper. Add water until chicken is covered by 2 inches.', 'Cook over medium-low heat until chicken is cooked through, about 3 hours. Remove chicken to a plate and allow to cool, 15 to 20 minutes.', 'Remove meat from bones, cut into bite-size pieces, and return to the saucepan. Discard bones. Cook over medium-low heat until heated through, about 30 minutes longer. Remove dill before serving.']

title: Campfire Bread on a Stick Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '16'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '16 rolls'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'active dry yeast'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water, or as needed'}]
directions: ['Combine flour, sugar, oil, yeast, and salt in a large bowl. Add 1 cup water and start kneading. Continue kneading and adding water until you get an even dough that is very slightly sticky. Knead dough for 10 more minutes, or longer if you have the time and patience.', 'Place dough in a lightly oiled bowl; cover and let rise in a warm area until doubled in volume, about 1 hour.', 'Have a few longish sticks or branches ready, about the thickness of a hotdog. Tear off a fistful of dough, roll it into a ball, then flatten it into a 4-inch round. Roll dough around the end of the stick, so the edges will overlap.', 'Put the dough end of the stick in the campfire. Try to find a hot area that is not actually burning. Cook, turning every so often, until bread is dark on the outside and slides easily off the stick, about 10 minutes.']

title: Super-Delicious Zuppa Toscana Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'bulk mild Italian sausage'}, {'Quantity': '1 ¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'crushed red pepper flakes'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'bacon, cut into ½-inch pieces'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'onion, diced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'minced garlic'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': '(13.75 ounce) cans', 'Name': 'chicken broth'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'potatoes, thinly sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'heavy cream'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'bunch', 'Name': 'fresh spinach, tough stems removed'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Cook Italian sausage and red pepper flakes in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat until crumbly, browned, and no longer pink, 10 to 15 minutes. Drain and set aside.', 'Cook bacon in the same Dutch oven over medium heat until crisp, about 10 minutes.', 'Drain, leaving a few tablespoons of drippings with the bacon in the bottom of the Dutch oven. Stir in onions and garlic; cook until onions are soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.', 'Stir in chicken broth and bring to a boil over high heat.', 'Add potatoes and simmer until fork tender, about 20 minutes.', 'Reduce heat to medium; stir in cream, cooked sausage, and spinach.', 'Cook and stir until spinach has wilted and sausage is warmed through; serve.']

title: Ukrainian Red Borscht Soup Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'Name': 'pork sausage'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'beets, peeled and shredded'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'carrots, peeled and shredded'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'baking potatoes, peeled and cubed'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'medium head', 'Name': 'cabbage, cored and shredded'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'diced tomatoes, drained'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(6 ounce) can', 'Name': 'tomato paste'}, {'Quantity': '8 ¾', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water, divided, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'white sugar, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sour cream, for topping'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'freshly chopped dill or parsley for garnish'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Crumble sausage into a skillet set over medium-high heat. Cook and stir until no longer pink. Remove from the heat and set aside.', 'Fill a large pot halfway with water (about 8 cups) and bring to a boil.', 'Add sausage to pot, cover pot, and return to a boil. Add beets and simmer for 10 minutes. Add carrots and potatoes and continue to cook until potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes more. Stir in cabbage and tomatoes.', 'Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Stir in tomato paste and remaining 3/4 cup water until well blended; transfer to the pot.', 'Add garlic to the soup, cover, and turn off the heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Stir in sugar and season with salt and pepper.', 'Ladle into serving bowls. Garnish with sour cream and dill. Enjoy!']

title: Baked Potato Soup Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '12', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'bacon'}, {'Quantity': '⅔', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '⅔', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '7', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'large baked potatoes, peeled and cubed'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onions, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1 ¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'shredded Cheddar cheese'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sour cream'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}]

title: Homemade Corn Dogs Recipe

title: Caldo de Pollo Recipe

ingredients: [{'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'chicken leg quarters'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'gallons', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'minced garlic'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'garlic powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cube', 'Name': 'chicken bouillon'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'carrots, peeled and cut into large chunks'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'potatoes, peeled and cut into large chunks'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'zucchini, cut into large chunks'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'chayote, cut into large chunks'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'white onion, cut into large chunks'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'bunch', 'Name': 'fresh cilantro, chopped'}]

title: Chef John's Creamy Mushroom Soup Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) packages', 'Name': 'sliced fresh mushrooms'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'yellow onion, diced'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'sprigs', 'Name': 'fresh thyme, tied in a bundle with kitchen twine'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, peeled'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chicken broth, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'heavy whipping cream'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'fresh thyme leaves for garnish, or to taste'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Melt butter in a large soup pot over medium-high heat. Sauté mushrooms and 1 pinch salt in the melted butter until mushrooms release their juices, 5 to 10 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low and continue to cook, stirring often, until juices evaporate and mushrooms are caramelized, 15 to 25 minutes. Set aside a few attractive mushroom slices for garnish later, if desired.', 'Add onion to the mushrooms; cook until onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.', 'Stir flour into the mushroom mixture and cook, stirring often, to remove the raw flour taste, about 2 minutes.', 'Add thyme bundle and garlic cloves, then pour in 4 cups chicken broth and 1 cup water. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour. Remove and discard thyme bundle.', 'Purée soup with a blender in batches until smooth and thick.', 'Stir in cream. If too thick, add a little chicken broth or water. Season with salt and black pepper.', 'Ladle into bowls, and garnish with reserved mushroom slices and thyme leaves.']

title: Broccoli Cheese Soup Recipe

ingredients: [{'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'Name': 'frozen chopped broccoli'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '(14.5 ounce) cans', 'Name': 'chicken broth'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(1 pound) loaf', 'Name': 'processed cheese food, cubed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'garlic powder'}, {'Quantity': '⅔', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}]

title: Pasta Salad with Homemade Dressing Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'Name': 'uncooked tri-color rotini pasta'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'pepperoni sausage, diced'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'provolone cheese, cubed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'red onion, very thinly sliced and cut into 1-inch pieces'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'cucumber, thinly sliced'}, {'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped green bell pepper'}, {'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped red bell pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(6 ounce) can', 'Name': 'pitted black olives, drained'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'minced fresh parsley'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'grated Parmesan cheese'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add rotini and cook until tender yet firm to the bite, 8 to 10 minutes. Add pepperoni, provolone cheese, red onion, cucumber, bell peppers, olives, parsley, and Parmesan cheese.', 'Mix olive oil, vinegar, garlic, basil, oregano, ground mustard, salt, and pepper for dressing in a jar with a lid. title: Day-After-Thanksgiving Turkey Carcass Soup Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'picked-over turkey carcass'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'leftover stuffing'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, peeled and diced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'carrots, peeled and sliced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'celery stalks, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'poultry seasoning'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground sage'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bay leaves'}, {'Quantity': '2 ½', 'Unit': 'quarts', 'Name': 'chicken broth'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water, or as needed (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garlic salt, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'ground black pepper, to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': '(uncooked) regular long-grain white rice'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'Name': 'frozen green peas'}]
directions: ['Place turkey carcass in a large, deep pot. Add stuffing, onion, carrots, celery, poultry seasoning, sage, and bay leaves.', 'Pour in chicken broth. Add additional water if needed to cover. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium and simmer, skimming off any foam, for about 1 hour.', 'Remove carcass and any bones. title: Beet Salad with Goat Cheese Recipe
