Cook and stir until chilies begin to soften and shrimp start to turn opaque and pink, about 2 minutes. Pour in water and soy sauce. Cook and stir until okra is tender and sticky, 2 to 4 more minutes.']

title: Chicken with Black Beans Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'light soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breast meat - cubed'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(2 inch) pieces', 'Name': 'fresh ginger, cut into matchsticks'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'fermented black beans, rinsed and mashed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'red bell pepper, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green bell pepper, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onions, cut into 1-inch pieces'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'carrot, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'oyster sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'thick soy sauce'}]
directions: ['Whisk together light soy sauce, cornstarch, 1 teaspoon sugar, and pepper in a large glass or ceramic bowl. Add chicken and toss to evenly coat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 10 minutes.', 'Heat water in a large skillet over medium-high heat until boiling. Quickly stir in chicken mixture and cook for 3 to 4 minutes; chicken will not be cooked through. Drain water and place chicken on a plate; set aside. Carefully wipe down the skillet.', 'Heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Cook and stir ginger and garlic in hot oil until fragrant, about 1 minute. Return chicken to the skillet and stir in black beans and 1 tablespoon sugar. Cook chicken, stirring occasionally, until no longer pink in the center, about 10 minutes. Stir in red and green bell peppers, green onions, carrot, oyster sauce, and thick soy sauce. Cook and stir until heated through, about 1 minute.']

title: Malaysian Flatbread (Roti Canai) with Curried Lentil Dip
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '8 hrs 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '10 hrs 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'bread flour'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'egg, beaten'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'unsalted butter, melted'}, {'Quantity': '1 ¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}]
directions: ['Combine bread flour, sugar, kosher salt, egg, melted butter, and water for roti canai in a mixing bowl. Mix with your hands until a shaggy dough forms. Transfer to a work surface and knead until a smooth, elastic dough forms, about 7 minutes.', 'Divide dough into 8 equal pieces and form each one into a ball. Coat each ball with vegetable oil, transfer to a plate, and cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 8 hours, to overnight.', 'Melt butter for dip in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion, ginger, garlic, kosher salt, curry powder, paprika, cumin, black pepper, and cayenne pepper; stir together and saute until onion has softened and spices are fragrant, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in tomato paste and cook until it starts to toast and caramelize on the bottom of the pan, about 3 minutes.', 'Stir in cold water and coconut milk. Add lentils; stir and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 40 minutes. Taste and adjust seasonings. Reduce heat to low and keep warm while you prepare the roti canai.', 'Place 1/4 cup melted butter in a bowl. Transfer rested dough balls onto a lightly oiled work surface. Flatten each ball slightly and rub a little melted butter on top. Cover dough with plastic wrap and let it warm up slightly, about 10 minutes.', "Press on top of the plastic wrap to flatten warmed dough. Remove plastic wrap and add a bit more butter. Stretch each piece from the center out to get it as thin as possible (until almost see-through), adding more butter as needed. Don't worry if there are a few small tears.", 'Sprinkle on more melted butter, then pull two sides in towards the center until touching and overlapping slightly. Pull the other two edges in the same way to form a square. Cover with plastic wrap and flatten roti canai one more time.', 'Add some melted butter to a skillet set over medium or medium-low heat. Add roti canai and cook until browned, flaky, and crispy on the outside and fully cooked through on the inside, 3 to 4 minutes per side.', 'Remove from the skillet and smush it with your hands to fluff it up and separate the layers of dough. Repeat to cook remaining roti canai.', 'Sprinkle the curried red lentil dip with cilantro and sliced serrano peppers and serve alongside the roti canai.']

title: Durian Puree Cheesecake Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '12', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'cream cheese, room temperature'}, {'Quantity': '7', 'Unit': 'fluid ounces', 'Name': 'sweetened condensed milk'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'puréed fresh durian'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sour cream'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'durian or banana extract'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(9-inch)', 'Name': 'prepared graham cracker crust'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (170 degrees C).', 'If not using canned or frozen durian purée, cut into husk of durian fruit and remove one segment of pulpy inner flesh. Place in a bowl and use a fork to mash flesh. Reserve 1/4 cup.', 'Beat cream cheese until fluffy. Add condensed milk and continue beating until smooth. Beat in puréed durian, eggs, sour cream, vanilla extract, and durian or banana extract. Pour batter into prepared graham cracker crust.', 'Bake 1 hour or until filling is set and edges are lightly browned. Serve warm or chill overnight in the refrigerator.']

title: Malaysian Red Curry Thighs Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onions, white parts only, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(2 inch) piece', 'Name': 'peeled fresh ginger'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'peeled garlic'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'grapeseed oil'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'skin-on, bone-in chicken thighs'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt to taste'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'hot curry powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'red curry paste'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'garam masala'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'Chinese five-spice powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(14 ounce) can', 'Name': 'coconut milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'fish sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'white sugar, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'Sriracha sauce (Optional)'}]
directions: ['Place green onions, ginger, and garlic in the bowl of a food processor; pulse until smooth.', 'Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Season chicken thighs with salt; cook, skin-side down, until browned, about 10 minutes per side. Remove from skillet.', 'Add green onion purée to the skillet; cook, stirring constantly, 2 to 3 minutes. Add curry powder, red curry paste, garam masala, and Chinese five-spice powder; cook and stir until fragrant. Pour in coconut milk; stir while scraping the browned bits of food off the bottom of the skillet with a wooden spoon. Add fish sauce and 3/4 teaspoon sugar. Taste; adjust salt and sugar and stir in Sriracha sauce.', 'Return chicken thighs to the skillet, reduce heat, and simmer until flavors are combined, about 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted near but not touching the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).']

title: Malaysian Mango Chicken Curry Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '2'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breast, cubed'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chicken stock'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'cider vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'curry powder'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, diced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green bell pepper, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'red bell pepper, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'minced fresh ginger root'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'mango, peeled and cubed'}]
directions: ['Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat and stir in chicken breast. Cook and stir chicken in hot oil until no longer pink in the center. title: Pumpkin Kaya Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '40'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '40 servings'}]

title: Chicken Curry V Recipe

title: Sherry Chicken Curry Recipe

title: Chicken Singapore Noodles Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'dry Chinese egg noodle nests'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'peanut oil'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'slivered fresh ginger'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'crushed red pepper flakes'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breast halves'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'green onions, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '⅔', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'julienned carrot'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(8 ounce) can', 'Name': 'sliced water chestnuts, drained'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) cans', 'Name': 'whole straw mushrooms, drained'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'peanut butter'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'oyster sauce'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'curry powder'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}]

Cook and stir until the chicken is no longer pink, about 5 minutes. title: Chicken Curry III Recipe

title: Rendang Gaging (Beef Stew) Recipe

title: Malaysian Chicken Curry Recipe

title: Malaysian Chicken Satay Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 day'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 day 50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '60'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '60 skewers'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4 ½', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'onions, coarsely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': '1-inch piece shrimp paste (belachan)'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'galangal powder (lengkuas)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground anise seed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': '60', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bamboo skewers'}]
directions: ['Place chicken cubes in a large bowl.', 'Place onions, brown sugar, garlic, shrimp paste, galangal powder, coriander, cumin, anise seed, black pepper, and turmeric in the bowl of a food processor. Grind into a smooth paste. Transfer to bowl with chicken; mix well to coat chicken.', 'Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 24 hours.', "Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Line 2 baking sheets with aluminum foil.", 'Thread chicken onto bamboo skewers, leaving enough space to hold skewers. Arrange skewers on baking sheets.', 'Broil in the preheated oven until top is browned, about 10 minutes. Remove from oven; flip all the skewers over. Return to the oven and broil second side until browned, about 10 minutes more. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).']

title: Mild Coconut Tofu Curry Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'fresh ginger root'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cashews'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'stalks', 'Name': 'lemon grass, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onions, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'dash', 'Name': 'crushed red pepper flakes'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'curry powder'}, {'Quantity': '2 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'cubed firm tofu'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(14 ounce) can', 'Name': 'coconut milk'}, {'Quantity': '14', 'Unit': 'fluid ounces', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'medium potatoes, peeled and cubed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'white sugar'}]
directions: ['In a blender or food processor, grind the ginger root, garlic, cashews, lemon grass, and onions into a paste.', 'Heat olive oil in a medium wok over low heat. Stir in the blended mixture and red pepper flakes. Gradually mix in the curry powder.', 'Place tofu in the wok, and cook until heated through. Mix in the coconut milk, water, and potatoes. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are tender. Season with salt and sugar.']

title: Simple Malaysian Fried Chicken Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 to 6 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(4 pound)', 'Name': 'whole chicken, cut into pieces'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'oyster sauce'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'curry powder'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}]
directions: ['To Marinate: In a nonporous glass dish or bowl, combine the garlic, oyster sauce and curry powder. Mix together. Add chicken pieces and turn to coat. Cover dish or bowl and refrigerate to marinate for at least 1/2 hour.', 'In a large skillet or wok, heat oil over medium high heat. Add marinated chicken (disposing of leftover marinade) and fry for 20 to 25 minutes or until chicken is crispy and brown and juices run clear.']

title: Spicy Noodles - Malay Style Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'Name': 'uncooked egg noodles'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'finely chopped garlic'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'bunch', 'Name': 'fresh spinach, stems removed, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chile paste'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'ketchup'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'egg'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'fresh bean sprouts'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'green peas'}]
directions: ['Bring a large pot of water to a boil, cook the egg noodles 6 to 8 minutes, until al dente, and drain.', 'Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat, and saute the garlic about 1 minute. Stir in the spinach, and cook about 1 minute. Mix in the cooked egg noodles, chile paste, and ketchup, and toss until well coated.', 'Make a hole in the center of the noodle mixture. Place the egg in the center, and scramble, tossing with the noodles just before egg is finished cooking.', 'Mix the sugar and enough water to keep the mixture moist into the skillet. Season with salt and pepper. Continue to cook, stirring constantly, about 6 minutes. Toss in the sprouts and peas, and cook and stir about 4 minutes, until heated through.']

title: Easy Creamy Crockpot Chicken Enchilada Casserole Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'boneless chicken breasts'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garlic powder'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'tomatillo salsa or green enchilada sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sour cream'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '(6 inch)', 'Name': 'corn tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'pepper Jack cheese,'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salsa,'}]
directions: ['Place chicken in crockpot and season with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and chili powder. Pour over salsa verde or enchilada sauce; cover and cook on High for 2 hours or Low for 3 1/2 hours.', 'Shred chicken and stir in sour cream. Reserve 1/4 of the tortillas and stir in remaining tortilla pieces along with 1 1/4 cups cheese. Top with reserved tortilla triangles and remaining cheese.\xa0 Cover and cook on High for 1 hour.', 'Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serve topped with desired toppings.']

title: Shrimp Fajita Rice Casserole Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cooking spray'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'red bell pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'yellow bell pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'poblano pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'onion'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'dried oregano'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'shrimp'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(14.5 ounce) cans', 'Name': 'fire roasted diced tomatoes'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white rice'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'sliced avocado'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'sour cream, as needed'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lime wedges'}]

Coat a 2-quart baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.', 'Heat oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add peppers and onion. Cook and stir until fragrant, 1 minute.', 'Stir together pepper mixture, shrimp, undrained tomatoes, and rice in a large bowl. Transfer to prepared baking dish. Cover tightly with foil.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until heated through, about 20 minutes.', 'Top servings with avocado, sour cream, and cilantro. Serve with lime wedges.']

title: Slow Cooker Chicken Enchilada Casserole Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs 40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'skinless boneless chicken thighs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15-ounce) can', 'Name': 'black beans'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'corn'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'onion'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic,'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(10-ounce) cans', 'Name': 'enchilada sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(8-ounce) package', 'Name': 'Mexican blend cheese,'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '(6-inch)', 'Name': 'corn tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'iceberg or Romaine lettuce'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'fresh tomato'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'chopped green onion'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'sour cream'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Combine chicken, beans, corn, onion, garlic, salt, pepper, and cumin in a 3 1/2- to 4-quart slow cooker. Cover with enchilada sauce.', 'Cover and cook for 3 to 4 hours on High or 6 to 7 hours on Low.', 'Shred chicken in the slow cooker using two forks.', 'Stir in half the cheese and the tortillas. Top with remaining cheese.', 'Cover and cook on High until tortillas are softened and cheese is melted, 30 minutes.', 'Top servings with lettuce, tomato, green onion, and sour cream.']

title: Beef Birria Ramen Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Soak Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs 50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '10', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'chilies, seeded'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'chilies'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'water,'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'avocado oil'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'white onion'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'garlic cloves,'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'Roma tomatoes'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'peppercorns'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'whole', 'Name': 'cloves'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(1/2 inch) piece', 'Name': 'dried ginger root'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cumin seeds'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'fresh thyme'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'dried marjoram'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'oregano'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'chicken bouillon, such as'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'apple cider vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt to taste'}]
directions: ['For sauce base, first toast chilies: heat a dry griddle or skillet over medium heat. Toast guajillo chilies and chiles de arbol, turning often, until fragrant and lightly browned, being careful not to burn them. Place chilies in a bowl, cover them with boiling water, and soak until reconstituted, about 30 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, heat oil over medium heat in a large pan. Add onion and garlic; cook and stir\xa0until soft, about 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook until they break down, about 5 minutes.\xa0Let the mixture cool.', 'Place peppercorns, cloves, dried ginger, cumin seeds, thyme, marjoram, and oregano in a mortar and grind into a fine mix.', 'In a blender, combine soaked chilies, 1/4 cup of the chile soaking liquid, onion-tomato mix, ground spices, chicken bouillon, and apple cider vinegar. Blend until smooth. Add a small amount of beef broth if needed for blending. Taste sauce; season with salt.', 'To cook meat, place chuck roast, beef shanks, and beef short ribs in a large pot and pour the sauce over it. Add enough beef broth to cover meat by about 1 inch, then stir to combine. Bring to a boil over high heat, then add cinnamon stick, onion, garlic, and bay leaves. Cover, and reduce heat to low, and simmer until meat is tender and falling apart, about 2 1/2 hours. Remove and discard short rib bones; skim fat from surface of broth using a spoon. Reserve fat for another use, such as quesabirrias. Taste broth; season with salt.', 'Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil, add ramen, and cook until tender, 7 to 20 minutes, or according to package instructions. Drain; divide noodles into bowls.', 'To assemble the dish, ladle birria and broth over ramen. Top with chopped onion and cilantro. Serve with lime wedges.']

title: Crispy Turkey Flautas
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '3 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '28 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '12 large turkey flautas'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'cooked, shredded turkey'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'shredded pepper Jack cheese'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped green onions'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '24', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'small white corn tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'egg white to seal flautas (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'shredded napa cabbage'}, {'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'guacamole'}, {'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sour cream'}, {'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'salsa'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}]
directions: ['Mix shredded turkey, pepper Jack cheese, green onions, salt and pepper together in a bowl.', 'Wrap stack of tortillas in a paper towel and place in a sealable plastic bag. Seal the bag only halfway. Microwave on high until tortillas are hot and flexible, about 45 seconds. Keep tortillas warm in the bag as you fill the others.', 'Place 2 tortillas on a work surface, one about 2 inches off center of the first creating a longer partially double tortilla. Spoon about 1/4 to 1/3 cup turkey mixture in a row just below the center of the long side of the tortilla. Paint a bit of egg white along the top edge of the tortillas. Bring bottom edge of the tortilla up and over the filling and roll rather tightly toward the top edge over the egg white. Set aside with the fold on the bottom while you fill the remaining tortillas.', 'Place 1/4 inch vegetable oil in a saute pan over medium heat. When oil is hot, place flautas in oil, seam side down. Press down gently with a spatula a couple of seconds to flatten bottoms. Fry in batches until flautas are crispy, golden, and heated through, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Drain about a minute on paper towels. Serve topped with shredded cabbage, guacamole, sour cream, salsa, and chopped cilantro.']

title: Chicken Adobo Tacos Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Marinate Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bay leaves'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'granulated garlic'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'skinless, boneless chicken thighs'}]
directions: ['Combine soy sauce, vinegar, bay leaves, and garlic in a large plastic bag with a zipper. Gently squeeze to mix well. Add chicken and coat with marinade. Squeeze out as much air from the bag as possible, coat all the chicken pieces with marinade, seal, and refrigerate for at least 20 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, combine vinegar, fish sauce, avocado oil, sugar, and black pepper in a bowl for the salsa. Stir with a whisk or fork until sugar is dissolved. Add mango, tomato, red onion, jalapeño, and chopped cilantro to the bowl. Toss to combine, and refrigerate salsa until ready to serve.', 'For tacos, remove chicken pieces from the marinade and reserve the marinade.', 'Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Carefully add the chicken thighs, and brown on each side, 1 to 2 minutes, then remove chicken to a plate.', 'To the same skillet, add onion, and cook for about 1 minute. Stir in minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add reserved marinade, water, brown sugar, and black pepper, and bring to a boil.', 'Return chicken to the skillet, smooth side down. Reduce heat to low, and simmer chicken uncovered, about 15 minutes. The liquid should bubble gently. Turn chicken and simmer 10 minutes more. Remove chicken from skillet to rest.', 'Cook sauce over medium heat until syrupy, thick, and reduced, about 10 minutes. Remove skillet from heat. Remove bay leaves and discard.', 'Slice chicken into 1/2-inch slices and return to the skillet to coat in the sauce. Garnish with fresh cilantro and chopped green onions, if desired.', 'Fill each tortilla with chicken strips and top with mango salsa. Serve immediately.']

title: Roscoe's Chilaquiles Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Soak Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'chile peppers'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'chile pepper,'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'Roma tomatoes'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'white onion'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'garlic cloves,'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'beef bouillon cube'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'culantro leaves'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lime, juiced'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}]
directions: ['For salsa roja, pour boiling water over peppers and let sit until softened, 15 to 30 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, add 2 tablespoons olive oil to a skillet over high heat, and sear tomatoes, onions, and garlic until charred for about 2 minutes.', 'Place softened peppers, charred vegetables, and 1 cup of the chile soaking water in a blender. Reserve remaining 3 cups chile water.\xa0 Blend until smooth. Strain the sauce; pour back into the pan.', 'Cook sauce over medium heat, scraping any charred bits from the bottom of the pan; add 2 cups of remaining chile water. Simmer until sauce is reduced by 1/3. Stir in bouillon cube and last 1 cup chile water, culantro leaves, lime juice; stir until bouillon cube dissolves. Season with salt and pepper.', 'For chilaquiles, heat oil to 350 degrees F ( 175 degrees C) in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add tortillas and fry until crisp and golden. 2 minutes per batch.', 'For each serving, heat 1 tablespoon oil in a small nonstick pan over medium heat. Crack an egg into the skillet, and cook until outer edges become opaque, about 1 minute. Turn egg over and cook until whites are completely opaque, 1 to 2 minutes more.', 'Add a handful of chips to the salsa roja, and turn to coat completely. Remove to a serving plate with a slotted spoon.', 'Drizzle with crema, top with an egg, cotija cheese, avocado, cilantro, squeeze of lime juice, and drizzle with more salsa roja. Sprinkle with oregano. Repeat with remaining ingredients.']

title: Taquito Casserole Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Stand Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cooking spray'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(19 ounce) can', 'Name': 'enchilada sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'Name': 'black beans drained and rinsed'}, {'Quantity': '2 1/2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'frozen corn'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(8.8 ounce) package', 'Name': 'white rice'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'red bell pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'red onion'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'heavy whipping cream'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(1 ounce) package', 'Name': 'taco seasoning'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '16', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided'}, {'Quantity': '20', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'beef and cheese flour tortilla taquitos'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sour cream'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'lime juice'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'pickling liquid from jarred pickled jalapenos'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'pickled jalapenos'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cilantro leaves'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly coat a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray; set aside.', 'Stir together enchilada sauce, beans, corn, rice, bell pepper, red onion, cream, taco seasoning, salt, paprika, cumin, and 3 cups shredded cheese in a large bowl until well combined.', 'Spread into the prepared baking dish in an even layer. Arrange taquitos evenly over rice mixture.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until taquitos are crispy and rice mixture is bubbling, about 40 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, whisk together sour cream, lime juice, and pickling liquid in a small bowl until smooth. Set aside, uncovered, at room temperature until ready to serve.', 'Remove baking dish from oven, and sprinkle evenly with remaining cheese. Top evenly with jalapeño slices. Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) until cheese is melted, about 8 minutes more.', 'Let stand for 10 minutes. Top evenly with cilantro leaves. Drizzle each serving with jalapeño crema.']

title: Rajas con Crema (Roasted Poblano Peppers in Cream Sauce) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cool Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'poblano peppers'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic'}, {'Quantity': '3/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'Mexican crema'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chicken bouillon granules'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'Oaxaca cheese'}]
directions: ['Place poblano chiles directly on the grates of a gas stove. Cook over medium heat, flipping with tongs occasionally, until blackened and charred, about 5 minutes. Place in a sealed plastic bag and allow to cool, 5 to 6 minutes. Peel off charred skins, remove seeds, and slice chiles into strips. Set aside.', 'Melt butter in a large skillet. Add onions and cook until soft and translucent, 6 to 7 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add poblano peppers, Mexican crema, salt, chicken bouillon, and pepper; cook and stir until combined. Turn off heat, add cheese, and stir until melted.']

title: Arroz Verde with Hatch Chiles Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cool Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green chiles'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(14 ounce) can', 'Name': 'chicken broth'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped cilantro'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'long grain rice'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'onion'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'garlic cloves'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'chicken bouillon'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/8', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}]
directions: ['Place Hatch chiles directly on the grates of a gas stove. Cook over medium heat, flipping with tongs occasionally, until blackened and charred, about 5 minutes. Place in a sealed plastic bag and allow to cool, 7 to 8 minutes.', 'Peel off charred skins; remove seeds. Place chiles, chicken broth and cilantro in the jar of a blender and blend until smooth. Set aside.', 'Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat until it shimmers; add rice and onion. Cook and stir until lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in chicken bouillon, salt, and cumin. Add chile mixture and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low; simmer until rice is tender, 25 to 30 minutes.']

title: Chicken Fajita Skillet Casserole Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'poblano peppers'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'orange bell pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'white onion'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garlic powder'}, {'Quantity': '3/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '2 1/2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(10 ounce) can', 'Name': 'diced tomatoes and green chiles'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chicken broth'}, {'Quantity': '2 1/2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'rotisserie chicken'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce)', 'Name': 'can pinto beans, drained and rinsed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'sharp Cheddar cheese'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'tortilla chips'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lettuce'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).', 'Heat oil in a large, oven proof skillet over medium-high heat. Add peppers and onions and cook, undisturbed, 5 minutes or until browned. Add chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt and pepper and continue cooking until vegetables are soft, stirring often, 1 to 2\xa0 minutes. Remove vegetables from the pan and set aside.', 'Add butter to the pan and melt over moderate heat. Whisk in flour and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add in tomatoes and broth and cook until thick and creamy, stirring constantly, about 3 minutes. Stir in chicken and beans. Top chicken mixture with 1 cup cheese. Spread reserved peppers and onions evenly over the cheese and top with chips and remaining cheese.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly and lightly browned on top, about 15\xa0 minutes. Serve with desired toppings.']

title: Beef Birria Queso Tacos with Consommé Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 tacos'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'reserved sauce from beef birria recipe'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chicken broth'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'diced carrots'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'diced celery'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'diced cabbage'}]
directions: ['Gather the ingredients.', 'To make the consommé: Stir beef birria sauce, chicken broth, carrots, celery, and cabbage together in a saucepan over high heat. Bring to a simmer, then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer, occasionally brushing the caramelized bits (fond) off the side with the hot liquid, until vegetables are nice and tender and consommé has reached the desired consistency, about 20 minutes. Reduce the heat to low and keep hot while you prepare the tacos.', 'To make the tacos: Heat some reserved beef fat in a large skillet over medium heat until melted. Add two tortillas and flip with a spatula until generously coated in fat. Toast briefly until golden brown, then cover with Monterey Jack cheese and some shredded beef.', 'Drizzle each taco with about 1 tablespoon consommé liquid, then top with some white onion and cilantro.', 'Fold tacos in half and press gently. Continue to cook, flipping back and forth, until browned and crispy, 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer to a plate and repeat to make remaining tacos, adding more fat if necessary.', 'Ladle consommé into a bowl and garnish with any remaining white onion and cilantro. Squeeze lime wedges into consommé and serve with tacos.', 'Enjoy!']

title: Chicken Chalupas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'baking powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'whole milk'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter'}]
directions: ['To make the chalupa shells, combine flour, baking powder, and salt in a medium mixing bowl. Stir well to combine the dry ingredients.', 'Gradually pour in milk, while stirring, until you need to use your hand to knead. Add in the melted butter, and knead well.', 'Shape dough into 6 equal balls. Sprinkle flour over a work surface and flour the rolling pin. Roll each dough ball into about a 7-inch circle, moving the dough a quarter turn after a couple of passes with the rolling pin. Add more flour to the work surface and rolling pin if dough sticks.', 'Keep rolled dough circles under a clean, damp kitchen towel until ready to fry.', 'Set up stations of chopped lettuce, chopped tomatoes, shredded cheese, and any optional toppings you plan to use, and place in a convenient array for assembling the chalupas.', 'Microwave refried beans on medium setting until soft and spreadable, about 1 minute, and add as the first station to your other ingredients.', 'Warm shredded chicken briefly in the microwave or in a skillet, and toss with taco seasoning mix, and add as the second station to the other ingredients.', 'To fry chalupa shells, add cooking oil to a depth of about 1/4-inch to a large, nonstick skillet. Heat oil over medium heat, and when the oil is hot, fry one side of one dough circle until lightly brown, about 1 minute.Using tongs, lift the partially cooked shell from the skillet and place only half of the uncooked side into the oil. Carefully hold half of the shell away from the oil, until the first half is browned, about 1 minute, then brown the other half. Repeat until all the shells are done.', 'To keep the bent shape, place fried chalupa shells into a taco holder until ready to fill.', 'To serve, spread each chalupa shell with about 2 tablespoons refried beans, and fill with 2 or 3 tablespoons seasoned shredded chicken. Fill with lettuce, tomatoes, and cheese.', 'Garnish with optional toppings, such as pico de gallo, sour cream, and sliced avocados, if desired. Serve immediately.']

title: Chilaquiles Breakfast Casserole Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(20 ounce) can', 'Name': 'enchilada sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'tomato salsa'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'green chilies'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lime, juiced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'dried oregano'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'green onions'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).', 'Add enchilada sauce, salsa, Hatch chilies, lime juice, chili powder, cumin, oregano, and green onions to a bowl and whisk thoroughly.', 'Toss Monterey Jack and Cheddar cheeses together; set aside.', 'Transfer 1 ladle of sauce into the bottom of a 9x12-inch baking dish. Top with half the chips, arranging into an even layer. Ladle over half the remaining sauce. Top evenly with half the cheese mixture.', 'Top with remaining chips, arranging into an even layer. Ladle over remaining sauce. Top evenly with the remaining cheese mixture.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until the casserole is heated through and cheese is starting to brown, 20 to 25 minutes.', "In the last few minutes of baking time, prepare the eggs by frying or poaching, or bake them on top of the casserole as shown in the video. See Chef's Note for directions.", 'Serve casserole hot, topped with avocado, queso fresco, cilantro, sour cream, and hot sauce. Add a fried or poached egg to the top of each serving.']

title: Creamy Mississippi Chicken Enchiladas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Stand Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'boneless chicken breasts'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(1 ounce) package', 'Name': 'dry ranch dressing mix'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'pepperoncini peppers'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'pepper juice'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'cream cheese'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sour cream'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'shredded Monterey Jack cheese'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '(10 inch)', 'Name': 'flour tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'heavy cream'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'sliced green onions'}]
directions: ['Place chicken, ranch dressing mix, pepperoncini, pepper juice, butter, and water, in that order, into a slow cooker. Cook on High for 2 hours or Low for 3 1/2 hours until chicken easily shreds with a fork.', 'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (1 degrees C). Remove half of the liquid in the slow cooker and discard. Shred chicken in the remaining liquid. Stir in cream cheese and sour cream.', 'Place about 1/2 cup chicken mixture and 2 tablespoons cheese in each tortilla and roll to seal. Place seam side down in a 9x13-inch casserole dish. Top with remaining cheese and pour heavy cream evenly over the top.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until browned around the edges and bubbly, about 30 minutes. Let stand for 5 to 10 minutes before serving. Top with green onions and pico de gallo.']

title: Beef Enchilada Bake Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'bell pepper, any color, diced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'ground beef'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'Name': 'chili beans'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'Name': 'enchilada sauce, divided'}, {'Quantity': '12', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'corn tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '12', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'exican blend shredded cheese'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cilantro, for garnish (optional)'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'sour cream, for garnish (optional)'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).', 'Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add olive oil, then add onions. Sauté until onions just start to soften, 2 to 3 minutes. Add bell pepper; sauté 1 to 2 minutes. Add garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 1 minute.', 'Add ground beef; cook, breaking up beef with a spatula, until browned and crumbly, about 10 minutes. Drain any grease. Stir in chili beans. Season with salt, black pepper, and cumin. Stir in 1 cup enchilada sauce, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, spread remaining enchilada sauce evenly in the bottom of a 10x8-inch baking dish.', 'Using a sharp knife, carefully cut a straight edge off one side of the tortillas. Place 4 tortillas with the cut edge facing the sides of the dish.', 'Spread half of the beef mixture over tortillas and top with 3 ounces cheese. Add another layer of tortillas, then beef mixture and 3 ounces cheese to create the second layer. Repeat layers ending with remaining cheese. Cover with foil.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Remove foil; bake until cheese is lightly browned, 5 to 10 minutes more. Remove from the oven; allow to rest for 5 to 10 minutes before serving. Garnish with sour cream and chopped cilantro if desired.']

title: Strawberry Tres Leches Cake Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cool Time:', 'Value': '4 hrs 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '5 hrs 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 cake'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'baking spray'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'baking powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs, at room temperature'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'granulated sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'whole milk, at room temperature'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly spray a 13- x 9-inch baking dish with baking spray; set aside.', 'Whisk together flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat eggs, sugar, and vanilla on medium speed until light, fluffy, and almost doubled in volume, about 10 minutes.', 'Beat in half of the flour mixture on low speed until just incorporated. Gradually stream in the milk until combined, followed by the remaining flour mixture. Transfer batter to prepared baking dish.', 'Bake in preheated oven until golden brown and a wooden skewer inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean, 25 to 30 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool on a wire rack in the pan for 20 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, for the strawberry milk toss strawberries and sugar in a small bowl until fully coated, let rest at room temperature for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Transfer to a blender and process until smooth, about 30 seconds. Strain puree through a fine mesh sieve into a large bowl, discarding any pulp or seeds. Whisk together 1 cup of the strained strawberry puree (reserving any remaining for a later use), evaporated milk, condensed milk, and heavy cream into a large bowl until fullycombined.', 'Using a wooden skewer or the tines of a fork, poke holes all over the top of the cooled Cake, pour strawberry ,ilk mixture evenly over cake. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or up to 12 hours.', 'Top with a layer of whipped topping and sliced strawberries before serving.']

title: Black Bean Casserole Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 (8-inch square) casserole'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'nonstick cooking spray'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped white onion'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'red bell pepper, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'minced, seeded jalapeño'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) cans', 'Name': 'black beans, drained and rinsed'}, {'Quantity': '2/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'jarred medium picante sauce or chunky salsa (such as Pace)'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'Name': 'sweet whole kernel corn, drained and rinsed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped, seeded tomato'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'Monterey Jack cheese, shredded'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'Cheddar cheese, shredded'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'thinly sliced green onions'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lime wedges, cilantro leaves, sour cream, salsa, warm corn or flour tortillas, or tortilla chips, for serving'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Coat an 8x8-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, bell pepper, and jalapeño; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and slightly browned, 5 to 7 minutes.', 'Stir in beans, picante sauce, water, salt, cumin, cayenne pepper, and smoked paprika. Mash beans using the back of a spoon or a potato masher until mixture is slightly thickened. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Simmer, undisturbed, until sauce thickens and bubbles appear all over the surface, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in corn.', 'Transfer mixture to the prepared baking dish, and sprinkle with tomato, Monterey Jack cheese and Cheddar cheese. Cover with aluminum foil.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until casserole is hot and cheeses are melted, 25 to 30 minutes. Sprinkle with green onions. Let cool slightly before serving.', 'Serve with lime wedges, cilantro, sour cream, salsa, warm tortillas, or tortilla chips, if desired. Enjoy!']

title: Air Fryer Chicken Quesadillas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 quesadillas'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'shredded cooked chicken'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '(8 inch)', 'Name': 'flour tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'grated cheese (see Note)'}, {'Quantity': '16', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'wooden toothpicks'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'olive oil cooking spray'}]
directions: ['Preheat an air fryer to 360 degrees F (180 degrees C), according to manufacturer’s guidelines. Toss chicken with chili powder, cumin, and cayenne in a bowl.', 'Place a tortilla on a work surface and cover half the tortilla with about 2 tablespoons grated cheese. Top with 2 tablespoons chicken mixture, then top with 2 additional tablespoons grated cheese.', 'Fold tortilla in half and use wooden picks to hold the tortilla halves together. Spray both sides of the filled tortilla with olive oil spray.', 'Air fry quesadillas in a single layer until tortillas are lightly browned and cheese is melted, about 4 minutes per side. You may have to cook in batches. Serve warm with your favorite toppings.']

title: Trout Tacos Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 tacos'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '16', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'white corn tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'purple cabbage'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onions'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'coleslaw mix'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'Mexican crema'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'lime zest'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lime wedges as needed, divided'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'cilantro leaves'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'filets', 'Name': 'trout'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon', 'Name': 'tapioca starch'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'chipotle powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'Mexican oregano'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'prepared guacamole, or as needed'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Wrap tortillas in foil.', 'Bake tortillas in the preheated oven until warm, 8 to 10 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, place cabbage, white parts of green onion, coleslaw mix, 3 tablespoons Mexican crema, lime zest, juice of 2 lime wedges, and cilantro in a large bowl. Toss to coat; season with salt and pepper. Set aside..', 'Carefully remove skin from trout. Cut each trout filet into 2- to 3-inch pieces. Stir tapioca starch, cumin, chipotle powder, and Mexican oregano together in a shallow bowl.', 'Dip fish pieces into seasoning mixture to coat.', 'Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add coated fish pieces; cook until golden brown and fish flakes easily with a fork, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Transfer to a drip tray, and season with salt.', 'Using 2 corn tortillas for each taco, divide fish, slaw, and guacamole between the tacos. Garnish each with green tops of scallions. Serve with remaining lime wedges and crema on the side. Enjoy!']

title: Air Fryer Quesadillas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '2'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'flour tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'shredded cheese'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'nonstick cooking spray'}]
directions: ['Heat tortillas in the microwave until pliable, about 15 seconds.', 'Place 1/4 cup cheese on one half of each tortilla; fold other half of tortilla over cheese. Place in\xa0 air fryer. Spray with non-stick cooking spray.', 'Set temperature to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Place quesadillas in the basket of the air fryer, and cook until golden brown, 4 to 6 minutes. Flip quesadillas, press down with a spatula, and air fry an additional 2 to 3 minutes.']

title: Pork Chile Verde Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '4 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '4 hrs 45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'fresh tomatillos, or more to taste, husks removed'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'serrano peppers'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, peeled'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'lard or vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'pork shoulder, or more to taste, trimmed and cut into 1 ½-inch cubes'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'garlic salt'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'yellow onion, coarsely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green bell pepper, coarsely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'red wine'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'low-sodium chicken stock'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'dried oregano'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Combine tomatillos, serrano peppers, and garlic in a bowl. Drizzle with olive oil and toss to coat. Transfer to a baking sheet.', 'Place in the preheated oven and roast until tender, about 30 minutes. Remove vegetables from oven, cool slightly, and transfer to the bowl of a food processor. Puree until smooth. Reduce oven temperature to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C).', 'While vegetables are roasting, heat lard in a Dutch oven or heavy oven-safe pot over medium-high heat. Sprinkle pork with garlic salt and pepper and add to the pot in batches. Cook each batch until browned, about 7 minutes, removing to a plate with a slotted spoon. Drain and discard all but 2 tablespoons pan drippings.', 'Add onion and bell pepper to the pot. Sauté, stirring occasionally, until onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes. Pour wine into the pan and bring to a boil while scraping the browned bits of food off the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon. Stir in browned pork, tomatillo puree, chicken stock, cilantro, oregano, cumin, and salt.', 'Cover and cook in the oven until pork is tender, 3 ½ to 4 hours. Allow to stand for 15 minutes, covered, before serving.']

title: Sheet Pan Quesadillas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green bell pepper, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'red bell pepper, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breast, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(1.12 ounce) package', 'Name': 'fajita seasoning mix'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'flour tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'shredded Mexican cheese blend'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'sour cream, for serving'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'pico de gallo, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chopped fresh cilantro, for garnish'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).', 'Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and bell peppers and cook until they are just beginning to soften, about 2 minutes. Remove from skillet with a slotted spoon and set aside.', 'Add chicken to the same skillet and cook until no longer pink on the outside, about 3 minutes. Return onion and bell peppers to the skillet. Stir in water and fajita seasoning. Cook and stir until the chicken has completely cooked through.', 'On a half sheet pan, place 6 tortillas around the edges of the pan so that about half of each tortilla hangs over the side. Place another tortilla in the center to cover the pan completely.', 'Using a slotted spoon, top with the chicken, onion, and pepper mixture in an even layer (being careful not to add too much liquid from the skillet). Finally, sprinkle cheese evenly over the chicken mixture.', 'Place another tortilla in the center on top of all fillings, then fold each tortilla over the toppings towards the center. Place a second half baking sheet on top of tortillas (this will help the quesadilla hold its shape).', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Remove the top baking sheet and continue baking until the tortillas are golden and crispy, 8 to 12 more minutes.', 'Slice into rectangles and serve topped with sour cream, pico de gallo, and cilantro, if desired.']

title: Black Bean and Corn Quesadillas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'finely chopped onion'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15.5 ounce) can', 'Name': 'black beans, drained and rinsed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(10 ounce) can', 'Name': 'whole kernel corn, drained'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'salsa'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '(8 inch)', 'Name': 'flour tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'shredded Monterey Jack cheese'}]
directions: ['Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir onion in hot oil until softened, about 2 minutes. Stir in beans and corn, then add salsa, brown sugar, and red pepper flakes; mix well. Cook until heated through, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat.', 'Melt about 1 ½ teaspoons butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Place a tortilla in the skillet. Sprinkle with ¼ of the Monterey Jack cheese, then top with ¼ of the bean mixture. Place another tortilla on top; cook until the bottom is golden, then carefully flip and cook until the other side is golden. Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling.']

title: Simply Guacamole Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '20'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '5 cups'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'avocados - peeled, pitted, and mashed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'minced green onion'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'minced fresh cilantro'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and pepper, to taste'}]
directions: ['Stir together the avocado and lemon juice in a serving bowl; add the green onion and cilantro; mix well. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately or store covered in refrigerator with avocado pits in the bowl to keep from browning.']

title: Microwave Mexican Rice Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Stand Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'instant rice'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'picante sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(4 ounce) can', 'Name': 'green chiles'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': '(1 ounce) envelope', 'Name': 'taco seasoning'}]
directions: ['Place minute rice, water, picante sauce, green chiles, and taco seasoning in a large microwave-safe baking dish. Stir until evenly combined.', 'Microwave, uncovered, on High for 8 minutes. Let sit for 5 minutes to absorb liquid. Fluff with a fork and serve.']

title: The Best Chimichangas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garlic powder'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breasts'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'onion'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'plus 3 tablespoons water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'chicken bouillon cube'}, {'Quantity': '1 (7', 'Unit': 'ounce) can', 'Name': 'green chiles'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'peanut oil or vegetable oil for frying, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '(10 to 12-inch)', 'Name': 'flour tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'refried beans'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(8 ounce) block', 'Name': 'pepper Jack cheese'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'shredded lettuce'}]
directions: ['Sprinkle salt, pepper, and garlic powder evenly over one side of the chicken breasts.', 'Heat olive oil in a large deep skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken, seasoned side down, into skillet, and cook, undisturbed, until browned, 3 to 4 minutes. Flip chicken over and push to one side of the pan.', 'Add onion, garlic, chili powder, and cumin to the skillet and cook for 1 minute.\xa0 Add 2 cups water and bouillon and gently stir until well combined.', 'Bring mixture to a simmer. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer gently until chicken is no longer pink at the center and juices run clear, about 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted near the center should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).', 'Remove chicken from pan and increase heat to medium-high; cook until broth mixture is reduced by about half. Shred chicken and add back to the pan, along with green chiles. Stir until well combined and remove from heat.', 'Whisk flour and remaining water together in a small bowl until smooth; set aside. Heat oil for frying in a large saucepan or Dutch oven over medium-high heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Set a wire rack over a rimmed baking sheet.', 'Place tortilla on work surface and spread about 3 tablespoons beans in the center. Top with 1/4 cup shredded cheese and 1/3 to 1/2 cup well-drained shredded chicken. Brush flour mixture lightly around edges of top half of tortilla. Fold sides of tortilla in just over edges of filling and fold bottom of tortilla up over filling.\xa0 Press back on the tortilla to push the filling tightly together and continue to roll upwards. Lightly press the edges of the tortilla to seal tightly and set aside, seam side down. Repeat with remaining ingredients.', 'Carefully place 2 burritos into hot oil and cook, turning occasionally, until golden brown and toasted on the outside, about 2 minutes. Drain on the prepared baking sheet. Bring oil back up to temperature and repeat with remaining burritos.', 'Top as desired with warm queso, pico de gallo, cilantro and shredded lettuce, or other toppings, and serve immediately.']

title: Blackened Shrimp Tacos with Pineapple Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '3'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 tacos'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'onion powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'dried oregano'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garlic salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'black pepper'}]
directions: ['Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat; lightly oil the grate. Combine paprika, onion powder, oregano, cayenne pepper, garlic salt, and black pepper in a small bowl; set aside.', 'Cut the pineapple lengthwise into wedges. Grill pineapple wedges for 4 to 5 minutes on each side. Chop pineapple and combine in a bowl with red onions, cilantro, fresh lime juice, and salt.', 'Thread shrimp onto skewers; brush with melted butter, and coat with seasoning mix. Grill shrimp until they are bright pink on the outside and the meat is opaque, about 3 minutes per side.', 'Place tortillas on the hot grill and heat until lightly grilled, 20 to 30 seconds per side.', 'Place shrimp on each tortilla and top with pineapple mixture.']

title: Pork Chops Al Pastor Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Rest Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Marinate Time:', 'Value': '8 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '9 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 chops'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '(12 to 14 ounce) bone-in double-cut p', 'Name': 'bone-in double-cut p'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '14 ounce)', 'Name': 'pineapple chunks with juice'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chili pepper, or any dried ground chile pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chipotle'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '3 1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'white vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, peeled'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onions, cut into 2-inch pieces'}]
directions: ['Place chops in a resealable plastic bag set in a bowl. Add pineapple, guajillo, New Mexico chili powder, chipotle, cinnamon, salt, white vinegar, garlic, and onions to the jar of a blender, and blend until marinade is smooth; pour marinade into bag. Massage pork to coat evenly. Press out air, seal the bag, and refrigerate overnight, or up to 48 hours.', 'Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).', 'Heat olive oil in an oven-safe pan over medium-high heat. Remove chops from marinade, scraping off as much excess as possible; reserve all marinade for the sauce. Sear chops in the hot pan on both sides until lightly browned, about 3 minutes per side. Remove to a plate; set aside.', 'Add yellow onion, cumin, and dried oregano to the pan, and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. If pan seems dry, add another drizzle of oil.', 'Turn off heat, and pour in water. Stir, scraping any brown bits off the bottom of the pan. Place\xa0chops on top of onion mixture.', 'Roast in the preheated oven until pork is cooked to taste, 20 to 30 minutes, basting or brushing chops with pan juices occasionally. An internal temperature of 140 to 145 degrees F (60 to 63 degrees C) will ensure juicy, tender meat. Roasting time will vary greatly depending on size of chops, so check temperature with an instant-read thermometer early and often.', 'Meanwhile, pour marinade into a saucepan, and add about 1/2 cup of water, or as needed to achieve desired thickness. Bring to a simmer on medium-high heat, whisking occasionally. Taste sauce for seasoning; keep warm until needed.', 'To make salsa, combine white onion, diced pineapple, fresh oregano, ¼ teaspoon salt, and lime juice in a bowl and mix thoroughly.', 'Remove pork from the oven; tent with foil and let rest for 5 to 10 minutes before serving. While resting, tops of chops can be garnished with sauce and a spoon of salsa.']

title: Cafe de Olla Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Steep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'grated piloncillo'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'stick', 'Name': 'cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'coffee'}]
directions: ['Place water, piloncillo, and cinnamon in a pot. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 8 minutes.', 'Remove from heat, add coffee, and stir well. Cover pot and steep for 5 minutes. Pour through a fine mesh strainer twice or until free of any coffee granules.']

title: Cornbread Taco Bake Recipe
