time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '5'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'ground beef'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'taco seasoning'}, {'Quantity': '1 (10', 'Unit': 'ounce)', 'Name': 'tomatoes with green chilies'}, {'Quantity': '1 (8.75', 'Unit': 'ounce) can', 'Name': 'corn, drained'}, {'Quantity': '1 (15.5', 'Unit': 'ounce) can', 'Name': 'chili beans'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'heddar cheese, shredded'}, {'Quantity': '1 (8.5', 'Unit': 'ounce)', 'Name': 'cornbread mix'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'egg'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'sour cream'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'In a deep cast iron skillet, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink, breaking it into crumbles, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain off excess grease. Stir in taco seasoning, tomatoes with green chilies, corn, and chili beans. Stir in Cheddar cheese.', 'Stir cornbread mix, egg, and milk together in a bowl. Spread batter over beef mixture.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted near the center of cornbread comes out clean, about 25 minutes. Garnish each serving with sour cream and chopped green onions. Serve immediately.']

title: Blackened Shrimp Tacos Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '12 tacos'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 (14', 'Unit': 'ounce) bag classic', 'Name': 'coleslaw mix'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'red onion'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped cilantro'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'jalapeno'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'limes, juiced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/8', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'raw shrimp'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'seasoning'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '12', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'flour tortillas, warmed'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'guacamole'}]
directions: ['Place coleslaw mix, red onion. cilantro, jalapeno, lime juice, 1 tablespoon olive oil, salt, and cayenne pepper in a large bowl. Stir until evenly combined. Set aside.', 'In a separate bowl combine shrimp, blackened seasoning, and the remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons olive oil. Stir until evenly combined.', 'Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add shrimp mixture and cook until shrimp are bright pink on the outside and the meat is opaque, about 6 minutes, stirring halfway through.', 'Divide coleslaw and shrimp between the tortillas. Top each taco with a dollop of guacamole.']

title: Potato Soup with Chorizo Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '9 ounce', 'Name': 'Mexican chorizo'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'onions'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, pressed'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chicken broth'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'potatoes'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'chicken bouillon granules ('}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'oregano'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'heavy cream'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}]
directions: ['Combine chorizo and onions in a soup pot over medium heat and cook until onions are soft and translucent and chorizo is fully cooked,\xa07 to 8 minutes. Add garlic and cook until garlic is fragrant, about 1 minute more.', 'Add chicken broth, potatoes, chicken granules, cumin, and oregano. Bring to a boil and simmer until potatoes are fork tender, 6 to 10 minutes. Reduce heat and stir in heavy whipping cream. Season with salt and pepper.']

title: Te de Canela (Cinnamon Tea) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '1'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'sticks', 'Name': 'cinnamon, broken into pieces'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'sweetener, such as honey, sugar, or piloncillo (optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'lemon juice, or as needed (optional)'}]
directions: ['Place water and cinnamon sticks in a pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Strain tea and pour into a cup; add sweetener and lemon juice as desired.']

title: Mexican Street Corn Deviled Eggs Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'dip'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'mayonnaise'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'lime juice, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'cotija cheese, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'red onion'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'chopped cilantro'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'Tajin® Clásico Seasoning'}]
directions: ['Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil, remove from heat, and let eggs stand in hot water for 15 minutes. Remove eggs from hot water, cool under cold running water, and peel. Cut eggs in half lengthwise.', 'Remove yolks to a small mixing bowl; mash with a fork. Add in Mexican street corn dip, mayonnaise, and lime juice. Stir together with a fork until fairly smooth; stir in 2 teaspoons of cotija cheese.', 'Fit a piping bag with a coupler and a tip with a fairly large opening. Drop piping bag into a tall glass and fold edges down around the glass. Spoon egg yolk filling into the bag. Gather edges and twist together. Pipe filling into egg whites. Alternately, spoon filling into a resealable plastic bag, press to remove excess air, and reseal. Cut one corner of bag off, and pipe filling into egg whites. Or, simply spoon filling into egg whites.', 'Sprinkle remaining cotija cheese over eggs; scatter on onion slivers and cilantro. Sprinkle with Tajin® seasoning and serve.']

title: Chilaquiles with Homemade Tomato Sauce Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '16', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'corn tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'oil, or as needed for frying'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt, plus more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '2 cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'chiles, stems and seeds removed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'white onion, quartered'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cloves garlic'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'tomatoes, quartered'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'jalapenos, halved'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1 (14.5', 'Unit': 'ounce)', 'Name': 'fire-roasted diced tomatoes'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'queso fresco'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'avocado, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'crema'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'sliced radish, hot sauce, chopped cilantro'}]
directions: ['Cut each tortilla into 8 wedges. Heat oil to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C) in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add tortillas to fry in batches, taking care not to crowd the pot. Cook, stirring constantly until golden and crispy, 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from oil with a slotted spoon and drain well on paper towels. Sprinkle with salt to taste immediately. Repeat with remaining tortillas.', 'In a large saucepan, add water and guajillo chiles. Bring mixture to a boil over high heat,\xa0reduce temperature, and simmer until chiles soften, about 5 minutes. Return heat to medium-high and add onion, garlic, tomatoes, jalapenos, cumin, and 1 teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until onion has softened, about 10 minutes.', 'Remove from heat and carefully pour mixture into a blender or food processor. Add canned tomatoes, vinegar, and olive oil. Remove center from the lid to allow steam to escape and blend until smooth, about 1 minute, scraping down the sides as necessary.', 'In a large skillet over medium heat, add 1 cup of sauce and bring to a simmer, stirring often.\xa0 Add 1/4 of the chips and cook about 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until the chips are well-coated in sauce and fully heated through. Place chips on a plate.', 'In a separate small skillet, heat 1/2 tablespoon butter over medium heat. Crack an egg into the butter and cook over easy or as desired. Add egg to chips and top with queso fresco, avocado, crema, and any other desired toppings.']

title: The Best Easy Shrimp Enchiladas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '32', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'extra-large raw shrimp'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt, or more as needed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'avocado oil, plus more as needed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'diced poblano pepper or other green chili pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'onion'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chipotle pepper'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'ounce', 'Name': ') cans lobster bisque soup'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'tomato paste (optional)'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chopped cilantro'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': '(6-inch) flour tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'Monterey Jack cheese, shredded'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'heddar cheese, shredded'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'jalapeño, thinly sliced, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'radishes, thinly sliced, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sour cream, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'hot sauce, as needed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lime, cut into wedges for serving'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Season shrimp with salt and cayenne in a bowl and toss with tongs to evenly coat.', 'Add 1 tablespoon of avocado oil to a skillet, and set on medium-high heat. Place shrimp, without crowding, in a single layer in the skillet; sear for 30 to 60 seconds per side, then transfer to a bowl. You will have to work in batches. Place seared shrimp in the refrigerator.', 'Add peppers, onions, and a large pinch of salt to the skillet. Reduce heat to medium, and cook, stirring up the brown bits from the bottom of the pan, until onions begin to turn translucent, 3 to 5 minutes.', 'Season with chili powder, smoked paprika, cumin, black pepper, chipotle pepper, and garlic; sauté for 1 to 2 minutes more. Remove 8 rounded tablespoons of the mixture to a bowl and set aside.', 'Pour water into the pan and stir to deglaze the bottom. Stir in lobster bisque, plus a few tablespoons of water used to rinse the cans. Add tomato paste and raise heat to medium-high; stir until well combined. Bring sauce to a simmer, reduce heat to medium, and simmer for 5 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.', 'Meanwhile, remove shrimp from the refrigerator, and pour any accumulated juices from the shrimp into the sauce. Turn off heat, stir in cilantro, and season with salt and black pepper to taste.', 'Transfer half the sauce into the bottom of a large (15x10-inch) baking dish.', 'Brush each tortilla on both sides with avocado oil. Toss Monterey Jack and Cheddar cheese together in a bowl.', 'Top each tortilla with 1/4 cup cheese mixture, followed by 4 shrimp. Top with 1 spoon of reserved veggie mixture. Add 2 tablespoons cheese mixture on top and roll up tortilla, finishing with seam on bottom.', 'Place 8 rolled enchiladas into the baking dish, seam on bottom, and top with remaining sauce. Sprinkle over remaining cheese, or more if desired.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until the top starts to brown, and the sauce is bubbly, 20 to 25 minutes. Let enchiladas rest for about 10 minutes before serving. While resting, garnish with thinly sliced jalapeños and radishes.', 'Serve with extra sauce from the bottom of the dish spooned over. Garnish with additional sliced jalapeño, radish, and chopped cilantro, and serve with sour cream, hot sauce, and fresh lime wedges.']

title: Salsa Macha Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cool Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'ancho chili pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'Guajillo chili pepper'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'chili de árbol peppers'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'sesame seeds'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'garlic cloves, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'apple cider vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'oregano'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'peanuts'}]
directions: ['Remove the stems and seeds from the chili peppers. Chop into 1/4-inch pieces. Set aside.', 'Heat oil over medium heat until it begins to shimmer. Add sesame seeds and garlic. Cook, stirring constantly, until sesame seeds are browned and garlic has crisped up, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Add chili peppers and stir until combined. Let sit at room temperature until cool, about 10 minutes.', 'Stir in vinegar, salt, and Mexican oregano. Pour mixture into a food processor and pulse several times until the salsa is combined, making sure not to over process. Stir in peanuts.']

title: Chicken Fajita Tacos Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Marinate Time:', 'Value': '8 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '8 hrs 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'orange juice'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'taco seasoning (see Note)'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into strips'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, cut into strips'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green bell pepper, seeded and cut into strips'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'red bell pepper, seeded and cut into strips'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '6 inch', 'Name': 'flour tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'avocado, pitted and sliced, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sour cream, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cotija cheese, or as needed'}]
directions: ['Combine orange juice, taco seasoning, and vegetable oil in a large resealable bag. Add chicken, coat with the marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag. Marinate in the refrigerator overnight.', 'Heat a cast iron skillet over medium high heat.', 'Cook chicken in the hot skillet for 5 minutes. Add onion, green bell pepper, and red bell pepper. Cook until peppers are crisp tender, 4 to 5 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into center of chicken strips should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).', 'Heat tortillas until soft and pliable. Top with chicken fajita mixture, avocado, sour cream, and cotija cheese. Serve immediately.']

title: Mild Taco Seasoning Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'paprika'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'garlic'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'dried oregano'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'coriander'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}]
directions: ['Mix seasonings together and store in an airtight container.', 'Use 2 tablespoons to season1 pound of chicken or other meat.']

title: Chef John’s Chicken Tortilla Soup Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '5 hrs 45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '6 hrs 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'whole chicken'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'white onions, halved, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'bunch', 'Name': 'cilantro, rinsed well'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bay leaves'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'peppercorns'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'oregano'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'dried chili pepper pods, seeded (optional)'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'quarts', 'Name': 'water'}]
directions: ['Combine chicken, 1 onion, stems from the cilantro bunch, bay leaves, oregano, peppercorns, dried chili pods, and 3 quarts of water in a large soup pot set over medium-high heat. Bring to simmer, lower heat to medium-low, and simmer for 1 hour.', 'Meanwhile, make the tortilla strips: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with a silicone mat or parchment paper.', 'Cut tortillas in half, and then cut crosswise into 1/4-inch strips. Transfer tortilla strips to the prepared baking sheet and drizzle with oil. Add salt and toss well to coat, then spread strips out as evenly as possible.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and crispy, tossing once or twice during the cooking time, about 30 minutes. Set aside.', 'Carefully remove chicken to a bowl. Reduce heat on broth to low.', 'Let chicken rest until cool enough to pull off the meat. Shred chicken and refrigerate until needed.', 'Add bones, skin, and all the scraps back to the pot of broth, and simmer on low heat for about 4 hours total. If broth reduces too much, just add a splash of water.', 'Meanwhile, after about 2 hours, make the charred vegetable salsa: Preheat on the oven’s broiler for high heat and set a rack about 8 inches below the heating element. Line a baking sheet with foil and oil lightly; place remaining 2 onions, tomatoes, sweet red pepper, and jalapeno pepper on the prepared baking sheet.', 'Broil vegetables until charred, 7 to 10 minutes. Add charred vegetables to the jar of a blender with garlic cloves, chipotle pepper, and 1 cup water, and blend until smooth.', 'Pour pureed salsa into the pot, and raise heat to medium-low. Simmer broth for another 2 hours, stirring occasionally. Pass soup through a fine mesh strainer into a separate pot, squeezing the chicken to get all those nice juices; discard bones and skin in strainer. Season soup to taste with salt.', 'Add cumin, shredded chicken, and juice from 1 lime. Simmer 15 to 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Taste for seasoning, and serve with crispy tortilla strips. Garnish with sour cream, avocado, chopped cilantro, grated or crumbled Mexican cheese, additional lime juice, and a sprinkle of cayenne, if desired.']

title: Esquites with Frozen Corn Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '12 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '22 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(2 pound) bag', 'Name': 'corn kernels, thawed and drained'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'lime juice'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'mayonnaise'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cotija cheese'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chopped cilantro, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lime wedges (optional)'}]
directions: ['Melt butter in a soup pot over medium-high heat, and cook corn until hot, about 8 minutes.', 'Stir in lime juice and chili powder; cook until lime juice is nearly evaporated, about 2 minutes. Fold in mayonnaise and cook 2 minutes more. Turn off heat.', 'Spoon into serving cups and top with cotija and cilantro. Serve with lime wedges.']

title: Teriyaki Steak Quesadillas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'mirin'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sake'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ginger'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'Thai', 'Name': "chili or bird's eye chili pepper"}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'skirt steak, cut into bite-sized pieces'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'broccoli florets'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '10-inch)', 'Name': 'flour tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'quesadilla cheese'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'mini bell pepper'}]
directions: ['Add soy sauce, mirin, sake, garlic, brown sugar, ginger, and Thai chili to the jar of a blender. Blend on high until smooth. Reserve 2 tablespoons marinade; pour remaining marinade into a resealable plastic bag.', 'Add steak to the resealable bag, close the bag, and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight.', 'Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Remove steak from the marinade,\xa0 shake off excess, and cook and stir steak in the skillet until browned, about 5 minutes. Discard the remaining marinade.', 'Meanwhile add broccoli to a microwave-safe steamer, and steam in the microwave until tender, about 3 minutes. Roughly chop the broccoli.', 'Remove steak to a plate to keep warm, and drizzle with the 2 tablespoons reserved marinade. Rinse the skillet and dry with a paper towel. Place 1 tortilla in the skillet, and add a 1/8 portion each of cheese, steak pieces, broccoli, and bell pepper to tortilla. Fold tortilla in half. Press down with a spatula, and cook until tortilla begins to brown and cheese melts, about 3 minutes. Carefully turn quesadilla over; cook until browned on the other side, about 3 minutes more. Repeat with remaining ingredients.', 'Cut quesadillas into wedges. Sprinkle with black sesame seeds and green onions; serve with Yum Yum sauce and teriyaki sauce, if desired.']

title: Slow Cooker Pozole Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '6 hrs 35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '6 hrs 55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'canola oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(2 pound)', 'Name': 'boneless pork loin roast, cut into 1-inch cubes'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(14.5 ounce) cans', 'Name': 'enchilada sauce'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(15.5 ounce) cans', 'Name': 'white hominy, drained'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'green chilies, diced'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'dried oregano'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cilantro, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}]
directions: ['Heat oil in a skillet over high heat. Add pork; cook and stir just until meat is browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.', 'Place meat in a 4-quart slow cooker. Pour enchilada sauce over the meat. Top with hominy, onion, chilies, garlic, cayenne pepper, and oregano. Pour in enough water to fill the slow cooker.', 'Cover and cook on High for 6 to 7 hours. Stir in cilantro and salt. Cook on Low for 30 minutes more.']

title: Marranitos (Mexican Pig-Shaped Cookies) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '15'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '15 large cookies'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 ¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'packed brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'shortening'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'egg'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'unsulfured molasses'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'baking soda'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'egg, beaten'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line cookie sheets with parchment paper.', 'Beat brown sugar and shortening together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth. Beat in 1 egg, milk, and vanilla until smooth. Stir in molasses, baking soda, and cinnamon. Mix in flour until the dough is stiff enough to roll out.', 'Roll dough out on a lightly floured surface to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut into cookies using a pig-shaped cookie cutter. Place cookies 2 inches apart on the prepared baking sheets. Brush the tops of the cookies with beaten egg.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until risen and edges are lightly browned, about 15 to 17 minutes. Cool briefly on cookie sheets; serve warm or transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.']

title: Buñuelos Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '16'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour, plus more for kneading'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'vegetable oil for frying'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Beat eggs and 1/4 cup sugar in a large bowl until thick and lemon-colored; mix in 1 teaspoon vegetable oil.', 'Combine 1 ½ cups of flour, baking powder, and salt; gradually add to egg mixture, mixing well until evenly combined.', 'Turn dough out onto a floured board and knead thoroughly until dough is smooth.', 'Shape dough into 16 even-sized balls. Flatten and roll each one into a very thin circle about 5 inches in diameter. Let stand uncovered on waxed paper for about 10 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, combine 1 cup sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl until evenly mixed; set aside. Heat oil in a deep pan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Lower one circle of dough carefully into the hot oil; fry until golden, turning once, about 30 seconds on each side. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain; sprinkle with cinnamon-sugar mixture.', 'Repeat with remaining dough. Serve or cool and store in airtight containers.']

title: Rotel Tacos Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 tacos'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'lb', 'Name': 'ground sirloin'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'low sodium Taco seasoning'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'processed American cheese ('}, {'Quantity': '1 (10-', 'Unit': 'ounce) can', 'Name': 'diced tomatoes with green chiles'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'crunchy taco shells'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'shredded iceberg lettuce'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'diced tomato'}]
directions: ['Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.\xa0 Add onion and cook 1 minute, stirring constantly.\xa0 Add ground beef and cook, crumbling with a wooden spoon until browned and cooked through, 5 to 10 minutes. Add in taco seasoning and cook for 1 minute.\xa0 Mix in cheese and tomatoes and reduce heat to medium-low.\xa0 Cook stirring constantly, until cheese is melted and mixture comes to a simmer.\xa0 Cook for 3 minutes and remove from heat.', 'Add filling to taco shells and top with shredded lettuce and other toppings, if desired.']

title: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Taco Cups Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cooking spray'}, {'Quantity': '12', 'Unit': '(4-inch)', 'Name': 'flour tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sweet potato'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'yellow onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'jalapeño', 'Name': ', seeded and minced'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1 (15-', 'Unit': 'ounces)', 'Name': 'can black beans in mild chili sauce, undrained'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'shredded queso quesadilla or Mexican-style cheese blend'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'small avocado, diced', 'Name': 'avocado, diced'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'fresh cilantro, for garnish'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lime wedges and lime crema,'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat 12 (2 1/2-inch) muffin cups with cooking spray. Press 1 tortilla into the bottom of each muffin cup, pleating edges as needed to fit.', 'Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add sweet potato; cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Add onion; cook until softened, 2 to 3 minutes. Add jalapeño and garlic; cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Stir in beans, salt, and black pepper.', 'Divide bean mixture evenly among prepared muffin cups and sprinkle with cheese.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and filling is bubbly, 15 to 20 minutes. Top with avocado and garnish with cilantro. Serve with limes and lime crema.']

title: Campfire Queso Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'ground beef'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'Italian sausage'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'red onion'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'red bell pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '10-ounce) can can', 'Name': 'diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL®)'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'pasteurized cheese product (such as Velveeta®), cubed'}, {'Quantity': '1 (', 'Unit': '8-ounce) package', 'Name': 'cream cheese, softened and cubed'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'Pepper Jack'}, {'Quantity': '3/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'salt added canned black beans, rinsed and drained'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'frozen corn'}, {'Quantity': '3/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'diced avocado (about 1/2 avocado)'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sour cream'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'fresh cilantro'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'tortilla chips for serving'}]
directions: ['Heat a 10-inch cast-iron skillet on a grill grate over a fire. You can also preheat an outdoor grill to medium-high heat (375 degrees F to 400 degrees F (190 degrees C to 200 degrees C)) .', 'Add beef, sausage, onion, bell pepper, and jalapeño to the skillet. Cook, stirring to break up lumps, until meat is browned, about 8 minutes. Pour off grease. Stir in tomatoes with green chiles, cheese product, cream cheese, pepper Jack, beans, and corn. title: Fried Egg Tortilla Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '4 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '9 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '1'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'egg'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'taco seasoning, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'shredded Cheddar cheese, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(6 to 7-inch)', 'Name': 'flour tortilla'}]
directions: ['In a 10-inch nonstick skillet, melt butter over medium heat, and swirl the pan to coat the bottom evenly.', 'Carefully break egg into buttered skillet and cook until egg white is opaque and egg is firm enough to turn, about 1 minute.', 'Turn egg over, being careful not to break yolk; sprinkle with taco seasoning and about half of cheese.', 'Gently place tortilla over egg and cheese, and cook about 1 minute. Using a silicone egg turner, flip the egg and tortilla, as one.', 'Sprinkle remaining cheese on top of the egg, and continue cooking until the egg is done to your liking and the tortilla is warm and toasty, about 2 minutes.', 'Slide tortilla and egg to a serving plate and serve warm.']

title: Skillet Shrimp Fajitas with Cilantro-Lime Cream Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '5'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sour cream'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'cilantro'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'limes, zested and juiced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'clove', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt, or to taste'}]
directions: ['For cilantro-lime cream, place sour cream in a small bowl with a lid. Add cilantro, zest and juice of 2 limes, garlic, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Stir together well, cover, and refrigerate until ready to serve.', 'For fajita seasoning, combine chili powder, cayenne pepper, cumin, paprika, oregano, salt and pepper in a small bowl; set aside.', 'In a large bowl or resealable plastic bag, add 2 tablespoons oil, half of lime juice, and fajita seasoning. Stir together or squeeze the bag to combine. Add shrimp and mix well to coat shrimp; set aside.', 'Heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir onion and peppers into the hot oil, and cook, stirring frequently, until some color begins to develop on the vegetables, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove vegetables from the skillet and set aside.', 'Add\xa0shrimp to the same skillet and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Return cooked vegetables to the skillet. Cook and stir until shrimp is opaque and pink, 2 to 3 minutes. Squeeze remaining lime juice over the skillet contents.', 'Fill warm tortillas with shrimp, peppers, and onions, and garnish with avocado slices, pico de gallo, and additional cilantro, if desired. Drizzle with cilantro-lime cream.']

title: Easy Chicken Street Tacos Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '8 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '18 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 tacos'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'boneless, skinless chicken'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, diced'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cilantro'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'corn tortillas'}]
directions: ['Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.', 'Grill chicken, turning occasionally, until juices run clear and chicken is no longer pink at the center, about 7 minutes. An instant-read thermometer, inserted near the center, should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).', 'Heat corn tortillas until soft and pliable in the microwave, about 1 minute. Top with chicken, onions, and cilantro.']

title: Churro Cheesecake Bars Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '24'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '24 cheesecake bars'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cooking spray'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(7.5-ounce) packages', 'Name': 'brown sugar and cinnamon spreadable cream cheese, softened'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'egg'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'orange zest (optional)'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(8-ounce) packages', 'Name': 'refrigerated crescent sheets (2 sheets)'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'salted butter, melted'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'cajeta (Mexican caramel), warmed (Optional)'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly coat a 13x9-inch baking pan with cooking spray.', 'Combine sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl. Sprinkle ½ of the sugar mixture evenly in the bottom of the pan.', 'Place one crescent sheet in the pan, trimming to fit as needed.', 'To make the filling: Beat cream cheese, egg, vanilla, and orange zest together in a medium bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed until smooth.', 'Spread cream cheese filling evenly over crescent crust in pan.', 'Gently lay the remaining crescent sheet over the filling.', 'Pour melted butter over the top.', 'Sprinkle remaining sugar mixture evenly over top.', 'Bake until golden brown, about 30 minutes. Cool slightly. Cut into bars. Serve warm or chill and serve within 24 hours. If desired, drizzle with Cajeta just before serving.']

title: Steak Burrito Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '1'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(10-inch)', 'Name': 'flour tortilla'}, {'Quantity': '3/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'ribeye steak, warmed'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'exican rice, heated'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'pinto beans, heated'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'shredded Cheddar cheese'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'onion'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'chopped cilantro'}]
directions: ['Fold a paper towel around tortilla. Microwave on High until pliable, 5 to 10 seconds.', 'Lay tortilla flat on a plate. Layer steak, rice, beans, cheese, onion, and cilantro in a line across the middle of the tortilla. Fold opposing edges of the tortilla to overlap the filling. Roll 1 of the opposing edges around the filling and tuck tortilla to form a burrito.']

title: Agua Fresca de Fresas con Crema (Strawberries and Cream) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2 1/2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'strawberries, hulled and diced, divided'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1 (14 1/2', 'Unit': 'ounce) can', 'Name': 'sweetened condensed milk'}, {'Quantity': '1 (12', 'Unit': 'ounce) can e', 'Name': 'vaporated milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vanilla'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sugar, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'ice cubes, or as needed'}]
directions: ['Place 2 pounds of the strawberries and water in a blender cup and blend until smooth.', 'Pour strawberry puree into a large pitcher. Add sweetened condensed milk, evaporated milk, and vanilla. Stir until well incorporated. Taste; add sugar, a little at a time, as needed.', 'Add ice cubes and stir. Gently stir in remaining 1/2 pound diced strawberries. Chill until ready to serve.']

title: Chipotle-Citrus Marinated Chicken Tacos Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '12 mins'}, {'Label': 'Marinate Time:', 'Value': '4 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '4 hrs 22 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '12 tacos'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'limes, juiced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'orange, juiced'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'chipotle pepper in adobo'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'boneless skinless chicken breasts'}, {'Quantity': '24', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'corn tortilla'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'onion, diced'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped cilantro'}]
directions: ['Combine lime juice, orange juice, olive oil, chipotle pepper, garlic, cumin, coriander, salt, and black pepper in a blender. Blend on high until smooth.', 'Pour marinade mixture into a resealable plastic bag. Add chicken breasts to the bag; marinate in the refrigerator for 3 hours.', 'Preheat a grill to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).', 'Place marinated chicken breasts on the grill; close the lid. Discard the marinade. Grill, turning once, until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 6 to 8 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).', 'Remove chicken from grill. Let stand for 5 minutes; slice into strips.', 'Heat tortillas over a griddle on medium heat until tortillas are soft and pliable. Stack tortillas in pairs; divide chicken, onion, and cilantro onto each pair of tortillas.']

title: Grilled Chicken Street Tacos Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Marinate Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Stand Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '12 tacos'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'boneless skinless chicken thighs, trimmed of excess fat'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'lime juice'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '24', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'corn tortillas (such as'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white onion'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cilantro'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'Mexican hot sauce (such as'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lime wedges'}]
directions: ['In a gallon-size resealable bag, place chicken, lime juice, vegetable oil, garlic, cumin, coriander and chili powder. Reseal the bag, and massage bag until chicken is evenly coated. Marinate for 1 to 2 hours in the refrigerator.', 'Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate.', 'Remove chicken from marinade and place on the hot grill. Discard marinade. Grill over direct heat until juices run clear, 6 to 8 minutes per side. An instant read thermometer inserted near the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Remove to a plate and let rest for 5 minutes. Chop chicken into small pieces and set aside, keeping it warm.', 'Place tortillas on the hot grill, stacked 2 tortillas thick, and heat for about 20 to 30 seconds; flip each stack and heat an additional 20 to 30 seconds. Divide the chicken mixture between the 12 stacks of tortillas. Top with onion and cilantro and drizzle with hot sauce, if desired. Serve with lime wedges.']

title: How to Make Arroz con Leche Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(3-inch long)', 'Name': 'cinnamon sticks'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'uncooked white rice'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'whole milk'}, {'Quantity': '1 (12-ounce can)', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '14', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'sweetened condensed milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cinnamon for garnish'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Combine water and cinnamon sticks in a medium saucepan over high heat.', 'Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until cinnamon releases its color and flavor, about 5 minutes.', 'Add rice and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and water is absorbed, about 20 minutes.', 'Stir in whole milk, evaporated milk, and sweetened condensed milk. Cook uncovered over medium heat until mixture has thickened to desired consistency, 15 to 20 minutes.', 'Serve warm or cold. Sprinkle each portion with ground cinnamon.']

title: Frijoles Borrachos (Drunken Baked Beans) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'lightly packed light brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'apple cider vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'prepared red salsa'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cans', 'Name': 'pinto beans, drained, not rinsed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'diced onion'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped jalapeno peppers'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'prepared mustard'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garlic powder'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'Mexican oregano'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '12-ounce bottle', 'Name': 'Mexican lager-style beer (such as Modelo)'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'strips', 'Name': 'bacon (optional)'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).', 'Add brown sugar, vinegar, and salsa to a 2 1/2- to 3-quart baking dish or casserole pan. Stir until sugar dissolves.', 'Add pinto beans, onion, jalapeno peppers, mustard, paprika, black pepper, salt, garlic powder, oregano, and cayenne pepper. Pour lager over, and stir until thoroughly combined.', 'Lay bacon strips on top of casserole.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until liquids have reduced and thickened, 1 to 1 1/2 hours.']

title: Mexican Pinwheels Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '0 mins'}, {'Label': 'Refrigerate Time:', 'Value': '4 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '4 hrs 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cream cheese, softened'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sour cream'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'onion powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garlic powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'Aleppo pepper'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'sundried tomato tortilla wraps'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'diced tomatoes with green chilies'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'heddar cheese, shredded'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'grilled chicken breast strips'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'guacamole, or as needed (optional)'}]
directions: ['Blend cream cheese, sour cream, smoked paprika, onion powder, and Aleppo pepper together in a small bowl.', 'Lay tortillas out on a cutting board. Spread cream cheese mixture evenly over tortillas. Divide RO*TEL, Cheddar cheese, chicken strips, and guacamole evenly among tortillas.', 'Roll up pinwheels tightly. Refrigerate for 4 hours. Cut into 1-inch rounds. Enjoy!']

title: Pizza “Tlayuda” Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 tortilla pizzas'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'avocado oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'green onion'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cloves garlic'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chili powder or paprika'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '15', 'Unit': 'oz', 'Name': 'black beans'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'oregano'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '1 pinch', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'lard'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'lime juice'}]
directions: ['Combine avocado oil, green onions, minced garlic, and a pinch of salt in a saucepan and place over medium heat. Once garlic starts to sizzle, cook and stir for 1 minute. Add cumin, black pepper, and ancho chili powder, and cook stirring for 30 seconds.', "Add water, drained black beans, remaining salt, oregano, cayenne, and asiento (crispy pork butter, see Cook's Note). Stir together and simmer for 5 minutes. Use a potato masher to mash beans until smooth. Simmer for 5 minutes more. Turn off heat and taste to adjust seasoning if necessary."]

title: Breakfast Burrito Bowl Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '2'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'center-cut bacon'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cooking spray'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(8-inch)', 'Name': 'flour tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'pepper Jack cheese'}, {'Quantity': '3/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'adobo seasoning'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cherry tomatoes'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'fresh cilantro'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'scallions', 'Name': 'scallions'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'lime juice'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'avocado', 'Name': 'avocado'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', "Preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 10 minutes, or according to manufacturer's instructions.", 'Line the air fryer basket with aluminum foil. Add bacon slices in a single layer and cook until crispy, about 8 minutes.', 'Remove from the air fryer and set aside on a paper towel-lined plate. Reduce temperature to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Spray 2 large ramekins or heatproof bowls with cooking spray, and press one tortilla inside each bowl with the edges coming up and out.', 'Crack 2 eggs into each tortilla shell, then top each with 1/4 cup cheese. Sprinkle each with 1/8 teaspoon adobo seasoning and 1/8 teaspoon salt.', 'Working with one tortilla bowl at a time, cook in the air fryer until tortillas are crispy, egg whites are set, and yolks are runny, 13 to 15 minutes.', 'While tortillas cook, stir together cherry tomatoes, cilantro, scallions, lime juice, remaining 1/2 teaspoon adobo seasoning, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt in a small bowl. Break bacon into small pieces, and set aside.', 'Remove tortillas from bowls and place on a plate. Top bowls evenly with tomato mixture, avocado, and bacon.']

title: Tamales Rojos de Pollo (Red Chicken Tamales) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '4 hrs 35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '35'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '35 tamales'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'corn husks'}, {'Quantity': '1 ¼', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breast halves'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'salt to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'mulato chiles, stemmed and seeded'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'ancho chiles, stemmed and seeded'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'clove', 'Name': 'garlic'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cumin seeds'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'boiling water as needed'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'lard'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'masa harina'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chicken broth, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'baking powder'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'salt'}]
directions: ['Place corn husks in a bowl, cover with boiling water, and soak for a few hours. Drain, place on a work surface, and cover with a clean, damp towel.', 'Place chicken in a pot, season with salt, and cover with water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, reduce heat, cover, and simmer until chicken is cooked through, 20 to 25 minutes. Drain chicken and shred with 2 forks.', 'Heat a griddle over medium heat and toast mulato and ancho chiles until fragrant, 3 to 5 minutes. Place in a bowl and cover with boiling water. Soak until soft, about 25 minutes. Combine ancho and mulato chiles, garlic, cumin seeds, and about 1/2 cup of the soaking water in a blender; blend until a thick, smooth, mole-like sauce forms, adding more water if necessary.', 'Heat 1 tablespoon lard in a saucepan over medium heat and add the sauce; cook for 3 to 5 minutes. Add shredded chicken and cook until flavors are combined and chicken is heated through, about 5 minutes.', "Place remaining lard in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until creamy. Add masa harina, chicken broth, baking powder, and 1 1/2 teaspoon salt, and beat until all ingredients are well combined. Test if the masa is ready by dropping a small ball of masa into a glass of cold water; if it floats, it's ready, if not, keep working the dough a little longer.", 'Select 1 wide corn husk. Spread about 2 tablespoons masa mixture onto the the corn husk, filling it up to 2 inches from the bottom and 1/4 inch from the top. Add 1 tablespoon of the chicken filling in the center of the masa mixture. Fold sides of husk together, one over the other. Fold the bottom of the husk over the seam of the 2 folded sides. Repeat with remaining husks.', 'Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer. Bring water to a boil. Add tamales with the open side up and cook until filling is heated through and separates from the husk, about 1 hour. Let tamales rest for 15 minutes before serving.']

title: Traditional Mexican Street Tacos Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '0 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '2'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 tacos'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': '(5-inch)', 'Name': 'corn tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chopped cooked chicken'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'sprigs', 'Name': 'fresh cilantro, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped white onion'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'guacamole'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lime, cut into wedges'}]
directions: ['Place a paper towel on a microwave-safe plate and top with tortillas; heat in the microwave for 10 seconds.', 'Place chicken in a microwave-safe bowl; heat in the microwave until heated through, 30 seconds to 1 minute.', 'Layer chicken, cilantro, onion, and guacamole, in that order, onto each tortilla. Squeeze lime juice over each taco.']

title: Instant Pot Carnitas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '24'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(6 pound)', 'Name': 'pork butt roast'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'dried oregano'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chile powder'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'paprika'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'orange juice'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, coarsely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, diced, or more to taste'}]
directions: ['Trim excess fat from pork butt; cut pork into 2-inch cubes and transfer to a large bowl.', 'Combine salt, oregano, cumin, black pepper, chile powder, and paprika in a small bowl. Rub pork cubes with spice mixture. Coat seasoned pork cubes lightly in olive oil; transfer to a pressure cooker. Cover pork cubes with orange juice, onion, and garlic.', 'Cover pork cubes with orange juice, onion, and garlic.', 'Place lid on the pressure cooker and lock; bring to full pressure over medium heat until pork is no longer pink in the center, about 60 minutes. Let pressure come down naturally, about 15 minutes.', 'Remove pork from the pressure cooker and shred meat.']

title: Shrimp Quesadillas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'red bell pepper, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green bell pepper, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'jalapeño pepper, seeded and minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lime, juiced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'flour tortillas'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided'}]
directions: ['Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and bell peppers; cook, stirring frequently, until onion is translucent and peppers are soft, 6 to 8 minutes. Add salt, cumin, and chili powder; stir to coat vegetables.', 'Add shrimp; cook and stir until shrimp are opaque and no longer pink in the center, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in minced jalapeño and lime juice.', 'Heat another skillet over medium heat and brush with about 1 teaspoon oil. Place one tortilla in the hot skillet; spoon about 1/6 of the shrimp filling and 1/2 cup Mexican cheese blend onto one side of tortilla. Fold tortilla in half. Cook until lightly browned on the bottom, about 5 minutes. Flip and cook until lightly browned on the other side, 3 to 5 minutes. Repeat to make remaining quesadillas.']

title: Portuguese Custard Tarts (Pasteis de Nata) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '4 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '12 tarts'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cold water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'stick', 'Name': 'high-quality unsalted butter, fully softened, divided'}]
directions: ["Combine flour, salt, and cold water in a bowl. Mix with a wooden spoon until dough just comes together and pulls away from the sides of the bowl. Dough should be sticky; adjust with more flour or water to achieve what's shown in the video.", 'Transfer dough onto a well-floured surface. Dust a little more flour over the top. Knead for 1 to 2 minutes to form a round. Cover and let rest for 15 to 20 minutes.', 'Roll dough into a square about 1/8-inch-thick, dusting with flour as necessary; dough should still be sticky.', 'Spread 1/3 of the butter over 2/3 of the square using a silicone spatula, leaving a 1/2-inch border. Flip the unbuttered side over the middle of the square and fold the opposite end over it like a letter. Straighten the edges as needed.', 'Turn dough with a bench scraper to unstick it from the counter; dust with flour. Flip and sprinkle more flour on top. Roll dough into a 1/8-inch-thick rectangle, carefully stretching edges as needed. Spread another 1/3 of the butter over 2/3 of the dough. Fold into thirds. Transfer onto a lined baking sheet and freeze until butter is slightly chilled, about 10 minutes.', 'Sprinkle dough with flour and roll into a square a little over 1/8-inch-thick. Spread remaining butter over the dough, leaving a 1- to 1 1/2-inch border on the top edge. Dip your finger in water and lightly moisten the unbuttered edge. Roll dough into a log starting from the bottom edge. Dust with more flour and polish the ends as needed. Seal with plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 2 hours, preferably overnight.', 'Combine sugar, 1/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon water, cinnamon, and lemon zest in a pot. Boil over medium heat, without stirring, until syrup reaches 210 to 215 degrees F (100 degrees C). Remove from heat.', 'Preheat the oven to 550 degrees F (288 degrees C). Grease a 12-cup muffin tin.', 'Whisk flour, salt, and cold milk together very thoroughly in a cold pot. Cook over medium heat, whisking constantly, until milk thickens, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool for at least 10 minutes.', 'Whisk egg yolks into the cooled milk. Add sugar syrup and vanilla extract. Mix until combined. Strain custard into a glass measuring cup.', 'Unwrap the dough and trim any uneven bits on the ends. Score log into 12 even pieces using a knife; cut through.', 'Place a piece of dough in each muffin cup. Dip your thumb lightly in some cold water. Press your thumb into the center of the swirl; push dough against the bottom and up the sides of the cup until it reaches least 1/8 inch past the top.', 'Fill each cup 3/4 of the way with custard.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until the pastry is browned and bubbly, and the tops start to blister and caramelize, about 12 minutes.', 'Cool tarts briefly and serve warm. Enjoy!']

title: Homemade Portuguese Chicken Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '8 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '9 hrs 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 chicken legs'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'lemon juice'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, peeled'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'paprika'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'dried oregano'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'sea salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chili powder, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'red pepper flakes, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bay leaf'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'chicken leg quarters'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'sea salt to taste'}]
directions: ['Combine lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, paprika, oregano, 1 teaspoon sea salt, chili powder, red pepper flakes, bay leaf, and black pepper in a blender or food processor. Blend until sauce is very smooth.', 'Use a knife to score chicken legs a few times and place in a resealable plastic bag (or a large bowl). Pour about 1/3 cup sauce over chicken legs; stir to coat well. Season with additional sea salt. Seal the bag (or cover the bowl) and marinate in the refrigerator, 8 hours to overnight. Reserve remaining sauce for basting.', 'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Place marinated chicken in a baking dish; discard any excess marinade. Cover the dish with aluminum foil.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes. Turn chicken over and baste with reserved sauce. Re-cover with foil and bake for 20 to 25 minutes. Remove foil and continue baking until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 15 to 20 minutes more. An instant-read thermometer inserted near a bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).']

title: Caldo Verde (Portuguese Green Soup) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'onion, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'clove', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'quarts', 'Name': 'cold water'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'linguiça sausage, thinly sliced'}, {'Quantity': '2 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'kale, rinsed and julienned'}]
directions: ['Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook for 3 minutes. Add potatoes and cook, stirring constantly, for 3 minutes. Pour in water and bring to a boil; boil gently until potatoes are very tender, about 20 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, cook sausage in a large skillet over medium-low heat until it has released most of its fat, about 10 minutes. Drain.', 'Use an immersion blender to purée potato mixture. Stir in sausage and season with salt and pepper. Increase the heat to medium, cover, and simmer for 5 minutes.', 'Stir in kale and simmer until tender and bright green, about 5 minutes. Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil and serve immediately.']

title: Caldo Verde (Portuguese Sausage Kale Soup)
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '12', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'linguica sausage, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, finely diced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'russet potatoes, peeled and sliced 1/8 to 1/4 inch thick'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'salt, plus more as needed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'quarts', 'Name': 'chicken broth or water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'kale - trimmed, chopped, rinsed, drained'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper (Optional)'}]
directions: ['Slice sausage into 1/4-inch rounds. Heat oil in a pot over medium-high heat. Add sausage and saute until sausage begins to turn brown and renders some fat, 3 to 5 minutes. Transfer with a slotted spoon to a dish. Reduce heat to medium-low; add onions and pinch of salt salt. Stir and cook until softened, 4 to 5 minutes.', 'Transfer potatoes to pot. Sprinkle in 2 teaspoons salt. Pour in chicken broth. Increase heat to high and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to medium-low; simmer until potatoes are tender, 8 to 10 minutes.', 'When potatoes are tender, carefully mash them in the broth with a potato masher until broken up or completely mashed. Add kale, a handful at a time. Transfer browned sausage to soup. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until greens are tender, about 45 minutes.']

title: Wine and Garlic Pork (Portuguese Vina Dosh) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '2 days'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 days 40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'red wine'}, {'Quantity': '7', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bay leaves'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'whole cloves, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'dried thyme'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(3 pound)', 'Name': 'boneless pork shoulder, cut into 1-inch cubes'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}]
directions: ['Whisk red wine vinegar, red wine, garlic, bay leaves, cloves, black pepper, salt, and thyme together in a bowl; pour into a resealable plastic bag. Add the pork, coat with the marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag. Marinate in the refrigerator 2 to 4 days, turning occasionally.', 'Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Drain the pork, reserving 1/2 cup of marinade. Put pork and reserved marinade in a baking dish.', 'Bake in preheated oven until the pork is completely warmed, about 20 minutes. Drain as much liquid from the pork as possible.', 'Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Add the pork to the skillet in batches to prevent crowding; cook and stir in hot oil until completely browned and no longer pink in the center, 10 to 15 minutes.']

title: Malasadas Recipe

title: Portuguese Shrimp Recipe

title: Portuguese Custard Tarts - Pasteis de Nata Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '12 tarts'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'vanilla bean'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'egg yolks'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(17.5 ounce) package', 'Name': 'frozen puff pastry, thawed'}]
directions: ['Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C.) Lightly grease 12 muffin cups and line bottom and sides with puff pastry.', 'In a saucepan, combine milk, cornstarch, sugar and vanilla. title: Maria's Portuguese Bacalau Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '1 day 1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 day 2 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'dried salted cod'}, {'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped fresh parsley, divided'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, chopped, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'Yukon Gold potatoes'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons unsalted', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'yellow onions, thinly sliced'}, {'Quantity': '10', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'pitted green olives'}, {'Quantity': '10', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'pitted black olives'}, {'Quantity': '4 hard-cooked', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs, chopped'}]
directions: ['Soak dried salted cod in cold water for 24 hours, changing the water several times.', 'Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add soaked cod; boil until flakes easily with a fork, about 5 minutes. Transfer cod to a cutting board; save water for cooking potatoes. Remove cod skin and bones then flake the meat into pieces using a fork; set aside in a large bowl.', 'Whisk olive oil, 1 tablespoon parsley, 1 clove garlic, pepper flakes, and black pepper together in a small bowl; pour over cod and lightly toss to coat.', 'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8x11-inch baking dish.', 'Place potatoes in reserved pot salt cod cooking water; bring to a boil. Cook until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain under cool water, peel, and cut into 1/4-inch slices.', 'While potatoes cook, melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions; sauté until golden and caramelized. Stir in remaining 1 clove garlic; set aside.', 'Layer 1/2 of the potatoes in the bottom of the prepared baking dish; cover with 1/2 of the cod, then 1/2 of the onions. Repeat layers, ending with onions.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, about 15 minutes. Garnish with olives and hard-cooked eggs; sprinkle with remaining 7 tablespoons parsley.']

title: Portuguese Muffins - Bolo Levedo Recipe

title: Portuguese Chourico and Peppers Recipe
