title: Portuguese Pork Alentejana Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '6 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '7 hrs 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 to 6 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'dry white wine'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'paprika'}, {'Quantity': '2 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, peeled and cut in half'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bay leaf'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'pork loin, cut into 1 inch cubes'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'olive oil, divided'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onions, peeled and thinly sliced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'finely chopped garlic'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'tomatoes - peeled, seeded and chopped'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'crushed red pepper flakes'}, {'Quantity': '24', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'clams in shell, scrubbed'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}]
directions: ['In large bowl, combine wine, paprika, salt and pepper, blend well. Add garlic cloves, bay leaf, and cubed meat, turn meat in marinade to coat pieces. Marinate for 6 hours, turning occasionally.', 'Drain pork; reserve marinade. Pat cubes completely dry. Discard garlic and bay leaf. Melt 1 teaspoon of oil in large skillet. Add pork cubes, stirring frequently so that the meat colors quickly and evenly. Transfer with slotted spoon to a bowl.', 'Pour reserved marinade into skillet and bring to a boil over high heat, scraping off any brown particles clinging to the inside of pan. Boil briskly uncovered until marinade is reduced to 1 cup. Pour over pork and set aside.', 'In 6 to 8 quart pan, heat remaining 2 teaspoons oil; add onion and cook for 5 minutes, stirring frequently until onion is soft but not brown. Add garlic, tomatoes and crushed red pepper. Simmer, stirring constantly for 5 minutes.', 'Spread the clams, hinged side down, over the tomato sauce; cover the pan tightly and cook over medium to high heat for ten minutes or until clams open. Stir in reserved pork and juices. Simmer for 5 minutes to heat thoroughly. Sprinkle with parsley.']

title: Portuguese Sopas Recipe

Cook over medium heat until roast is tender, adding more water if needed, about 4 hours.', 'Stir cabbage wedges into the pot. Simmer until cabbage is tender, about 30 minutes.']

title: Quince Paste Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs 50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '32'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 (9x13-inch) block'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4 ½', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'ripe quinces'}, {'Quantity': '5 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'water to cover'}]
directions: ["Wash, peel, and core quinces, reserving cores and peels. Coarsely chop flesh and transfer fruit to a large pan. Wrap cores and peels in cheesecloth, tie the bag with kitchen string and add it to the pan. (The peels contain most of fruit's pectin, which contributes to the firmness of quince paste.)", "Pour in enough water to cover quinces and boil, with the pan partly covered, until fruit is soft, about 30 to 40 minutes. Remove the bag of peels and pass quince flesh through a sieve or food mill. (For best results, don't use a food processor as it will result in too fine a texture.) You should have about 2 ½ pounds of fruit pulp.", 'Transfer quince pulp to a saucepan and add sugar. Ideally, you should add the same amount of sugar, by weight, as fruit pulp. Cook and stir over low heat until sugar is dissolved. Continue cooking, frequently stirring with a wooden spoon, until paste becomes very thick and has a deep orange color, about 1 ½ hours. Draw the wooden spoon along the bottom of the saucepan: it should leave a trail, and quince mixture will stick to the spoon.', 'Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish or line it with greased parchment paper. Transfer quince paste to the baking dish, spreading it about 1 ½ inches thick. Smooth the top and allow it to cool.', 'Dry paste for about 1 ½ hours on your lowest oven setting, no more than 125 degrees F (52 degrees C). Allow quince paste to cool completely before slicing. In Europe, the traditional method of drying quince paste is to leave it in a cupboard for about 7 days. The remaining juices will continue to evaporate and render a drier paste.', 'Store quince paste in an airtight container in the refrigerator; the color will deepen with age.']

title: Queijadas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '18'}]

directions: ['Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).', 'In a blender, combine eggs, sugar, and butter. Blend until smooth. Pour in flour and milk, a little at a time, blending until smooth again. Stir in vanilla.', 'Pour into muffin tins, filling 3/4 full. Bake in the preheated oven, 45 minutes, until golden brown. Serve hot or cold.']

title: Kale and Cabbage Soup Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'tomatoes, peeled and chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'dried minced onion'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'stalks', 'Name': 'celery, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bay leaves'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'hot water'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'head', 'Name': 'green cabbage, shredded'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'beef base'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'herbes de Provence'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'red pepper flakes (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'Name': 'kidney beans, rinsed and drained'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'bunch', 'Name': 'kale, chopped'}]
directions: ['Combine tomatoes, butter, dried minced onion, salt, and black pepper in a small saucepan over medium heat; cover and simmer for 10 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a stockpot over medium heat. Add celery, onion, garlic, and bay leaves; cook and stir until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Add tomato mixture; cook and stir another 5 minutes.', 'Remove and discard bay leaves; add water, green cabbage, beef base, herbes de Provence, and red pepper flakes. Partially cover the pot and simmer until cabbage is very tender, about 20 minutes.', 'Stir in kidney beans and kale; partially cover the pot and continue cooking until heated through, about 15 minutes.']

title: Portuguese Steamed Clams Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]

title: Captain Duarte's Salt Cod Cakes Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '8 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '9 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '18 cod cakes'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'salted cod fish'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'potatoes, peeled and cubed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'seafood seasoning'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs, beaten'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'olive oil for frying'}]
directions: ['Place salt cod into a bowl and cover with cold water. Refrigerate for 8 hours; pour off water and replace it with fresh water every 2 hours.', 'After soaking cod for 8 hours, rinse in cold water and cut into 3-inch portions.', 'Place cod and potatoes into a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until potatoes are tender and cod flakes easily with a fork, about 20 minutes. Drain and allow to cool for 10 minutes.', 'Place potatoes and cod into a mixing bowl. Season with seafood seasoning, pepper, and parsley; roughly mash with a potato masher. Stir in eggs and onion until evenly combined; there should still be pieces of cod and potato in mixture.', 'Place flour into a shallow bowl. Form cod mixture into golf ball-sized pieces and roll in flour. Press between your palms to flatten slightly.', 'Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Working in batches, cook cod cakes in hot oil until golden and crispy on both sides, about 3 minutes per side. Drain on a paper towel-lined plate.']

title: Codfish with Cream Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 day'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 day 1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '12', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'dried salted cod'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'vegetable oil for frying'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'potatoes, peeled and cut into very small cubes'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'onion, sliced thin'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'hot milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'heavy cream, divided'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'ounce', 'Name': 'grated Parmesan cheese'}]
directions: ['Soak cod in cold water, skin-side up, for 24 hours, changing water about 4 times. Drain and discard water.', 'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Place cod in a saucepan with enough water to cover; bring to a boil and cook for 10 minutes. Transfer cod to a work surface; remove and discard skin and bones. Cut cod into chunks; set aside.', 'Heat 1/2 inch vegetable oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add potatoes, working in batches if necessary; fry until just cooked, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate; drain.', 'Add 1/2 cup olive oil to a Dutch oven or heat-proof casserole dish over medium heat. Add onion and garlic; cook until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Add cod; cook 3 minutes. Stir in potatoes; cook 1 to 2 minutes. Reduce heat to low.', 'Melt butter in a separate saucepan over medium-low heat; vigorously stir in flour. Slowly stream in hot milk while stirring; cook and stir until thick. Season with nutmeg. Stir into cod mixture with 1 1/3 cups cream; stir to coat. Simmer for about 2 minutes; season with salt and black pepper. Drizzle remaining 2/3 cup cream over mixture; sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until top is browned, 30 to 40 minutes. Serve hot.']

title: Jag (Portuguese Rice and Beans) Recipe

title: Portuguese Sausage Soup Recipe

ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'Yukon Gold potatoes, diced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'sweet onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'diced carrots (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'diced celery (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'red pepper flakes, or more to taste (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'bunch', 'Name': 'kale, stems removed and leaves chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bay leaves'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chicken broth'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(14 ounce) can', 'Name': 'garbanzo beans, with liquid'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(14 ounce) can', 'Name': 'diced tomatoes'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'linguica sausage, diced'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'chorizo sausage, diced'}]
directions: ['Heat oil in a soup pot over medium heat until it sizzles, about 1 minute. Add potatoes, onion, carrots, and celery; cook and stir 3 to 4 minutes. Add garlic, red pepper flakes, salt, and black pepper; cook and stir 2 to 3 minutes.', 'Add kale and bay leaves; cover until kale wilts, 2 to 3 minutes.', 'Add chicken broth, garbanzo beans with their juices, tomatoes, linguica, and chorizo; bring to a boil, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to medium; simmer until vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes.']

title: Linguica (Smoked Portuguese Sausage)
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '10 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '12 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '10 pork sausages'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'Pork, fresh, backfat, raw'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '7', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(4 pound)', 'Name': 'pork butt, cut into 1-inch chunks'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'red table wine'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sweet paprika'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'powdered milk'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'cider vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'hickory-flavored liquid smoke'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'dried marjoram'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'ground white pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'crushed red pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'feet', 'Name': 'hog casing'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lump charcoal'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'hickory wood chunks'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'toothpicks'}]
directions: ['Rinse fatback thoroughly and soak in warm water for 30 minutes. Remove and chop into small pieces.', 'Pour olive oil in a small pan and saute garlic for 30 seconds to 1 minute. Do not let it brown. Remove from pan and put into a large bowl. Add fatback, pork butt, wine, paprika, milk, vinegar, salt, sugar, liquid smoke, marjoram, white pepper, black pepper, and red pepper and mix until everything is well combined. Cover and refrigerate for 8 hours, or overnight.', 'Test the sausage flavor by frying a small bit of it in a pan and tasting it. Adjust spices if needed and place back in the refrigerator, covered, for 2 more hours.', 'Run water through hog casings and rinse out as well as possible. Soak in warm water for 30 minutes.', 'Set up sausage stuffing attachment on KitchenAid®. Squeeze out water from a length of casing. Tie one end in a knot, then roll onto sausage making fitting like a condom. Turn KitchenAid® onto medium speed. Feed cold sausage mixture a little at a time into the funnel. Use one hand to keep casing tight and one to feed meat mixture. Twist off links as you get to desired length. Repeat with remaining hog casings and sausage mixture.', "Add several handfuls of hot coal into a smoker to get a base temperature going, then let the temperature die down to about 140 degrees F 60 degrees C). You need a cold smoke to smoke the sausages so it doesn't cook and the skin doesn't get browned.", 'When smoker has the right temperature, add hickory wood chunks. The temperature will spike again, so let it cool back down to 140 degrees F (60 degrees C).', "Using toothpicks, hang sausages in the smoker as far away from the direct heat source as possible. Maintain temperature at 140 degrees F (60 degrees C) as best as possible. It's difficult - don't sweat it if you get spikes. Just open the smoker door and let heat escape accordingly.", 'Smoke until links are deep red and skin is starting to firm, about 1 1/2 hours.', 'Remove from smoker and let rest for 30 minutes. Cook like any other sausage before, either pan-fry or grill, before serving.']

title: Bacalhau Portuguese ao Forno (Salt Cod with Tomatoes and Olives) Recipe

directions: ['Soak cod in a large bowl of water in the refrigerator for 24 hours, changing soaking water 4 times to remove excess salt.', 'Drain water off cod; add lemon juice and salt. title: Portuguese Chourico, Beans, and Rice Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '2'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '2 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'uncooked white rice'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'dried chourico sausage, halved lengthwise and cut into 1/4-inch slices'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'Spanish onion, finely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'Italian seasoning'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'Name': 'fava beans, rinsed and drained'}]
directions: ['Bring the water to a boil in a pot; stir the rice into the boiling water, reduce heat to low, place cover on the pot, and allow the rice to cook until all the moisture is absorbed, about 30 minutes.', 'As the rice cooks, heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook the chourico in the hot oil for 2 minutes. Add the onions and garlic to the sausage and continue cooking until the vegetables are soft and the chourico has browned, 5 to 7 minutes.', 'Stir the tomato sauce into the chourico mixture. Reduce heat to low. Season with the red pepper flakes, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper; simmer until thoroughly heated, 10 to 15 minutes. Stir the fava beans into the mixture and continue cooking just long enough for the beans to heat, 2 to 3 minutes. Serve over rice.']

title: Hearty Portuguese Bean Soup Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'quarts', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'ham hock'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(10 ounce)', 'Name': 'linguiça sausage, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, minced'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'potatoes, peeled and cubed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'ribs celery, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'carrots, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'Name': 'stewed tomatoes'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(8 ounce) can', 'Name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'clove', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'Name': 'kidney beans'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'head', 'Name': 'cabbage, thinly sliced'}]
directions: ['Place water, ham hock, linguiça, and onion in a Dutch oven over high heat; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer for 1 hour.', 'Remove meat from ham hock, chop, and return to soup. Stir in potatoes, celery, carrots, stewed tomatoes, tomato sauce, and garlic. Cover; simmer for 1 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally.', 'Stir in kidney beans and cabbage; cook until cabbage has softened, about 10 minutes.']

title: Portuguese Egg Tarts Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '12 egg tarts'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cooking spray'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(11 ounce) package', 'Name': 'pie crust mix (such as Betty Crocker®)'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'cold butter, cubed'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'ice cold water'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'egg yolks'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'heavy cream'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'drops', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}]
directions: ['Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Spray 12 muffin cups with cooking spray.', 'Place the pie crust mix into a bowl, and lightly rub the butter and water into the mix until the mixture holds together well enough to form a ball. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface, and knead several times to make the dough more elastic. Form into a ball again, and cut the ball in half; cut each half into half again (4 pieces); cut each quarter into thirds to make 12 total pieces. Roll the pieces into balls, and set aside.', 'Beat together the egg yolks, sugar, cream, milk, and vanilla extract in a bowl until light and foamy, about 3 minutes; strain the filling through a fine mesh strainer into a clean bowl.', 'Press a dough ball into the bottom and about 1 1/2 inches up the sides of a prepared muffin cup; repeat for remaining dough pieces. Spoon each crust about 80 percent full of the egg yolk mixture.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until the crusts are golden brown, the filling is set, and the tarts are lightly browned, 15 to 20 minutes.']

title: Portuguese Kale Soup Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '6 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '8 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '10 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'dried white pea beans'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'chorizo sausage, thinly sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'beef soup bones'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'quart', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'medium head', 'Name': 'cabbage, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'bunches', 'Name': 'kale - rinsed, dried and chopped'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'potatoes, peeled and cubed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'quart', 'Name': 'hot water or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}]
directions: ['Soak beans in twice their volume of water 8 hours or overnight.', 'In a large pot, place drained beans, chorizo, soup bones and 1 quart water (or more as needed to cover). Cook over medium heat until beans are just beginning to be tender, 1 hour.', 'Stir in cabbage, kale, potatoes and enough hot water to cover. Cook until potatoes are tender, 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.']

title: Portuguese Coconut Cakes (Bolos de Coco) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '3'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '3 coconut cakes'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 ¾', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'shredded coconut'}, {'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'grated lemon zest'}]
directions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line 3 muffin cups with paper liners.', 'Mix coconut, sugar, eggs, and lemon zest together in a large bowl. Scoop coconut mixture into lined muffin cups.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until firm and golden, 15 to 20 minutes.']

title: Easy Portuguese Cookies Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '24'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '2 dozen'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '2 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'baking powder'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).', 'In a medium bowl, stir together the cornstarch and white sugar. Add the butter and cream well. Add eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Combine the flour and baking powder; stir into the sugar mixture until a dough forms. On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough out to 1/4 inch thickness and cut into desired shapes with cookie cutters. Place cookies 1 inch apart onto an unprepared cookie sheet.', 'Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, until cookies are golden brown at the edges. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.']

title: Portuguese Chourico Stew Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'Name': 'chourico, cut into small pieces'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'clove', 'Name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'Name': 'canned tomato sauce'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'potatoes, diced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'dash', 'Name': 'paprika'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) cans', 'Name': 'green beans, drained'}]
directions: ['Heat a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Saute chourico, onion and garlic until onion is tender. Stir in tomato sauce, water and potatoes. Season with red pepper and paprika. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer 25 to 30 minutes, or until potatoes are tender. Stir in green beans, and simmer 5 to 10 minutes, or until heated through.']

title: Portuguese Burnt Sugar Candy Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '50'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '50 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'apple cider vinegar'}]
directions: ['In a saucepan, stir together the sugar, water and vinegar. Bring to a full rolling boil over medium-high heat. Continue to boil for about 15 minutes, or until the mixture turns a deep golden brown, or use a candy thermometer. The temperature should reach 300 degrees F (149 degrees C). Remove from the heat, and pour onto two well buttered heavy dinner plates.', 'When the candy begins to harden, pull from around the edges of the plates. Stretch into long ropes and cut into pieces with kitchen scissors, giving each piece a twist. Cool completely before storing in an airtight tin. Be careful! The candy will be very hot while pulling and cutting.']

title: Broa (Portuguese Cornbread) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '4 hrs 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '2 boules'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'milk, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'pats', 'Name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'cornmeal, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(.25 ounce) package', 'Name': 'active dry yeast'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'warm water'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'sea salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'olive oil, or to taste'}]
directions: ['Heat milk in a small saucepan over medium heat until it begins to bubble. Whisk in butter and 2 teaspoons sugar. Add cornmeal and whisk until mixture reaches a thick, sauce-like consistency. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature.', 'In the meantime, sprinkle yeast and a pinch of sugar over warm water. Stir and let stand until yeast softens and begins to form a creamy foam, about 5 minutes.', 'Combine flour and salt in the bowl of a stand mixture fitted with the dough hook. Add the yeast mixture and mix on low speed. Slowly pour in the milk mixture. Knead into a slightly dense dough. Remove from the bowl and roll into a ball.', 'Grease the sides of a bowl or pot with olive oil and add the dough. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place until doubled in volume, about 2 hours.', 'Punch dough down and roll into 2 boules, or flat-bottomed balls. Place boules on a baking sheet lined with a silicone mat. Sprinkle tops with flour and cover with plastic wrap again. Let rise until puffy, about 1 hour.', 'Preheat the oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C). Fill an oven-proof pot with 4 to 5 cups water and place on the bottom rack of the preheating oven.', 'Cut 4 shallow slits into the tops of the puffed bread boules in a cross pattern, 2 parallel lines up and 2 across.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Spritz tops with water from a spray bottle. Reduce oven temperature to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) and continue baking until crusts are a deep brown, about 20 minutes. Remove breads from the pan and let cool for 20 minutes.']

title: Malasadas Dois Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '1 day 6 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 day 6 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '48'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '48 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'sugar'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'warm water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(.25 ounce) envelope', 'Name': 'active dry yeast'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'lukewarm milk'}, {'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'butter or margarine, melted'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'quart', 'Name': 'vegetable oil for deep-frying'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar for decoration'}]
directions: ['Dissolve 1 teaspoon of sugar in warm water. Sprinkle yeast over the top, and let stand for about 5 minutes to dissolve.', 'In a large bowl, beat the eggs and 1 cup of sugar until sugar has completely dissolved. Stir in the salt and flour. Mix in the yeast mixture, milk and melted butter. A wooden spoon works well for this. Cover and set in a warm place to rise until doubled.', 'Once the dough has doubled, punch down and knead a bit - a lot if you want. The dough should be elastic. Cover and allow to rise again. If you like, you may refrigerate overnight. My grandmother would let it rise overnight, and hers were amazing. When the dough has doubled, it is ready to use.', 'Heat oil in a deep fryer or large deep skillet to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Set a small dish of water to the side for wetting your hands slightly before touching the dough. This will help it keep from sticking. Only wet your hands a little, excess water dripping in the hot oil is very dangerous.', 'With slightly wet hands, gather a small ball of dough about the size of a golf ball. Stretch the dough out a little bit while turning around until you have a disc about 4 inches wide. If you mess up, just throw it back in with the other dough, and start over. Tiny holes are fine.', 'Carefully place the stretched dough into the hot oil. The doughnuts should puff up a bit as they hit the oil. Cook for about 3 minutes per side. They are done when they are golden brown. Remove from the oil using a slotted spoon, and drain on paper towels. Coat with white sugar while still hot. Serve warm.']

title: Abade Prisco's Pudding Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'water'}]
directions: ['Heat 1 cup sugar and 1/2 cup water in a small saucepan over high heat without stirring. Reduce heat to low when sugar reaches an amber color, being careful to avoid burning. Carefully add 1 tablespoon water, stir, and remove from heat. Pour caramel into a lidded pudding pan, making sure to coat the entire inside of the pan.', 'Bring 2 cups water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Add 2 cups sugar, bacon, cinnamon, and lemon peels. Clip a candy thermometer to the side of the pan. Slowly heat syrup to 217 degrees F (103 degrees C) or until a small amount of syrup dropped in cold water forms a thin thread.', 'Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C) while syrup is cooking.', 'Pass egg yolks through a sieve into a bowl.', 'Heat port wine in a small saucepan over medium heat until it reduces by half, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool.', 'Pour the cooled port wine into the yolks, stirring as little as possible to avoid losing the color of the yolks.', 'Remove syrup from heat when it reaches 217 degrees F (103 degrees C). Pour into a bowl through a sieve to remove other ingredients. Allow syrup to cool slightly.', 'Pour yolk mixture into the bowl with the syrup. Pass the mixture through the sieve into a bowl. Pour mixture into the caramel-lined pudding pan. Cover the pan tightly with 2 layers of aluminum foil and the lid. Set the pan into a baking pan filled with an inch of water.', 'Bake pudding in the preheated oven until set, about 1 hour. Add water to the baking pan if necessary. Remove from the oven and place pan on a wire rack. Let pudding cool until center is lukewarm, at least 1 hour. Carefully unmold onto a serving plate. Refrigerate until ready to serve.']

title: Portuguese Snow Drops Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '10 snow drops'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'large egg whites'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'lemon juice'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).', 'Beat egg whites in a glass or metal bowl with an electric mixer until foamy. Gradually add sugar and lemon juice, continuing to beat until stiff peaks form. Lift the beater or whisk straight up: egg whites should hold sharp peaks.', 'Drop meringue mixture by heaping teaspoonfuls onto a baking sheet, making little peaked mounds.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned and dry on the outside yet soft and no longer gooey on the inside, 15 to 20 minutes.']

title: Portuguese Sweet Bread II Recipe

ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'margarine'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '3 ¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'bread flour'}, {'Quantity': '2 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'active dry yeast'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'lemon juice'}]

Once cycle is complete, shape dough and place in a greased loaf pan. Allow to rise in a warm spot until doubled in size. Bake in a preheated 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) oven for 35 to 45 minutes.']

title: Easy Portuguese Bean Soup Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'chorizo sausage, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'carrots, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped onion'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'stalks', 'Name': 'celery, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'tomatoes, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'potatoes, peeled and chopped'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'quarts', 'Name': 'chicken broth'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'Name': 'kidney beans, drained'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'tomato paste'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}]
directions: ['Place sausage in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown. Drain, crumble and set aside.', 'Heat oil in a stockpot over medium-high heat. Add carrots, onion, and celery; cook and stir for 2 to 3 minutes. Add tomatoes, potatoes, kidney beans and chicken broth. Bring to a boil and stir in cayenne pepper and tomato paste. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Add sausage and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.']

title: Spicy Red Bean Soup Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '20'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '20 or more servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'paprika'}, {'Quantity': '2 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'ketchup'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(1 ounce) package', 'Name': 'dry onion soup mix'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'linguica, casings removed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'chourico - Portuguese smoked pork sausage'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) cans', 'Name': 'kidney beans'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'potatoes, peeled and cubed'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'spaghetti'}]
directions: ['In a large pot over medium heat, combine the oil and the onion. Saute for 5 minutes, or until onion is tender. Add the paprika, ketchup, water, soup mix, salt and pepper and stir well. Cut the linguica and chourico into 3 inch pieces and add to the soup.', 'In a food processor or blender, puree the beans in small batches and add to the pot. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 2 to 3 hours. Add the potatoes and simmer for another hour. Break the spaghetti into 3 to 4 inch pieces, add to the pot and simmer for another 15 minutes, or until spaghetti is tender.']

title: Portuguese Sweet Bread III Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '13 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '15 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '24'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '2 round loaves'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(0.6 ounce) cakes', 'Name': 'compressed fresh yeast'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)'}, {'Quantity': '3 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1 ¼', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'butter, melted'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'egg, beaten'}]
directions: ['In a small bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water. Let stand until creamy, about 10 minutes.', 'In a medium bowl, beat 6 eggs and the sugar together until light and fluffy. Sift the flour and salt into a large bowl. Stir in the dissolved yeast, the egg and sugar mixture and the cooled, melted butter. Slowly add the milk to the flour mixture until the dough is of working consistency. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead until the dough is soft and elastic, about 15 minutes. Place into a well oiled bowl, and cover with a damp cloth. Set aside to rise overnight.', 'The next morning, preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C). Grease two 10 inch round cake pans. Divide dough in half, shape into round loaves, and place into prepared pans. Brush the tops with beaten egg.', 'Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 15 minutes, then lower temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake for another 40 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the loaves sound hollow when tapped on the bottom.']

title: Portuguese Pork and Clams Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white wine'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'dried oregano'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bay leaves'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'boneless pork loin, cubed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'cooked and diced potatoes'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'Name': 'cannellini beans'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'ground cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '18', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'clams'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chopped fresh parsley, for garnish'}]
directions: ['To Marinate: Combine the wine, garlic, oregano, salt, pepper, bay leaves, and cumin in a nonporous glass dish or bowl. Mix together. Add pork and toss to coat. Cover dish or bowl and refrigerate to marinate for 2 to 3 hours.', 'Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute until soft. Remove pork from dish or bowl (reserving marinade) and add to skillet; brown quickly, then add potato cubes, reserved marinade, beans, cayenne pepper and clams or mussels. Cook until open, about 7 minutes. Garnish with parsley and serve hot.']

title: Portuguese Sausage and Kale Soup (Caldo Verde) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'Portuguese linguica sausage, cut into 1/2-inch think slices'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'onions, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, roughly chopped'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chicken broth'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'white potatoes, cut into 1/2-inch cubes'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'kale, stemmed and cut into strips'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cannellini beans, drained'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt to taste'}]
directions: ['Saute sausage slices in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until browned, 3 to 5 minutes per side. Transfer sausage to a plate, leaving any fat in the skillet.', 'Add olive oil to the skillet and heat oil over medium heat; stir in onions. Cook and stir until the onions begin to brown, 8 to 10 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Return sausage to the pot and add chicken broth, potatoes, and pepper; bring to a boil. Add kale and cannellini beans, reduce heat slightly, and simmer until sausage is cooked through and potatoes are tender, about 30 minutes. Season with salt.']

title: Chicken Sofrito Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breasts, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'Name': 'chourico sausage, cubed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(12 fluid ounce) can or bottle', 'Name': 'beer'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'carrots, peeled and cut into chunks, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, cut into chunks'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped fresh parsley, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'sofrito'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'red cooking wine'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '(.18 ounce) packets', 'Name': 'sazon seasoning (such as Goya®)'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}]
directions: ['Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).', 'Place potatoes, chicken, chourico, beer, carrots, onion, parsley, sofrito, cooking wine, sazon seasoning, garlic, salt, and black pepper in a large Dutch oven; mix well to combine. Cover with aluminum foil.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the chicken reads at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C) and vegetables are tender, about 2 1/2 hours.']

title: Portuguese Braised Chicken Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '10 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'linguica sausage, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green bell pepper, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'chicken parts'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'chopped fresh oregano'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chopped fresh basil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'dry white wine'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chicken broth'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bay leaves'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'orange, cut into wedges'}]
directions: ['Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium heat. Add sausage, onion, and bell pepper; saute until vegetables are softened and sausage is browned, about 10 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon to a plate, leaving drippings in the pot.', 'Combine oregano, basil, salt, and pepper in a small bowl and rub on chicken. Add chicken to the pot, raise heat to medium-high, and brown on all sides, about 10 minutes.', 'Stir sausage and vegetable mixture into the pot with wine, broth, bay leaves, and red pepper flakes. Bring to a boil; reduce heat to medium-low and let simmer, covered, until chicken is no longer pink in the centers, 35 to 45 minutes.', 'Remove and discard bay leaves. Serve chicken with orange wedges.']

title: Chourico Stew Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'Name': 'Portuguese chourico sausage, diced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'potatoes, diced'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'head', 'Name': 'cabbage, coarsely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'carrots, diced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'stalk', 'Name': 'celery, diced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'Name': 'mixed vegetables, drained'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garlic powder'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'celery salt'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground red pepper'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'cornstarch (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'water (Optional)'}]
directions: ['Place the water, chourico, potatoes, cabbage, carrots, onion, celery, canned vegetables, parsley, garlic powder, celery salt, and red pepper in a large pot. Bring to a simmer over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low and continue to simmer the soup until the vegetables are tender, about 40 minutes. If soup is too thin, stir in cornstarch dissolved in water to thicken.']

title: Stuffed Dates for Ramadan Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '20'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '20 dates'}]
