Grease a medium loaf pan.', 'Transfer milk and dates to food processor, add brown sugar, and process into a smooth paste. Mix in vegetable oil and vanilla extract with a few pulses.', 'Whisk flour, baking soda, and cinnamon in a bowl until thoroughly combined. Pulse flour mixture, about 1/4 cup at a time, into the date paste until batter is smooth; do not overmix. Stir walnuts into batter with a fork and transfer to the prepared loaf pan.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the middle of the cake comes out clean, about 40 minutes.']

title: Ashure Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 day'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 day 1 hr 55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'fine bulgur'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'dry garbanzo beans'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'dry white beans'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'raisins'}, {'Quantity': '15', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'dried apricots'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'orange peel, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'whole cloves'}]
directions: ['To make the pudding: Place bulgur, garbanzo beans, white beans, and raisins in 4 separate bowls and add water to cover. Let stand overnight.', 'The next day, combine garbanzo beans and white beans in a saucepan with water to cover. Bring to a boil; reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, until beans are tender, 1 to 1 ½ hours. Drain and set aside.', 'Drain bulgur and transfer to a large saucepan. Add 15 cups water (3 quarts plus 3 cups) and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes, skimming and discarding any foam that appears.', 'When bulgur has thickened, stir in sugar and bring mixture to a boil. Add cooked beans to bulgur mixture. Stir in drained raisins, apricots, orange peel, and cloves. Reduce heat and simmer until pudding thickens and fruit is tender, about 15 minutes.', 'Pour pudding into individual serving bowls. Garnish with sesame seeds, walnuts, pistachios, currants, and cinnamon. Allow pudding to cool, then serve.']

title: Beghrir (Moroccan Pancakes) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '12 pancakes'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'warm water (115 degrees F/46 degrees C)'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'active dry yeast'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'semolina flour'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'baking powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}]
directions: ['Place the water, yeast, and sugar in a blender, and let stand without blending for 5 minutes, until the yeast softens and begins to form a creamy foam. Add the milk, flour, semolina flour, eggs, baking powder, and salt. Blend until the mixture is smooth, about 1 minute. Leave the mixture in the blender to rest for about 30 minutes.', 'Heat a 5-inch nonstick skillet over medium-low heat. Blend the pancake mixture for about 10 seconds, to remix, and scoop 1/4 to 1/3 cup of batter into the heated skillet. Cook the beghrir until bubbles have formed and popped, and the top of the pancake is no longer shiny, about 3 minutes. Do not flip. Adjust the heat as necessary so that the bottoms of the pancakes are just starting to brown when the tops are dry. Blend the batter for 10 seconds or so after cooking 3 or 4 pancakes, to keep the batter fluffy.', 'To make the sauce, place the butter, honey, and flower-water flavoring in a microwave-safe bowl, and microwave on High setting until the butter is melted and the honey is hot, about 1 1/2 minutes. Stir the sauce, and drizzle about 1 tablespoon over each warm pancake to serve.']

title: Curry Pasta - Pakistani Style Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chickpea flour (besan)'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'red bell peppers, seeded and diced'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'fresh curry leaves'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'cubed skinless, boneless chicken'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ginger garlic paste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'hot paprika'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(2 ounce) package', 'Name': 'coconut milk powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'Name': 'spaghetti'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green chile peppers, sliced into thin rings'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lemon, cut into thin slices'}]
directions: ['Heat a small skillet over medium heat. Add the chickpea flour and cook, stirring frequently, until the flour darkens slightly and smells fragrant, about five minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and pour the toasted chickpea flour into a bowl to cool.', 'Heat a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the red bell peppers and curry leaves and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Mix in the cubed chicken and cook, stirring frequently, until no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Stir in the ginger-garlic paste and fry for 30 seconds.', 'Combine the turmeric, cayenne pepper, and chickpea flour. Sprinkle the spice mixture over the chicken mixture and cook, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes. Pour in 1/4 cup of water to prevent the spices from sticking to the bottom of the pan. Dissolve the coconut powder in 1 cup of water. Pour it over the chicken mixture and reduce the heat to low. Stir the mixture occasionally while you prepare the pasta.', 'Fill a large pot with well-salted water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat. Once the water is boiling, stir in the spaghetti, and return to a boil. Cook the pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the pasta has cooked through but is still firm to the bite, about 12 minutes. Drain well in a colander set in the sink.', 'Transfer the hot spaghetti to a serving bowl and pour the chicken mixture over the pasta. Garnish with sliced green chilies, cilantro, and lemon slices.']

title: Kofta Kebabs Recipes
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '28'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '28 skewers'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'ground lamb'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'grated onion'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground allspice'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground ginger'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '28', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bamboo skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes'}]
directions: ["Mash garlic into a paste with salt using a mortar and pestle or the flat side of a chef's knife on your cutting board.", 'Mix garlic into lamb with onion, parsley, coriander, cumin, cinnamon, allspice, cayenne pepper, ginger, and pepper in a mixing bowl until well blended.', 'Form mixture into 28 balls. Form each ball around the tip of a skewer, flattening it into a 2-inch oval; repeat with remaining skewers. Place kebabs onto a baking sheet, cover, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 12 hours.', 'Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.', 'Cook skewers on the preheated grill, turning occasionally, until browned and cooked through, about 5 to 6 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a kebab should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).', 'Serve hot and enjoy!']

title: Beef and Okra Bamia Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '⅔', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'salt, more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'beef top sirloin, cut into 1-inch cubes'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(10 ounce) cans', 'Name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'tomato paste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(10 ounce) package', 'Name': 'frozen okra, thawed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground white pepper'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'jalapeño pepper, thinly sliced'}]
directions: ['Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over high heat. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon salt over meat cubes. Add meat, onion, and garlic to the pan and cook until meat begins to brown, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to medium and continue to cook, about 3 more minutes. Remove meat and set aside.', 'Stir tomato sauce and tomato paste into the pan. Add okra, water, coriander, white pepper, and cumin. Bring to a boil. Season with salt to taste, reduce heat to low, and simmer until okra is tender, 30 to 45 minutes.', 'Return meat to the pan. Simmer until flavors are blended, about 10 minutes. Serve garnished with slices of jalapeño pepper.']

title: Noni Afghani Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 loaves'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'warm water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(.25 ounce) envelope', 'Name': 'active dry yeast'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1 ¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'salt, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'corn oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'egg'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'caraway seed (Optional)'}]
directions: ['In a small bowl, stir together 1/2 cup warm water and sugar. Sprinkle the yeast over the top, and let stand for about 10 minutes, until foamy.', 'Place flour in a large bowl, and stir in salt. Make a well in the center, and pour in the corn oil and yeast mixture. Add the remaining water in small amounts until you have a soft moist dough that can be handled. Turn out onto a floured surface, and knead for at least 5 minutes. Return to the bowl, cover with a towel, and let rise until doubled in size, about 1 1/2 hours.', 'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Deflate the risen dough, and divide into 8 pieces. Roll each piece into a ball.', 'On a lightly floured surface, roll each ball with a rolling pin so it is oval shaped, about 6 inches long, and 1/2 inch thick. Use a fork or dull knife to draw three lines on the top of each loaf. Place the loaves on a baking sheet. Mix together the egg and remaining tablespoon of water; brush the tops of the loaves with the mixture. Sprinkle caraway seeds over the tops, if using.', 'Bake for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven, until the loaves are shiny and golden brown.']

title: Upside Down (Maqluba) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '7', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onions, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'chopped garlic'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'garam masala'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'cooking oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'lamb meat, cut into small pieces'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggplant, cut into 3/4-inch slices'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'zucchini, cut into 1/4-inch slices'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'broccoli'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cauliflower'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'jasmine rice'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) container', 'Name': 'plain yogurt'}]
directions: ['Bring to a boil the water, onion, garlic, cinnamon, turmeric, garam masala, salt, and pepper in a large pot. Add the lamb; reduce the heat to low and simmer 15 to 20 minutes. Separate the lamb from the liquid and set aside. Transfer the liquid to a bowl.', 'While the lamb mixture simmers, heat the oil in a large, deep skillet over medium heat. Fry the eggplant slices in the hot oil, assuring the pieces do not touch, until brown on both sides; remove to a plate lined with paper towels to drain. Use the same procedure to fry the zucchini and the cauliflower. Cook the broccoli in the oil until hot and remove to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.', 'Layer the lamb into the bottom of the large pot. Arrange the eggplant, zucchini, broccoli, and cauliflower on top of the lamb in layers. Pour the rice over the meat and vegetables, shaking the pot gently to allow the rice to settle into the dish. Pour the reserved cooking liquid from the lamb over the mixture until it is completely covered. Add water if needed.', 'Cover the pot and simmer over low heat until the rice is soft and the liquid is absorbed, 30 to 45 minutes. Remove the lid from the pot. Place a large platter over the pot and flip the pot so the dish is "upside down" on the platter. Serve with yogurt on the side.']

title: Persian Halva Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'rose water'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'saffron threads'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}]
directions: ['Bring sugar and water to a boil in a saucepan; cook, stirring constantly, until sugar is dissolved, about 5 minutes.', 'Stir rosewater and saffron into the sugar mixture; cover the saucepan and remove from the heat.', 'Melt butter in a large saucepan over low heat; stir flour into melted butter until mixture is a smooth paste. Continue to cook, stirring often, until paste turns golden, 5 to 10 more minutes.', 'Slowly whisk sugar mixture into paste until smooth. Remove the saucepan from the heat.', 'Spread halva evenly onto a plate or platter. Make a pattern on the top of halva using the back of a spoon or a knife. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until set, at least 1 hour.']

title: Harira Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'cubed lamb meat'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'yellow onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'red onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped celery'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'margarine'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground ginger'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(29 ounce) can', 'Name': 'diced tomatoes, juice reserved'}, {'Quantity': '7', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'green lentils'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'Name': 'garbanzo beans, drained'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'vermicelli pasta'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs, beaten'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lemon, juiced'}]
directions: ['Combine lamb, onions, celery, cilantro, margarine, pepper, turmeric, cinnamon, ginger, and cayenne in a large soup pot over low heat. Cook, stirring frequently, for 5 minutes. Pour in tomatoes (without juice) and simmer for 15 minutes.', 'Add water, reserved tomato juice, and lentils. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat, cover, and simmer for 1 hour 50 minutes.', 'Increase the heat to medium-high and add garbanzo beans and vermicelli pasta. Cook until noodles are tender yet firm to the bite, about 10 minutes. Stir in eggs and lemon juice and cook for 1 minute.']

title: Yazdi Cakes Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '24'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '24 cakes'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking powder'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1 ¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'butter, melted'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'plain yogurt'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'rose water'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'blanched slivered almonds'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chopped pistachio nuts'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease the cups of a muffin pan. You will need 24 cups.', 'Sift flour and baking powder into a bowl; set aside.', 'Combine the eggs and sugar in a large heatproof bowl and set on top of a pan of simmering water. Beat constantly with a whisk or electric mixer until thick and pale, about 8 minutes. Remove from the heat and continue to beat until cooled, about 10 minutes. Mix in the butter, yogurt, cardamom and rose water. Stir in the flour mixture by hand and fold in the slivered almonds. Spoon into the prepared cupcake molds, filling 3/4 full. Sprinkle some chopped pistachios over the tops.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until firm to the touch and golden brown, 25 to 30 minutes.']

title: Afghan Beef Raviolis (Mantwo) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'plain yogurt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chopped fresh mint leaves'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'ground beef'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chopped onion'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'carrot, grated'}, {'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '26', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'wonton wrappers'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'tomato paste'}, {'Quantity': '⅛', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'dried yellow split peas'}, {'Quantity': '⅛', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cube', 'Name': 'chicken bouillon'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}]
directions: ['In a small bowl, stir together yogurt, mint, and garlic. Refrigerate.', 'In a large skillet over medium heat, cook ground beef and onions until meat is browned, stirring occasionally to crumble; drain fat. Stir in 1 cup water, carrot, salt, black pepper, 1 1/2 teaspoons coriander, and 1/2 teaspoon cumin; simmer uncovered for 30 minutes or until water evaporates.', 'Lay out wonton wrappers on aluminum foil. Mound two large spoonfuls of beef mixture in the center of one wrapper. Dip a finger in water and trace it around all four edges. Lay a second wonton wrapper on top of the first, and press on all edges to seal. Roll up the edges to create a round, hat-shaped ravioli. Repeat, making 13 ravioli.', 'Place ravioli in steamer and steam 40 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, mix together the yellow split peas, 1/8 teaspoon red pepper flakes, 1 teaspoon coriander, 1/4 teaspoon cumin, chicken bouillon, and 1 1/2 cups of water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, then simmer over medium-low heat for about 45 minutes, or until it reaches a thick slurry-like consistency.', 'Meanwhile, in the large skillet, mix remaining beef mixture with 2 tablespoons water, tomato paste, and 1/8 teaspoon red pepper flakes. Simmer over low heat until liquid has evaporated, about 10 minutes.', 'To serve, spread yogurt on a serving plate. Top with ravioli, and top again with split pea mixture. Finally, top with tomato and beef mixture. Serve immediately.']

title: Lubia Polo (Green Bean Rice) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'ground beef'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'jalapeno pepper, finely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'curry powder'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chicken broth'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'fresh green beans, cut into 1 inch pieces'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'uncooked basmati rice, rinsed and drained'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}]
directions: ['Heat a large nonstick pan (one that has a lid) over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease. Stir in onion and jalapeño, and cook until tender. Season with curry powder; stir in chicken broth and tomato sauce. Bring to a boil, and stir in green beans. Reduce heat to medium and simmer until beans are tender, about 15 minutes.', 'Stir in rice, and cover the pan. Cook on medium heat for 10 to 15 minutes or until much of the liquid is absorbed. Be careful not to overcook rice at this point, or the dish will be mushy; the rice should be firm. Transfer everything in the pan to a bowl or heatproof container, and return the pot to the stove.', 'Heat oil in the nonstick pan over medium heat. Carefully dump cooked rice mixture back into the pan. Wrap a clean dish towel around the inside of the pot\'s lid. (The ends of the dish towel will be folded over the edges on top of the lid.) Put the lid on the pot. Cook over medium-low heat for 35 minutes without uncovering or stirring. Remove the lid and place a tray on top of the pot, then carefully flip it over. The rice will hold the shape of the pot and have a nice crust on top called "tah digh."']

title: Bengali Dhal Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'red lentils'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'onion, thinly sliced, divided'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, coarsely chopped, divided'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bay leaf'}, {'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cherry tomatoes'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(2 inch)', 'Name': 'whole serrano chile peppers (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chopped cilantro'}]
directions: ['Wash lentils in a strainer. Combine lentils and water in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add 1/2 of the sliced onions and garlic, reserving the rest for later. Stir in turmeric, bay leaf, tomatoes, and salt. Add chiles, leaving them whole to add flavor or cut in half to add heat. When mixture begins to boil, reduce heat to a simmer; cook until lentils break apart and thicken slightly, about 20 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, in a skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat until oil shimmers. Add reserved sliced onions; cook and stir until onion has softened and translucent, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low; continue cooking and stirring until onion is very tender and dark brown, 15 to 20 minutes more. Stir in reserved garlic and cook, stirring constantly, until garlic is fragrant and tender, about 2 minutes.', 'Add onion-garlic mixture into cooked lentils and stir. Garnish with chopped cilantro.']

title: Turkish Red Lentil 'Bride' Soup Recipe

directions: ['Melt butter in a large saucepan over low heat. title: Indonesian Chicken Skewers with Peanut Sauce (Satay Ayam) Recipe

ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'chicken thighs, cut into 1/2-inch pieces'}, {'Quantity': '¾', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'ground white pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'sunflower seed oil'}, {'Quantity': '24', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'wooden skewers'}]
directions: ['Combine chicken thighs, 3/4 teaspoon salt, white pepper, and sunflower seed oil in a bowl. title: Authentic Lebanese Fattoush Recipe

Toss with dressing and serve with toasted pita.']

title: Halal Cart Chicken and Rice Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '4 hrs 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'light olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'lemon juice'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'coarsely chopped garlic'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'chopped fresh oregano'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'boneless chicken thighs, trimmed of excess fat'}]
directions: ['Make chicken: Combine olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, and coriander in a blender. Blend until marinade is smooth; season with salt and pepper. Place chicken thighs in a resealable plastic bag; pour in marinade and seal the bag. Refrigerate for 3 to 4 hours.', 'Make yogurt sauce: Whisk together yogurt, sriracha sauce, and garlic in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Refrigerate for 1 hour.', 'Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Remove chicken from marinade and pat dry with paper towels; discard excess marinade. Cook skin-side down in the hot skillet until well browned, 4 to 5 minutes. Flip and cook until no longer pink in the center, 4 to 5 minutes more. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Remove chicken to a plate to rest for 5 to 10 minutes, then chop into chunks.', 'Make rice: Melt butter in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add turmeric and cumin; cook and stir until fragrant. Add rice and stir to coat. Cook, stirring frequently, until toasted, about 4 minutes. Pour in chicken broth and season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil; reduce heat, cover, and cook until broth is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Remove the pot from heat and let stand, covered, for 15 minutes.', 'Divide rice and chicken among serving bowls. Drizzle yogurt sauce on top.']

title: Shakshuka (Middle Eastern Baked Eggs) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'fresh tomatoes, coarsely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'minced garlic'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'pita bread rounds'}]
directions: ['Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chopped tomatoes and garlic, stirring occasionally, until liquid has cooked out of tomatoes. Carefully break eggs over tomatoes without breaking yolks. Lightly season with salt, reduce heat and cover.', 'Simmer covered for 20 minutes, or until yolks are fully cooked. Adjust seasoning with salt as needed. Serve with pita bread.']

title: Egyptian Bamia Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'boneless lamb shoulder, cut into 1-inch pieces'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water, or as needed to cover'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(8 ounce) can', 'Name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(10 ounce) package', 'Name': 'frozen okra, thawed'}]
directions: ['Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir onion in hot oil until translucent, about 7 minutes. Mix in lamb, salt, and black pepper; cook and stir until lamb is lightly browned, 5 to 10 more minutes.', 'Stir in water and tomato sauce; season with salt and black pepper. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. Simmer lamb in sauce until very tender, at least 1 hour, adding more water as needed. Stir occasionally.', 'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Stir okra into lamb mixture, adding more water if necessary, and bring to a boil. Spoon bamia into a 2-quart baking dish and adjust salt and black pepper; cover the dish with aluminum foil.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until okra is tender, about 45 minutes; uncover for last 10 minutes of baking.']

title: Balah el Sham (Egyptian Choux Pastry) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '40'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water, divided'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white sugar, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lime, juiced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'vanilla extract, divided'}, {'Quantity': '2 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'corn oil'}]
directions: ['Combine 1 cup water and 1 cup sugar in a medium saucepan over high heat. Bring to a boil; stir until sugar dissolves. Reduce heat to medium; add lime juice. Simmer until flavors combine, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in 1 teaspoon vanilla; let syrup cool.', 'Stir together vegetable oil, remaining 2 cups water, remaining 1 cup sugar, and salt in a large pot over medium-high heat; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium. Add flour all at once; stir vigorously with a wooden spoon until batter forms into a ball. Cook until batter is shiny, about 1 minute. Transfer to a large bowl and cool for about 5 minutes.', 'Flatten batter into the bottom of the bowl. Add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in remaining 1 teaspoon vanilla; mix until batter is creamy. Pour into a cloth piping bag fitted with a large star tip.', 'Heat corn oil in a deep saucepan over medium heat until bubbly; reduce heat to medium-low. Squeeze 2 inches of batter onto an oiled spatula and lower into hot oil; repeat until the saucepan is full. Cook, turning occasionally, until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Transfer pastries to a paper bag to drain, about 30 seconds.', 'Soak hot pastries in syrup; transfer to a plate to cool, about 5 minutes.']

title: Stuffed Dates Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '36'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '36 pieces'}]

title: Duck Fesenjan Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs 40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs 50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'duck legs'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'diced yellow onion'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '⅛', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chicken broth, or more as needed'}, {'Quantity': '⅔', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'pomegranate molasses'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'honey'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'walnut halves'}]
directions: ['Season duck legs all over with salt and pepper.', 'Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over high heat. Place duck legs, skin-side down, in hot oil and cook until browned, 2 to 5 minutes. Turn and cook until browned on the other side, 2 to 4 minutes. Transfer legs to a plate; pour rendered duck fat into a bowl.', 'Pour water into the skillet and bring to a boil while scraping the browned bits of food off of the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon. Remove from the heat.', 'Place about 2 tablespoons duck fat into a Dutch oven; add olive oil and heat over medium heat until hot. Add onion and sauté until golden brown, 7 to 10 minutes. Add turmeric, cinnamon, and nutmeg; cook and stir until fragrant, 1 minute.', 'Pour chicken broth, pomegranate molasses, honey, and reserved water mixture from the skillet into the Dutch oven; bring to a simmer.', 'Meanwhile, grind walnuts to a fine powder in a food processor.', 'Cook and stir ground walnuts in a dry skillet over medium heat until fragrant, 2 to 3 minutes; stir into broth mixture.', 'Place duck legs into broth and press gently to submerge. Reduce the heat and simmer until duck legs are no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, 3 to 4 hours. An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).', 'Bring broth to a boil; cook until reduced and desired sauce consistency is reached. Season with salt. Ladle sauce over duck legs to serve.']

title: Dukkah Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '24'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 1/2 cups'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '⅔', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'hazelnuts'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sesame seeds'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'coriander seeds'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'cumin seeds'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'flaked sea salt'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Place hazelnuts on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven until fragrant, about 5 minutes. Pour hot nuts onto a tea towel. Fold the towel over them to cover and rub vigorously to remove the skins. Set aside to cool.', 'Toast sesame seeds in a dry skillet over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until light golden brown. Transfer to a medium bowl and set aside.', 'Toast coriander and cumin seeds in the same skillet, shaking or stirring occasionally, until they begin to pop. Transfer to a food processor and process until finely ground. Add to sesame seeds in the bowl. Place cooled hazelnuts into the food processor and process until finely ground. Stir into sesame seed mixture. Add pepper and salt; mix well.']

title: Indonesian Spiced Rice Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'jalapeno peppers, seeded and minced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'uncooked long-grain white rice'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(14.5 ounce) cans', 'Name': 'chicken broth'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bay leaf'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onions, chopped'}]
directions: ['Heat oil in a large, heavy pan over medium heat. Stir in onion, jalapeños, and garlic. Sauté until onion is translucent; about 6 to 8 minutes.', 'Stir in turmeric and cinnamon. Add rice; cook and stir for 2 minutes. Mix in chicken broth, water, and bay leaf; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 20 minutes.', 'Turn off the heat and let sit for 5 minutes. Garnish with chopped green onion.']

title: Muhammara (Roasted Pepper & Walnut Spread) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1 ¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'raw walnut halves'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'fresh bread crumbs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'fire-roasted red bell peppers - peeled, seeded, coarsely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'garlic cloves, crushed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'lemon juice'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'pomegranate molasses'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt, plus more if needed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'paprika'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'Aleppo pepper flakes or other red pepper flakes, plus a pinch or so for garnish'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cumin'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'chopped Italian parsley for garnish'}]
directions: ['Heat a skillet over medium heat. Add walnuts and drizzle with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Cook and stir frequently until walnuts smell toasted and are lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and transfer walnuts to a plate to cool. Reserve 2 or 3 to coarsely chop and use for garnish.', 'Place the skillet over medium heat; add 1 tablespoon olive oil. Sprinkle in bread crumbs; cook and stir frequently until crumbs turn golden brown, 3 or 4 minutes. Remove from heat and sprinkle onto plate with walnuts.', 'Place peppers in bowl of a food processor. Add walnuts, toasted bread crumbs, garlic, lemon juice, pomegranate molasses, salt, paprika, Aleppo pepper flakes, cumin, and cayenne pepper. Drizzle with remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil.', 'Pulse on and off, scraping mixture down occasionally, until mixture is fairly fine and smooth. Transfer to a bowl; cover and refrigerate until chilled, about 2 hours.', 'Transfer to a shallow serving bowl. Use the back of a spoon to swirl indentations on the surface to capture the garnishes. Garnish with reserved chopped walnuts, a drizzle of olive oil, pepper flakes, and chopped parsley.']

title: Algerian Kefta (Meatballs) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '3'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '12 patties'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'lean ground beef'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced, divided'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely chopped onion, divided'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'roma (plum) tomatoes, diced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'dried parsley'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ras el hanout (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}]
directions: ['Combine ground beef with 1/2 of the minced garlic and 1 tablespoon chopped onion in a large bowl. Mix with your hands until fully incorporated. Shape meat mixture into 1 1/2-inch oblong patties; you should have 12 to 14 meatballs.', 'Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Brown patties in batches in the hot skillet until crispy on both sides and no longer pink in the center, about 10 minutes. Set meatballs aside in a rimmed serving dish.', 'Reduce heat to medium and stir remaining chopped onion into drippings in the skillet. Season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring constantly, until onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in remaining garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Stir in Roma tomatoes, dried parsley, and ras el hanout. Pour in water. Cook until tomatoes are soft, about 5 minutes.', 'Pour tomato sauce over meatballs to serve.']

title: Little Lamb Meatballs in a Spicy Eggplant Tomato Sauce Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggplant, cubed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely minced onion'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'crushed red pepper flakes, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chicken broth'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'marinara sauce'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'plain dry bread crumbs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'large egg'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'Greek yogurt'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely minced onion'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, finely minced'}, {'Quantity': '1 ½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'ground lamb'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'chopped fresh mint'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat.', 'Combine eggplant, olive oil, salt, and black pepper in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in broth and marinara sauce. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until sauce mixture has reduced by half, about 30 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, whisk together bread crumbs, egg, and Greek yogurt in a large bowl until bread crumbs absorb all the liquid, about 3 minutes. Mix in 1/4 cup onion, garlic, kosher salt, black pepper, cumin, cinnamon, and coriander until well combined. Crumble in lamb and sprinkle with cayenne pepper; mix well.', 'Form lamb mixture into small meatballs and transfer to the prepared baking sheet.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until browned but still pink inside, about 10 minutes.', 'Remove meatballs from the oven and stir into simmering sauce. Simmer over low heat until sauce begins to thicken and meatballs are cooked through, 30 to 45 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a meatball should read 160 degrees F (72 degrees C).', 'Garnish meatballs and sauce with mint to serve.']

title: Russian Tea Cakes Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '36'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '3 dozen cookies'}]

title: Beef Stroganoff Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'beef chuck roast'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onions, sliced (white parts only)'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(10.5 ounce) can', 'Name': 'condensed beef broth'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'prepared mustard'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(6 ounce) can', 'Name': 'sliced mushrooms, drained'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sour cream'}, {'Quantity': '⅓', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white wine'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}]
